Short Summary

My name is Sherab Dorji. I am a United World College alumnus studying Environmental Science and Economics at Brown University as an Engaged Scholar with a focus on sustainable rural development.

In May 2017, after receiving the Social Innovation Fellowship, I decided to take a full year’s leave from college to work with local farmers in Phobjikha  - a beautifully rugged valley in central Bhutan where I was born, raised and schooled. Most of the 850 odd households in the valley own less than 3 acres of land which means that earning a decent livelihood is very difficult. This is a typical story for the majority of Bhutan's rural farmers. 

 

Since June 2017, I have worked with the farmers, the local government and district livestock officials in Phobjikha Valley to form Khemdro Dairy Group (KDG). KDG is a farmer-centric value chain for dairy products that works with local women to increase families’ monthly incomes by more than 100%. It seeks to  economically empower women because for generations, they have been running the dairying end of their farms with little to no financial power in the family.

KDG will share a part of its profit with the member farmers, and use the other part to support member farmers to buy better dairy breeds,  and invest in improved dairy implements.

 

 

I am now trying to raise USD 50,000 to finally bring Khemdro Dairy Group to life. KDG’s milk processing unit, built with financial help from the government, will finish construction by April 2018. However, we can only start operations when we have actually linked the farmers to the processing unit, and the processing unit to the market.

 

What your money can do for us

[Note: Excluding the Indiegogo fee, we are reserving 4% of the funds to covers costs for procuring, shipping and installing the equipment.]

With the money we raise through this campaign, we will buy basic facilities that will allow us to finally be in operation, namely:
• A milk van to collect and transport milk from member farmers
• Back-up solar installation to run processing and storage equipment in case of grid failure, which happens often in Phobjikha, especially in the rainy seasons.

Our context-specific funding needs allow us to make the best use of the amount raised even if we cannot reach our goal of raising USD 50,000. 

 

Paying you back

As a value chain for dairy product that is based in remote Bhutan, KDG will not be able to offer our fresh dairy products to backers abroad in return for investing in us. Fortunately, KDG has a complete set of rewards in store designed to recognize and appreciate your support for us! These rewards have been designed with an additional purpose in mind: supporting local businesses and craftspeople! 

To discover what these are, please check out our Perks section! 

 

Impact from your Support

By backing Khemdro Dairy Group through this campaign, you are helping 41 current members double their income, 70% of whom are women. KDG’s strategic goal is to reach 850+ farming families in Phobjikha valley by 2025 to create the same impact for these smallholder farmers. The great thing is that the same equipment we buy with your money can create the same level of impact for all these families in the valley!
column4:
>Dairying in Phobjikha: Glimpses into the lives of women who power it

In addition, by equipping KDG, you are helping us succeed and realize a much needed solution for our smallholder rural farmers. This will, in turn, bring further support and resources from other stakeholders in the future.

 

Challenges and Strengths

Khemdro Dairy Group faces challenges that it has, and will, address by leveraging strategic partnerships with public and private stakeholders.

One challenge is marketing our products in Thimphu, Bhutan’s capital city. As a small farmers' group, we do not have the resources to invest in our own sales counters. To circumvent this issue, we will directly supply our products to major buyers such as hotels, restaurants and schools. In addition, we have formed partnership with Youth Business Cooperative – a youth-run marketing cooperative with sales counters all over the city, to market our products to end consumers. 

The other challenge we face as a cooperative dairyhouse is the significant decrease in milk supply in winter due to shortage of nutritive feeds. KDG has formed a strong partnership with the Livestock Department to address this though our Comprehensive Cattle Feeds Improvement Program. This program will provide free fodder seeds, as well as training and implements to prepare and store nutritious cattle feed at home with financial and technical support from the livestock department. In addition, KDG will use part of its profit to financially support farmers buy better cattle. Thus, we seek to stabilize milk production by combining herd improvement and feed improvement. 

 

Other ways you can help

Please share our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and acquaintances! We will be grateful for any reach you help us create.

If you think the KDG idea has potential to scale and create impact beyond the scope of this project, and know any awesome individual who can offer resources, please help us get in touch! Drop us a short email at info@khemdrodairy.org.
column6: >I want to thank the people who have helped me put this campaign together. Sonam Pelden of Minergy has been a great help.  So has Mr Kencho Wangdi at MediaMax who has kindly provided audiovisual support right from the beginning, as well Pema at Wangyal Studio. And of course, I thank the most amazing people - the farmers of KDG. Huge shoutout to you all
column7:
this would not have been possible without any of you!

column1: Hello there, my partner and I would like to open a small coffee shop that apart from delicious coffee will also have on offer our own homemade cupcakes playing with colours and shapes. We want to ROCK THE WORLD OF GREEKS!!!!!!
We will be using the highest quality coffee because let's be honest, Greek people just can't live without their morning coffee!!!!!!

Another idea which we believe to be quite original is to prepare our cupcakes in front of our customers as they order them.......There will be a large selection of toppings and flavours to choose from.
Peanut butter, Cheesecake, Cookies and Cream marshmallow cupcakes will be some of our GUEST STARS!!!!!!!!
which we hope will give our clients a feeling of home from home!
SO DONT FORGS​ET US, DONATE, HELP, LOVE US, and if you come to Greece don't forget to pass by and grab a cupcake
So just to be specific we need money first and foremost to get our idea off the ground. We are working on around 14000$ for the space, supplies and equipment needed.

IIf any donations collected do not reach our target or anywhere near it, then some money will go to our cause and the most of them will go to nominated dog shelters. We are animal lovers and know that any money would be used carefully to find homes for stray animals, vaccines and of course for FOOD.
Of course the same would apply if we collect more money than needed. Any overspill of funds would again be donated to dog shelters.

It is a very risky project considering the economy here in Greece but we still hope that something so new and fresh together with love and faith that we have for our new and exciting venture,can be and will be successful !!!!!!
AND EXCELLENT CUPCAKES LIKE YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN OR TASTED BEFORE WILL STAR IN OUR SHOP.....
We don't expect people to help us for nothing, so we've got some fantastic perks in return for helping us out.
You can choose between discount tickets, logo mugs, tshirts, be a big invester or even help a stray dog ( cause our plan is to help ourselves so we can help animals too).
We strongly believe because our idea is kind of new for Greece we are gonna have a huge audience and impact.We offer a different view of producing cupcakes and also an excellent coffee.In short :
1)Quality of our coffee and different blends will gather more people
2)Innovation of our project make them believe in us
3) Our passion and love for making new things and experimentation it will dazzle you

The obstacles we have to deal with is in starter the money of course so our dream will die if we dont succeed and also to choose the right place.We 'd love to have a  little shop near the market of Ilioupoli in Athens in order to have more clients every day that pass by.

Εvery help of you guys is really important to us so if you cant contribute by dontation its always enough to share to your friends the link of our campaign   https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/897e3957
Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page!
Spread the world about it ! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.
And dont forget to sends us all your good vibes and energy so our dream finally come true!!!!!

Help Provide the Tools to End Gender Based Violence

MSilver Consulting's Principal, Moriah Silver, has over a decade of experience working to end domestic and sexual violence. Her career includes working with local rape crisis centers, prosecutors, state agencies, legal services organizations, the U.S. Department of Justice, and the White House. Ms. Silver's life's work has been dedicated to eradicating domestic and sexual violence. She envisions a world where gender based violence is not tolerated and where everyone works to ensure the wellbeing and safety of all members of our society.

To this end, MSilver Consulting was formed. MSilver Consulting is a consulting agency that provides support to the numerous entities in our communities that are looking to address domestic and sexual violence and prevent the conditions that allow it to continue.

With the staggering prevalence of domestic and sexual violence in homes, schools, workplaces, government agencies, the impact you can make by contributing to MSilver Consulting is enormous. Much of MSilver Consulting's work addresses domestic and sexual violence through structural changes that will improve the lives of numerous men, women, and children.
So what's the scope of the problem?
• Every day 3 women die in the US at the hands of an intimate partner.
• More than 70% of United States workplaces do not have a formal program or policy that addresses workplace violence.
• Nearly 33% of women killed in U.S. workplaces between 2003-2008 were killed by a current or former intimate partner.
• On average, 24 people per minute are victims of rape, physical violence or stalking by an intimate partner in the United States — more than 12 million women and men over the course of a year
• 52% of college women report knowing a friend who has experienced violent and abusive dating behaviors including physical, sexual, tech, verbal or controlling abuse.
<li>72% of all murder-suicides involve an intimate partner
column2: 94% of the victims of these murder suicides are female

column1: This Needs to Stop and We Are Ready to Stop It
MSilver Consulting is prepared to support all sectors of our society in addressing domestic and sexual violence.
• Special Projects Related to Domestic and Sexual Violence
• We are looking to raise $5,000 for marketing, communications, community engagement, and office start up costs.
• These funds go directly to support MSilver Consulting's work by telling the wold that we are here and we are ready to help you address domestic and sexual violence!
• You will be supporting a ground breaking effort to tackle gender based violence through much needed consulting services.

Well, we’re not just cheesemakers and brewers anymore! Now, we are also farmers!

Over the past twelve months we have built our new dairy farm… literally from the ground up!! This farm is everything that I dreamed it would be – a showcase of sustainable small-scale dairy farming that is all about animal welfare and milk quality. Because our farm is not part of the industrial dairy industry, we have the freedom to do things differently. Our herd is small and is made up of old breed cows that are no longer commercially viable. Our calves are all raised, not killed at birth. And we are organic.

Since September last year, we have been making all of our cheese from our own milk that comes from our happy herd of organically raised, heritage breed cows… and our cheese has never tasted better! I could not be more proud of what we have achieved in the last year… or more excited about our future.

In order to make enough cheese for you all in the next year or so, we need to increase our herd from just over 50 cows to 80 milking cows. So, together, we need to buy another 30 Normande and Australian Dairy Shorthorns cows.

That’s where you come in!

If you missed out the chance to sponsor one of beautiful cows last year, you now have the opportunity again.

SPONSOR ONE OF OUR BEAUTIFUL OLD BREED COWS:

Sponsoring a Cow will earn you some great rewards … not only do you get to name your girl and receive a professionally taken portrait of her, we will also send a whole year’s supply of cheese.  That’s every Cheese Club Offer for the year. You will also receive a signed copy of my book, Milk.Made, and you will become an important member of our Farm Family and receive regular updates and invitations to special events on the farm and around Australia.

If doing this as an individual is not possible, how about getting a few families together, or even your workplace? That way you can also all share in the bounty of cheese that will come your way every month.

So come on! Get involved in this really special farm and sponsor one of our gorgeous old breed dairy cows and help us to create the best dairy farm in Australia.

The Cows

The breeds we have selected to use are Brown Swiss and Australian Dairy Shorthorn. These are breeds that are considered commercially unviable these days but were once both prized for producing excellent quality milk for cheesemaking. In the past 6 months since we started milking, the decision to go for older breeds has paid off. Although the quantity of milk our cows give is less than half that would be expected from an industrial dairy, the quality has been outstanding and the character of the cheese we have made is next level.

The Farm

The Huon Valley was once a vibrant dairy region and was once home to dozens of small dairies. Sadly, today, they are all gone – unable to compete against the huge low-cost dairy farms that are now the standard in Australia. This dairy farm (the first to open in the Huon Valley in over half a century) will prove that small-scale, quality dairy farming can be viable in this country. It is 90 acres on the banks of the beautiful Huon River. We also lease an additional 100 acres on the opposite side of the river where we grow grass and (will soon start to) make organic compost. The farm has been in the same family since European settlement until we acquired it at the start of last year.

Why is this farm important?

It is widely agreed that the dairy industry has some major issues. Farmers are now at the mercy of global markets and pricing. Dairy farms are getting bigger and bigger and now resemble milk factories more than farms. In order to stay afloat in this environment, farmers are forced to apply more and more pressure to their animals, their land and also themselves. Some struggle to stay afloat and are forced to leave the industry.

Our farm is different. Because it operates outside of the regular dairy industry, we have the ability to make some choices about how it is run that more conventional farmers are not able to make. These choices effect every aspect of the farm. Our farm is also small – one of the smallest commercial dairy farms in Australia. And it’s certified organic. We use old breeds that are no longer considered viable but were once prized for the quality of their milk. We put animal welfare ahead of profitability and sustainability ahead of efficiency. We are committed to raising our calves, not slaughtering them as is the common industry practice with bobby calves. The breeds we have chosen are excellent dual-purpose breeds and will be raised on the property for rose veal and beef, which will then be offered back to our customers to purchase.

A bit about Bruny Island Cheese Co.

Since 2003, Bruny Island Cheese Co has pushed the boundaries and helped raise the standard for artisan cheese in Australia. When I first started the business, I was told that I had a choice: I could make a difference, or I could be successful. Well, I reckon we have done both. We were the first producer of unpasteurised milk cheese, despite being told it would never happen, and we reinvented the way cheese is sold in Australia through our Cheese Club. We are now an award winning successful small business, located on an island off the south coast of Tasmania, and every day we try and make a difference to the way cheese is made, sold and eaten in Australia.

Now we want to set a new standard in dairy farming. And we want you to be a part of it.

Being a supported of our farm means you will be supporting positive change in the dairy industry and being part of a viable, sustainable alternative.  All of our supporters become a member of our ‘Farm Family’ community and not only receive some great rewards for your support but also regular updates from the farm and opportunities to get involved in it.

Who are we?

We are a team of passionate, determined, innovative people. Here are some of the key people that are key to the business:

Nick Haddow: Managing Director the founder of the business. Nick has two decades of experience in the dairy industry in Australia and overseas. He is also the author of Milk.Made. – his new book on cheese.

Richard Butler: Farm Manager. Along with his wife Karen, Richard looks after the farm at Glen Huon Dairy – and we are very lucky to have them on the team. Richard is a specialist in organic dairying and moved from Devon, England to be a part of this project.

Luke Jackson: Production Manager. Luke is our amazing head cheesemaker. Luke discovered his passion for cheese making while working in the mining industry in WA where good cheese was hard to come by…. So he started making his own. Luke joined our team after returning to his home state and his skills as a cheesemaker have gone from strength to strength.

Tori Keygan: General Manager. Tori runs the whole show but also looks after all our amazing customers and Cheese Club community and makes sure that they are not only getting great cheese but also are connected to what’s happening at Bruny Island Cheese Co.

YOU!: You care about where your food comes from and how it was produced. And you love great cheese!

If you can’t help financially, there’s other ways to help.

If sponsoring a cow is a bit of a stretch for you, no worries, we get it. But if you still think that this project is important help us by spreading the word and make some noise about what we are trying to do. Let your networks know by using the Indiegogo sharing tools because chances are someone you know will also think this is a great project to support!

I really appreciate any help you can give us.

Thanks!

Nick
column2:

And we are organic.Since September last year, we have been making all of our cheese from our own milk that comes from our happy herd of organically raised, heritage breed cows… and our cheese has never tasted better! I could not be more proud of what we have achieved in the last year… or more excited about our future.In order to make enough cheese for you all in the next year or so, we need to increase our herd from just over 50 cows to 80 milking cows. So, together, we need to buy another 30 Normande and Australian Dairy Shorthorns cows.That’s where you come in!If you missed out the chance to sponsor one of beautiful cows last year, you now have the opportunity again.SPONSOR ONE OF OUR BEAUTIFUL OLD BREED COWS:Sponsoring a Cow will earn you some great rewards … not only do you get to name your girl and receive a professionally taken portrait of her, we will also send a whole year’s supply of cheese.  That’s every Cheese Club Offer for the year. You will also receive a signed copy of my book, Milk.Made, and you will become an important member of our Farm Family and receive regular updates and invitations to special events on the farm and around Australia.If doing this as an individual is not possible, how about getting a few families together, or even your workplace? That way you can also all share in the bounty of cheese that will come your way every month.So come on! Get involved in this really special farm and sponsor one of our gorgeous old breed dairy cows and help us to create the best dairy farm in Australia.The CowsThe breeds we have selected to use are Brown Swiss and Australian Dairy Shorthorn. These are breeds that are considered commercially unviable these days but were once both prized for producing excellent quality milk for cheesemaking. In the past 6 months since we started milking, the decision to go for older breeds has paid off. Although the quantity of milk our cows give is less than half that would be expected from an industrial dairy, the quality has been outstanding and the character of the cheese we have made is next level.The FarmThe Huon Valley was once a vibrant dairy region and was once home to dozens of small dairies. Sadly, today, they are all gone – unable to compete against the huge low-cost dairy farms that are now the standard in Australia. This dairy farm (the first to open in the Huon Valley in over half a century) will prove that small-scale, quality dairy farming can be viable in this country. It is 90 acres on the banks of the beautiful Huon River. We also lease an additional 100 acres on the opposite side of the river where we grow grass and (will soon start to) make organic compost. The farm has been in the same family since European settlement until we acquired it at the start of last year.Why is this farm important?It is widely agreed that the dairy industry has some major issues. Farmers are now at the mercy of global markets and pricing. Dairy farms are getting bigger and bigger and now resemble milk factories more than farms. In order to stay afloat in this environment, farmers are forced to apply more and more pressure to their animals, their land and also themselves. Some struggle to stay afloat and are forced to leave the industry.Our farm is different. Because it operates outside of the regular dairy industry, we have the ability to make some choices about how it is run that more conventional farmers are not able to make. These choices effect every aspect of the farm. Our farm is also small – one of the smallest commercial dairy farms in Australia. And it’s certified organic. We use old breeds that are no longer considered viable but were once prized for the quality of their milk. We put animal welfare ahead of profitability and sustainability ahead of efficiency. We are committed to raising our calves, not slaughtering them as is the common industry practice with bobby calves. The breeds we have chosen are excellent dual-purpose breeds and will be raised on the property for rose veal and beef, which will then be offered back to our customers to purchase.A bit about Bruny Island Cheese Co.Since 2003, Bruny Island Cheese Co has pushed the boundaries and helped raise the standard for artisan cheese in Australia. When I first started the business, I was told that I had a choice: I could make a difference, or I could be successful. Well, I reckon we have done both. We were the first producer of unpasteurised milk cheese, despite being told it would never happen, and we reinvented the way cheese is sold in Australia through our Cheese Club. We are now an award winning successful small business, located on an island off the south coast of Tasmania, and every day we try and make a difference to the way cheese is made, sold and eaten in Australia.Now we want to set a new standard in dairy farming. And we want you to be a part of it.Being a supported of our farm means you will be supporting positive change in the dairy industry and being part of a viable, sustainable alternative.  All of our supporters become a member of our ‘Farm Family’ community and not only receive some great rewards for your support but also regular updates from the farm and opportunities to get involved in it.Who are we?We are a team of passionate, determined, innovative people. Here are some of the key people that are key to the business:Nick Haddow: Managing Director the founder of the business. Nick has two decades of experience in the dairy industry in Australia and overseas. He is also the author of Milk.Made. – his new book on cheese.Richard Butler: Farm Manager. Along with his wife Karen, Richard looks after the farm at Glen Huon Dairy – and we are very lucky to have them on the team. Richard is a specialist in organic dairying and moved from Devon, England to be a part of this project.Luke Jackson: Production Manager. Luke is our amazing head cheesemaker. Luke discovered his passion for cheese making while working in the mining industry in WA where good cheese was hard to come by…. So he started making his own. Luke joined our team after returning to his home state and his skills as a cheesemaker have gone from strength to strength.Tori Keygan: General Manager. Tori runs the whole show but also looks after all our amazing customers and Cheese Club community and makes sure that they are not only getting great cheese but also are connected to what’s happening at Bruny Island Cheese Co.YOU!: You care about where your food comes from and how it was produced. And you love great cheese!If you can’t help financially, there’s other ways to help.If sponsoring a cow is a bit of a stretch for you, no worries, we get it. But if you still think that this project is important help us by spreading the word and make some noise about what we are trying to do. Let your networks know by using the Indiegogo sharing tools because chances are someone you know will also think this is a great project to support!I really appreciate any help you can give us.Thanks!Nick",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Hi, I'm Ninja Mike

""It started way back in 2009, at the Clark Fork Farmers Market, Trying to Make a Dime.""

That's right!  Fast forward 10 years and we have an amazing opportunity to grow from a farmers market stand to a full on storefront!   Dedicated to intentional food resourcing and relationships with local farmers, bakers, ranchers, and food suppliers, Ninja Mike’s menu items have always been so fresh and so clean!

Since we started, we have had limited and seasonal access to commercial kitchens, inhibiting us from growing and adequately meeting the needs of hungry Missoulians.  

WELL THAT ALL CAN BE CHANGING!  We currently have the opportunity to open a  fast service breakfast joint in downtown Missoula.  Serving locally roasted coffee and local breakfast options that include burritos, tacos, sandwiches, potato skillets,  and more, we plan on not only bringing local deliciousness to downtown, but also a vibrancy to a storefront that has been vacant since 2014.

Featuring online ordering, made-to-order options, and a ‘grab and go’ service we aspire to provide a fast morning food option that feels good and supports our local economy.  

 

The Funding

Like any business venture, initial capital is necessary to cover start up costs.  We have been able to receive partial funding, but remain short of our final goal.  To bridge the gap, we are looking for help from community members to allow us to purchase the following commercial kitchen equipment:

Coolers, freezers, 5' griddle, convection oven, countertop 4-burner, alto shaam holding cabinet, commercial food processor, Hobart mixer, coffee maker, hot cases, prep and hand sinks, stainless steel prep tables, storage containers, stainless steel shelving, and cooking utensils.

Operationally, we need the funding for POS systems, website development for online ordering, menu boards, storefront signage, permitting and licensing, and other surprise costs that are associated with stating a new business.

Our goal is to raise $30,000 to cover all these expenses.  We are offering amazing perks for your generosity including local food and coffee, Ninja Mike's wear, salsa dance lessons, youth cooking class, personalized raps composed by Ninja Mike, and a DJ for your next private party!

We understand that you may not be in the position to financially help us out, but don't worry!  You can still be supportive by sharing our campaign on social media or word of mouth, and directing people to this exciting endeavor that is poised for the betterment of our community.

Rebuilt in 1899 after a great fire, The Black Monarch's got beautiful bones and a phoenix-like story.  In modern times, The Black Monarch Hotel and Venue is featured in the Daily Mail, Lonely Planet, Refinery29, Inked and Travel + Leisure, looming as the haunting backdrop for countless indie films, photo shoots and music videos (as shown in the
column2: feature=youtu.be"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Nigel Dick-directed Brooks Forsythe video filmed here). If these walls could talk, they’d whisper the town’s deep lore of hauntings, a Wild West history of barkeep gun fights, and even a connection to Nicola Tesla.

column1: This former casino, brothel and saloon from the Gold Rush heydey is said to be haunted by the ghost of a miner who died in a gunfight. Guests have reported waking in the night to the sounds of women laughing and men shouting, only to find the next day they were the only people staying in building.

We’re working closely with the town of Victor to renovate this historic property into a boutique hotel, venue, restaurant and bar while preserving and respecting its rich history. We're also having a bit of fun with it: we've themed rooms after Nicola Tesla, who was said to have a history in the area, as well as serial killers H.H. Holmes and Elizabeth Bathory. Here's our design vision:
• Darkly-themed rooms after witches and serial killers
• Hosting a dark niche of compelling musical acts that pay homage to the Colorado sound

In a world of new construction developments and red tape, a property with such unspoiled history is a once-in-a-lifetime find. Not to mention that it's located in a scenic and welcoming town as Victor, who is removing red tape in countless ways to welcome community revitalization. Donate now to breathe new life into The Black Monarch. We're raising $40,000 in 30 days to fund just a portion of the renovations of hotel rooms, bar, a restaurant and venue.
The Black Monarch is more than just a hotel
column2: we're uncovering a compelling world only read about in novels and history books. Not only will your contribution bring this bewitching world to life, but it will help revitalize a mining town. The town of Victor is incentivizing young artists and entrepreneurs to start businesses in Victor.

column1: • Restore 2,000 square feet of space on ground floor into a bar
• Install an Elevator and handicap accessibility features
• Build a rooftop patio and penthouse with fire feature and hot tub
• Mechanical upgrades including energy efficient heating and cooling
• Restore 3 small affordable retail spaces for local businesses
• Revitalize 15,000 square feet of open-air plaza and live music venue backing against the building
• Throw decadent parties, like an annual Halloween ball
• Work with City of Victor to throw annual music festival in outdoor venue
• Create a secret society and community hub for Victorians and Coloradoans.

We understand that renovating this building is a large undertaking, but your support is totally risk-free. The building has already been purchased, the business is salient and we have the funds to complete the project over a long period of time. We are seeking donations to speed up the process, so we can open up the hotel from only four available rooms to more. We've gotten so much feedback from people who want to see this place finished soon!
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• Tell all of your friends about the Black Monarch Hotel and Venue! Follow us and share us on Facebook, Instagram and our website.
Book a room and review us! Your stay will help to fund opening up more rooms.
• Write about us! Contact Erin at ekbmedia@gmail.com for interviews with Adam Zimmerli or press materials.

The Hudson Valley Books for Humanity Story

Have you ever wondered what to do with your pre-loved, but still readable, books? Do you like to shop locally for gifts, games, and items for your home? Do you like to hang with friends in a place where you can talk or have a language exchange? Do you seek inspiration around social and environmental justice or community-building?

 

If you answered ""yes"" to any of those questions, then Hudson Valley Books for Humanity will be the place for you. We'll offer used books (all genres), new books (focused on women, BIPOC, and other historically underrepresented voices), books in Spanish, Hudson valley artisan products, and space to showcase local artistic and literary talent. All will be welcome in our store, located in the center of downtown Ossining.

 

Use of Funds

Opening a bookstore is a lot of work - and it's expensive? But we intend to do it right. We seek funds to help cover rent, a customer-friendly front door, air-conditioning, comfy furniture, website development, start-up inventory, and insurance. Every dollar raised through this campaign will support this community-oriented small business.

 

About Us

Amy, the owner of Hudson Valley Books for Humanity, has lived in Ossining with her husband Rob for over 20 years. They've raised two girls in the Ossining public schools and have been active in the community through their work and volunteerism.  A long-time human rights and sustainability professional (with EILEEN FISHER), Amy enjoys picking up trash on the shoreline or riding her (self-built) bamboo bike on the North County Trail. She also plays the bassoon (that funny-sounding double-reed woodwind) with the Hudson Valley Symphonic Wind Ensemble. 

 

The bottom line? Amy simply wants to help people live in harmony, celebrate their unique differences, and leave this earth a little better for future generations.

Junktiques Collective

Jamba's Junktiques was born out of dumpster-diving from the junk left by UVM students at the end of each school year.  This large pile of salvaged goods became a brick and mortar shop, first appearing as ‘The Spot’, inside the ‘Space’ inside Battery Street Jeans, then in the former Onion River Coop Building at 274 North Winooski Avenue, and finally landing in our current location at 324 North Winooski Avenue, where we have been peddling quality crap as Junktiques Collective since 2005.  Junktiques has been confined to 800-square feet of space, and we have prospered despite the spatial challenges.  The current Junktiques is a multi-use space that serves a diverse community.  Every year, we host a few events, including music and art shows, the Old North End Ramble, yard sales and auctions, and a huge birthday celebration.  We have affordably furnished many an apartment, provided props for theater and photo shoots, created opportunities for folks to trade skills for shop credit, encouraged barter and haggling, and so much more. Junktiques creates a welcoming atmosphere that makes for a unique experience each time you walk through the door. A new, and larger space would greatly expand the possibilities, opening up more avenues to community participation, neighborhood-building, and a sustainable open-space in the increasingly unaffordable and gentrified Old North End.

We have determined that the underutilized resource that would bring us our greatest profit margin is Furniture and Clothing and we have access to truckloads of affordable and vintage furniture. Now that the Salvation Army is no longer with us, a new building would serve as a much-needed thrift clothing shop in the Old North End, a showroom for quality used furniture, a furniture repair area, and a refurbish area accessible for skill sharing and for use as an artists’ workshop.  We intend for the new Junktiques to grow and change with the needs of the community it serves.  This expansion would also provide an opportunity for local artists to display and sell their creations, with most of the profits benefiting them directly.  We are excited to provide a space to serve beverages, such as coffee and teas, with seating areas throughout the shop for people to relax and commune in a safe and visually stimulating space.  The most vital role of the new space is to provide a safe and welcoming space for all people, regardless of whether they have money or affluence.  We feel that our diversity is the antidote to the encroaching gentrification in the Old North End.

We are raising 40K for renovation…with your contribution

We have already raised and borrowed $65,000 for the 20% down payment on the building but we need your help to pay for the building and repair of some necessary infrastructure (i.e., roof repair, plumbing for new bathrooms, drywall and hardwood flooring).  We have the people power, the energy, and the skills, now we need some funding.

By raising this $40,000, we are also providing the necessary confidence that Opportunities Credit Union needs to grant us the mortgage loan. 

We are so grateful for the community support and we are excited to offer you some unique and exciting perks that you will find in this fundraising campaign page, including an original sticker, Junktiques T-shirts, a mystery box, your name engraved on a placard, bus trips and personal Thank You’s from the Junktiques collective.

If we do not reach our goal, all the money raised would  be used to upgrade and repair the current Junktiques building so we can continue to fulfil our mission of serving the community of the Old North End and beyond.  

The benefits to this project are abundant:

* Junktiques will grow our employees from 2 to 8 within the first year of opening.  

* We will provide skill-sharing and building opportunities through our repair/refurbish area.  This will provide countless opportunities for neighborhood youth, refugees, and other under-served populations to build their skills and develop character.  

* We already have a successful volunteer mentor program and we intend for it to expand. 

* Artists and creators will have access to tools and space for their craft to flourish. 

* Customers and employees will get a unique space to explore and shop for affordable goods while engaging and interacting with their neighbors. 

Junktiques has been serving the Old North End for 16 years and we have the motivation and collective enthusiasm to make a community-minded multi-use space that will serve the neighborhood and beyond. 

But we can't do this without your help.  Please contribute to this campaign and share it with others.  This project will not only serve the community but it also sends a clear message to the developers and the affluent that people still want to feel the Soul in our neighborhood!  We need spaces that reflect the people they serve.  The new Junktiques will be organized and streamlined, but will still remain funky in our character and wildly unique in our expressions.  We are excited to show you what we can do! Thank you for your support!

Thank you for your support!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
We are a group of 6 from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. We are a group of friends fascinated by the game of paintball.

The ambition to be the founders of a paintball arena arose when we saw that there were  people of all ages and personalities that would love to enjoy a game of paintball here in addisababa!! It's our mission to provide these people with a paintball arena that with all the necessary equipments and accessories to quinch their thirst!!

our main aim is  to make it as safe as possible. We also hope to provide everyone a place to go to loosen up and enjoy a good game. We sincerely believe this arena will provide a good enviroment for people to let out aggression, stress,  boredom, and just have a good time.

It is also our aim to provide teens who struggle with addiction problems and depression a place to release all that negative energy and focus on the positive ones. It will be a healthy way for them to have fun and stay fit.

But the materials we need to make the arena a safe and fully equiped enviroment are not readily available in our country and are extremely expensive. Most of them have to be imported from abroad which ends up adding more price. Some of these items would be the
Air powered rifles that shoot specialized paintball pellets with pressurized canisters as a power source
Small pellets filled with paint that serve as the ammunition
A field / warehouse ( about 1000 spr meters)
Needed to refill the paintball gun's canisters

Although we have a solid plan to make this project work we face some challenges, like the fact that  most of the materials we need are not readily available in our country, the bureaucracy and other related stuffs. As a whole the environment  that we are working in is not that supportive but with your support we will get there.
We seek  your help in solving these financial problems and making this dream come true.
We are a group of 6 from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. We are a group of friends fascinated by the game of paintball.

The ambition to be the founders of a paintball arena arose when we saw that there were  people of all ages and personalities that would love to enjoy a game of paintball here in addisababa!! It's our mission to provide these people with a paintball arena that with all the necessary equipments and accessories to quinch their thirst!!

our main aim is  to make it as safe as possible. We also hope to provide everyone a place to go to loosen up and enjoy a good game. We sincerely believe this arena will provide a good enviroment for people to let out aggression, stress,  boredom, and just have a good time.

It is also our aim to provide teens who struggle with addiction problems and depression a place to release all that negative energy and focus on the positive ones. It will be a healthy way for them to have fun and stay fit.

But the materials we need to make the arena a safe and fully equiped enviroment are not readily available in our country and are extremely expensive. Most of them have to be imported from abroad which ends up adding more price. Some of these items would be the
Marker paintball rifles ( the paintball guns)
Air powered rifles that shoot specialized paintball pellets with pressurized canisters as a power source
Small pellets filled with paint that serve as the ammunition
A field / warehouse ( about 1000 spr meters)
Needed to refill the paintball gun's canisters

Although we have a solid plan to make this project work we face some challenges, like the fact that  most of the materials we need are not readily available in our country, the bureaucracy and other related stuffs. As a whole the environment  that we are working in is not that supportive but with your support we will get there.
We seek  your help in solving these financial problems and making this dream come true.

Photos by Lluvia Silva

Our Roots

Our small trailer started with a simple idea to feed the late night bar crowd. Although we didn’t start as a vegan spot, we soon realized the importance of encouraging a menu with a 100% cruelty-free menu, so that it reflected the values and vegan preference of the owners. 

A year ago we started working on a menu that had all of the elements of Mexican Street food but also making it vegan, which was something that had never been available before, here in El Paso. As we worked to turn our trailer into a vegan spot we dedicated ourselves to understanding the traditional cooking methods, recipes, and seasonings that Mexican food offers and recreated them with our own plant based twist. That is how our Seitan Milanesa Torta, one of the first vegan items on our new menu was born! Non-meat eaters and meat eaters alike were amazed at how good it was and those responses made us realize our intention was not to just make food for vegans but to make delicious food without using animal products. Period. 

 

Our Menu

Once we started making tortas we thought our next step should be gorditas, Juarez-style steak and adobada, quesadillas, nachos, burritos, flautas, etc. and that's how our current menu was born! We have also been successful in incorporating specials that let us experiment with possible new menu items by recreating other authentic Mexican dishes, such as the very popular elote and chik'n tortilla soup specials. We knew that we had something special when people who ate meat couldn’t tell the difference and fell in love with it.

With a full restaurant upgrade we will be able to offer an expanded menu that will include breakfast/brunch items, appetizers, deserts, and a kids menu. We will continue to offer new dishes  by having regular specials where we can still create new recipes and keep our menu ever-evolving. These are things we've always wanted to offer but never had enough space or resources in our small truck, that's where you come in!

 

Our Goal

We are working towards a goal of raising 25,000 dollars to move from a truck to a building. The money we raise will all go towards renovations, buying more kitchen equipment as well as all the restaurant necessities like tables, chairs, dishes, etc., hiring more staff, and all the other little expenses that go into opening up a new restaurant, basically from scratch.

Once we open our brick and mortar establishment we have a lot of new ideas for Lick It Up that we can finally put into action. Not only will we extend our hours and our menu, but we’ll also have a more comfortable setting offering families and groups a casual dining experience. Another new feature to the restaurant will be a bar offering beer and wine.

So we will like to welcome you into our fundraiser and help Lick It Up become a restaurant. We would like to hear your thoughts on this and please let us know if you have some ideas that we can do to making them real.

 

Thank You, El Paso

Millions of babies all over the world don't have access to baby pacifiers. 

Hi Backers I'm Marco, 

Two years ago I started creating  Paci the flying baby pacifier, when I had an awakening moment.

There are millions of babies in the world that don't have access to a baby pacifier. 

Even some welfare institutions don't have enough baby pacifiers for their little babies.

Babies should have their own baby pacifiers. Its an easy relaxing way to get them out of stress.

Not only does sucking on a pacifier provide comfort and security to non-verbal infants, but its use has been associated with a decreased incidence of SIDS (Sudden Infant Death Syndrome.) so you might be helping saving babies lives with your donations.

Also, when an infant becomes a toddler, a pacifier habit is always easier to stop than a thumb habit. 

With your help, we can try to provide at least one baby pacifier for every little baby out there!

You will help solve a real problem that is happening all the time everywhere in the world.

If we reach our goal we will help Ten Thousand babies! How awesome is that? 


In return, apart the personal satisfaction for helping at least one baby, we got this awesome perks for you:

column5: >5$ - One baby receives a baby pacifier and you are rewarded with a Big Baby Thank You for your help.
>10$ - Two babies receive a baby pacifier and you get a wonderful Paci wallpaper for your computer or digital device.

>25$ - Five babies receive a baby pacifier, you will get a free, no ads, awesome Paci in Space upcoming game for Android or iOS with your name in the Credits section, plus the wonderful Paci wallpaper.

>50$ - Ten babies receive baby pacifiers, you get one amazing Paci T Shirt, available in four different colours and sizes for you to choose from, plus the Paci in Space upcoming game with your name in the Credits section.
>100$ - Twenty babies receive pacifiers and you get everything. Awesome!
>500$ - One hundred babies receive pacifiers and you get it all. Plus you are an Angel. Also in the upcoming Paci in Space game.
column13: >Everyone is welcome to join us anytime anywhere so we can do good together.
column25:
>Millions of babies all over the world don't have access to baby pacifiers. 

Now, you too can be a part of the solution to this problem, and start changing the status quo.

Every baby in the world should have a baby pacifier.

Babies deliver happiness everywhere.

With your action, you are helping make babies happy too with a simple yet very important object that most of us take for granted.

The biggest challenge will be spreading the word out and get funds for the babies.

Everyone is welcome to join us and help, whatever way they wish, spreading the word is an awesome way to help, donations, our perks, media, every bit helps.

It's hard for us to talk about not reaching our goal but if we don't reach our goal we will help every baby we can with every cent we've done here, your perks are safe of course.

It's always a win for you and for the babies!

Babies will thank you when they grow up, for sure.

Let's change the world now!

Thank you for helping the babies of the world.

Remember Paci.


You can find the existing Paci game here:

Our Mission: 

Our mission is to create an exciting family-oriented theme park, developing employment opportunities for individuals with physical and/or mental challenges.

 

Our Story: 

Thank you for taking the time to visit our campaign and learn more about our endeavor. Our grass roots initiative seeks to build an automotive-themed destination with attractions beyond the imagination. 

Our team has over twenty subject matter experts who have been working together for two years to make Garage Guys a reality.

One of our key strategies is to combine the automotive industry with an entertainment setting. This strategy allows us to envision and create vast employment opportunities across many areas within Garage Guys.

How did this idea come about? It began with a spark from Anthony's son that sent us on a journey to change the world. It's amazing to look at things through a child's eyes. Please see the Spark Video for more insight:
column3:
showinfo=0"">

 

As you can tell, we are making sure Garage Guys is a family destination for all to enjoy. Please visit our website. You will be amazed at all the activities and attractions. If you:

column1:
Please join the Garage Guys team and help support our cause!

Click here to open our Website

Milestones 

Recognizing the scale and time frame of this endeavor, we have developed a strategy based on funding levels. The roadmap we have created  allows us to standardize and leverage economy of scale. Our team of industry professionals have carefully designed business strategies for each milestone. 

 

The Roar of the Crowd 

To recognize our partnership with the crowd (that’s YOU!), and the changing the landscape of commerce,  we have the privilege of naming our Formula One race track Indiegogo Raceway.

 

GG Perks - we are offering the best overall value on our perks to showcase our cause.  Thank you for helping Garage Guys to become a reality!

 

Stainless steel pocket tool: This stainless steel 16-function multi-tool fits easily in your wallet and is TSA approved. Included are screwdriver, box opener, cell-phone stand, hex wrench, earbud carrier and more, all in one compact tool!

This stainless steel 16-function multi-tool fits easily in your wallet and is TSA approved. Included are screwdriver, box opener, cell-phone stand, hex wrench, earbud carrier and more, all in one compact tool!
Stainless Steel Key Chain/Bottle-opener/Knife with LED Light
This stainless steel bottle opener features an anodized finish, swing-out super bright white LED light, 1 3/4"" knife blade, and a key chain attachment hole.
Sixteen-ounce all stainless steel travel mug/travel tumbler features double-wall thermal stainless steel insulation, chromed accent top and sipping slider lid. Fits most automobile cup holders.
This chamois-like towel is packed in a white PVC tube and is pre-moistened for convenience. It's great for cars, boats, and bodies! In fact, you will only ever need one towel!

With this case you will be prepared for any auto emergency. It comes with a police banner and a light stick to help you get the attention of passing cars. It also includes 5 bandages, 2 alcohol wipes, 2 antiseptic swabs, 3 After Bite itch erasers and a pencil. Use the mini First Aid Guide, quick facts card and accident form to get you through just about any situation.

Keep your auto interior cooler while also preventing cracks and fading of the interior with an impressive 34"" wide imprint area featuring specialized UV coating that reflects 90% of the sun's harmful rays.
This umbrella features 6 LED lights in the handle, 4 lights for use as a flashlight, and 2 red lights for emergency flashing.
Your custom brick will be used as part of the structure/foundation for all visitors to see.
Your custom brick will be used as part of the walkway for all visitors to see.
Thank you everyone that has been helping make this dream a reality!

We invite you to be part of our project of sharing Mexican food made with organic and sustainable ingredients. 


Please check out our food Gallery, it will make you hungry :)

The perks are so delicious, you can get some salsas and mole sauces ready to heat and enjoy with your favorite seasonal veggies or meat! Dinner will be ready in no time :)


tacos and salsa pairing :)

José has been cooking for more than 15 years and has built his trade through many experiences within the Bay Area community. His career began as a Prep Cook and Line Cook at Bix and Nopa, respectively. Jose, then transitioned from Nopa to it's sister restaurant Nopalito, after being asked to develop the menu and serve as the opening Chef
column2: here he received  recognition during his 4 year tenure. In addition, Jose, was the Executive Chef at Sabrosa, and is currently overseeing the kitchen at Nido in Oakland. Over the course of the last 6 years, especially, he has tested  and perfected many recipes including carnitas, pozole, mole sauces, chorizos and many more. Jose also has experience grinding nixtamal to make the best corn masa, with different textures! This is a must try!  He is constantly exploring complex regional Mexican recipes and all kinds of different salsas to continue to build upon his craft and share with the community. Several accolades include:

column1: Elizabeth,  Jose's wife, has always loved to cook, as her passion was instilled growing up. Elizabeth's style of cooking – simple, flavorful, prepared with love and shared with joy – is passed down from her Mother.  In fact, her mom always says, ""con amor sabe major”, which translates to ""it tastes better when made with love"". Elizabeth would like to honor her Mom by continuing to cook for others with passion and delight. In addition, she is a graduate of the renowned Culinary Institute of America.

column2:
>Food philosophy 

Our menu is inspired by the traditional cooking of Mexico, prepared with seasonal, local &
column3: organic produce. For us, quality, flavor, and hospitality are paramount.

column1: We are committed to making almost everything from scratch
column2: made-to-order tortillas, to toasting our own spices and formulating our own spice blends. Flour tortillas will be made with einkorn, spelt,  sprouted brown rice, quinoa flours. Our chorizos, mole sauces, salsas, hot sauce, and queso fresco are also all made fresh daily in small batches. In addition to a variety of meat dishes, we will have many vegetarian and some vegan options, most of our dishes are gluten-free. We will cook with coconut oil, olive, oil, bran rice oil, butter and sometimes lard and will incorporate more nuts and seeds in our cooking. We will use maple syrup, coconut palm sugar, honey, and piloncillo. We will also offer take-away items such as mole sauces, salsas, hot sauces, tortilla chips, guacamole, and much more!

column1: Farms/Purveryors: Happy Boy Farm, tomatero farms, rancho gordo, heirloom organic gardens, lucero farms, yerena farm, water2table, five dot ranch, masienda, giusto's, five dot ranch, St. John Family Farms, llano seco rancho, casa rosa farms, Iacopi Farms, Triple T ranch and farm, Fulton Valley, Pasture 42, Wise Acre Farm, Full Belly Farm, Brokaw Nursery, Massa Natural Meats, Spring hill  cheese, Clover Stornetta, True Grass Farms, and many more!

column2: >With YOUR  support, we will be able to purchase the following:
>We have big dreams, if we are able to raise more!  With
column6: > to make our our masa using brightly colored heirloom corn.

column1: photo courtesy of Baker Creek Heirloom Seed Company, www.rareseeds.com
Jose grinding organic corn, photo by Craig Lee, 2009
- provide our community fresh, organic, nourishing and delicious dishes, bring our taco cart to your local  farmers market!
- preserve heirloom corn as we support growers
- offer plenty of gluten-free dishes, and vegetarian dishes
- be part of our local economy system
- support local organic farmers and ranchers
- offer cooking classes for all ages but mostly youth

We understand there will be challenges along the way and how important it is to address them as they come up viewing every obstacle as a learning and development purpose, rather than a set back. With that being said this is a team effort and we will leverage each others strengths by calling upon Jose's 15 years of experience in the restaurant industry. Jose has shown his creativity by keeping the menu fresh, interesting, and introducing specials alongside the set favorites. we strongly believe that león will be a significant contributor to an already large sustainable community in the San Francisco Bay area. We also believe in the power of hospitality - making our guests feel special and taken care of is an integral part of our business.

Share our project 

Please share our beautiful project with all your friends and family!
Thanks so much for all your support, thank you for being part of our project.

column2: >And as much as we think we know and love it,  we have barely scratched the surface of what Mexican food really is. It is NOT melted cheese over a tortilla chip. It is not simple, or easy. It is not simply ‘bro food’ halftime. It is in fact, old— older even than the great cuisines of Europe and often deeply complex, refined, subtle, and sophisticated. A true mole sauce, for instance, can take DAYS to make, a balance of freshly (always fresh) ingredients, painstakingly prepared by hand. It could be, should be, one of the most exciting cuisines on the planet. If we paid attention. The old school cooks of Oaxaca make some of the more difficult to make and nuanced sauces in gastronomy. And some of the new generation, many of whom have trained in the kitchens of America and Europe have returned home to take Mexican food to new and thrilling new heights.

column1: Determination gives you the resolve to keep going in spite of the roadblocks that lay before you.
If you really want to make a friend, go to someone's house and eat with him... the people who give you their food give you their hearts.

Share our project  Please share our beautiful project with all your friends and family!
Thanks so much for all your support, thank you for being part of our project.

And as much as we think we know and love it,  we have barely scratched the surface of what Mexican food really is. It is NOT melted cheese over a tortilla chip. It is not simple, or easy. It is not simply ‘bro food’ halftime. It is in fact, old— older even than the great cuisines of Europe and often deeply complex, refined, subtle, and sophisticated. A true mole sauce, for instance, can take DAYS to make, a balance of freshly (always fresh) ingredients, painstakingly prepared by hand. It could be, should be, one of the most exciting cuisines on the planet. If we paid attention. The old school cooks of Oaxaca make some of the more difficult to make and nuanced sauces in gastronomy. And some of the new generation, many of whom have trained in the kitchens of America and Europe have returned home to take Mexican food to new and thrilling new heights.
Determination gives you the resolve to keep going in spite of the roadblocks that lay before you.
If you really want to make a friend, go to someone's house and eat with him... the people who give you their food give you their hearts.

Short Summary

SustainaBuild is a Community Benefit Organization committed to the advancement of sustainable living practices, design, and development.
We provide classes to educate the public on a wide variety of topics, including gardening, cooking, and food preservation.
SustainaBuild is currently working to build a network of

community gardens across the city of Hattiesburg, MS.

Your contributions will make it possible for us to purchase several small lots, as well as any resources that aren't donated.  Any remaining contributions will be put toward our next project: construction of a community learning center.
community gardens would help create a sustainable local food system, decreasing
dependence on non-sustainable resources and saving families money while providing a fun and educational environment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media you may use.

Other types of Donations accepted: Volunteered time, Gardening tools, Yard waste, Vehicle or use of vehicle, Land or use of land, Beekeeping.

If you have any questions or wish to make a non-monetary donation please feel free to email us: Info@SustainaBuild.org, Megan@SustainaBuild.org

Tagavent adds a new and different dimension to organizing and enjoying your social life.  We have designed a new and exciting social calendar that enables you to
create find and share all kinds of amazing events. What’s more,
having found an event, we make it easy for you to purchase tickets and invite
anyone else who you think might be interested in attending.
column2: >Each time you log on to tagavent your personal calendar will display a host of fresh events, all in one place, making it easy to stay in touch with what friends and family are doing, and to keep up to date with what’s going on in your wider social circle. Our guest list enables you to find like-minded people who share the same interests and you can easily connect with them by sending an Ice Breaker request. After the event is over you can upload your pictures for the event and also view pictures from other users who went.

>When we were considering what we could do to enhance individual lives by using social media, we found that the problem with many existing social networking sites was that they lack information about upcoming events. Instead, they simply enable you to spread the word about what you and your friends are already doing.

>We have designed Tagavent to make it as easy as possible to create new events by making your personal calendar the centre of your social world. You can use it to check out what events are being held in your area over the coming months and even to purchase tickets, courtesy of Ticketmaster and Skiddle. Tagavent will also display a list of suggested events based on the criteria you have provided, detailing which of your friends and acquaintances are attending.

column1: By accessing your calendar, you can see immediately who is going to which events. You might want to arrange a surprise birthday party for someone, for example
column2: so you have the option of restricting who can see the event to only specific family members and friends, while also blocking the guest of honour from viewing the information, which would obviously prevent the party from being a surprise.

column1: We will post “suggested” events on your calendar, based on the information you provided when joining.  You can also  see which of your friends are going to an event. You can invite people you would like to go with and see who has accepted your invitations. There is also a messaging system that makes keeping in touch a piece of cake.

Your calendar carries details of all the events your contacts are due to attend and past events they have already attended. With the facility to make comments about the event you have attended or are going to attend it makes it really easy to get a feel of how much fun your friends had.
that one of the coolest Tagavent features is the ability to upload your
favourite photos from all the events you have attended. By posting a tagged URL to
the internet, your shots of each event can be viewed by anyone else that was
there or by individuals who were unable to go but would like to see what it was

This is a great way of ensuring your pictures are seen by as many people as possible, and because all your images are stored by event together in one easy to access location you are more likely to look back at them and recall the fun that you and your friends had. You can also view photos that other people who were there have uploaded, so you can get an overview of the entire event from several different perspectives. Imagine being able to look at pictures taken by all the people who were at the same football match or festival. By doing so you can get a real taste of the atmosphere.

You don’t have to attend an event in order to view other people’s photos and comments, which is useful if you are considering going to something similar in the future. Being able to view images depicting how others enjoyed themselves is a great way of deciding whether it is something you might like to experience for yourself.

If you are thinking of taking in a concert or festival whilst holidaying abroad, having the ability to check out what previous events were like is particularly useful. Looking at the photographs uploaded by locals who attended is a great way of learning a little about the venue and the type of people you could expect to meet there.
Tagavent we believe it’s time people started to widen their circle of friends
by meeting new people with similar interests, which is precisely why we are so
excited about the icebreaker. Our icebreaker invitation enables anyone to check
out what events other like-minded people are attending and send a request to
join in the fun. This is a great way of meeting new people who you know will
have the same interests as you
column2: what’s more, you actually get to meet them

column1: rather than just communicating with them online.

At tagavent we have tried to go further than the existing social media sites by enabling our members to not only chat and share photos and comments of past events, but also meet and interact with like-minded people who share the same interests. Now if you want to plan future visits to the cinema, opera, festivals, carnivals, ballet, theatre, concerts, sports, you will always find someone who you can go with.

The Vision

So.... how did all this come about?
Tagavent was born on a Eurostar train from Paris to London about 18 months ago. I was coming home to the UK for a short break, and I was spending alot of time texting my friends trying to  arrange for everyone to meet in the same place at the same time. Some could make a certain time but some could not etc etc. It became a nightmare. I began thinking what if there was an events based social calendar website where all this could be co-ordinated? So the original idea was just a simple website where you could create an event at, say, a pub, and invite your friends. This developed when we started thinking about getting groups of people together to attend concerts, gigs etc, and even further as we realised this would be a great opportunity for strangers to meet who shared the same passions had common interests, hence the development of the ""Icebreaker"" function. The end result was tagavent.


The Launch

As one of the most vibrant and exciting cities in the world,
London is the ideal place to launch Tagavent. The combination of the rock and
pop scene, theatres, clubs and pubs, not to mention comedy venues makes it one
of the most social places on the planet. Help us take the population of London
by storm, and take their social lives to a new level! From there we will go
In today’s fast moving world more and more individuals are turning to their
mobiles for information, updates and socialising. 73% of online adults now
use a social networking site of some kind. Facebook is the dominant social
networking platform in the number of users, but a striking number of users are
now diversifying onto other platforms, which is why for the success of
tagavent we need to be mobile.
Our mobile app has already been designed and looks amazing. Now we need your
help in building the app, so everyone can enjoy tagavent.
We also need funding to kick start our visibility by launching a really
effective marketing campaign. The more people that become involved with
tagavent the more fun it will be for everyone.
In order to fund the development of the Apple and Android App, and the
marketing campaign, $100,000 is required. Development of both apps will take

What You Get Being a Contributor

Tagavent is all about socialising, getting together and meeting new people and thats exactly what we want to promote with this campaign. We think be

Facebook, Meetup and Eventbrite etc. What
we discovered is that while these websites covered some of what Tagavent do,
none of them covered everything. We also believe that Tagavent UX is superior,
and that Tagavent can generate a lot more excitement.
to the success of the business is a successful launch, with enthusiastic
founder members, with the site rapidly gaining traction. Any kind of social
site which does not have many members is not interesting. Tagavent has to grow
fast and become well known quickly.

Dip-A-Dee-Doo-Dah is a subscription based mail order lucky dip, created as a fresh and fun way to support ethical companies, while at the same time providing job opportunities for people with barriers to employment. We aim to launch in 2015.
Subscription fees are low, just £2.95 a month, so that as many people as possible can take part.
Dips are divided by age and gender, so that subscribers receive relevant gifts, and companies reach relevant markets.

A percentage of every subscription goes directly to the companies we support (£1.00 per subscription) and pays for the gifts and vouchers that our subscribers receive. Every subscriber receives a gift every month. Gifts range from thoughtful tokens, such as a miniature Fairtrade chocolate bar, through to hundreds of pounds in vouchers to spend in the online ethical and fair trade shops that we are partnered with - it's a lucky dip, so every month is an exciting surprise! Because our higher value prizes are awarded as gift vouchers, you get to choose what you spend them on. Our suppliers carry an extensive range of products including beauty and grooming, clothing, toys, homewares and edible goods.
The rest of the subscription fee covers overheads (package and posting costs, salaries, business premises, etc). A small percentage of each subscription is retained as profit.
Initially, subscriptions will be available in the UK. We plan to make subscriptions available in other territories as soon as possible.
Ethical and fair trade retailers and producers

We have already linked with lots of extremely well established and well respected ethical companies, and between them they stock an extensive range of fair trade and ethical goods from across the globe, encompassing everything from slavery free, cradle-to-cradle certified, locally produced, organic, carbon-neutral, collective and cooperative produced, recycled, upcycled and charity supporting products, to name just a few!
Dip-A-Dee-Doo-Dah lucky dips provide each and every one of these companies and all of their producers with the opportunity to reach new markets, expand their customer base and increase their sales.

As packing the envelopes is straightforward, we are also able to provide job opportunities for people with barriers to employment - those barriers may be due to homelessness, physical disabilities or cognitive impairments. We aim to create a supportive and inclusive working environment to build a strong and happy team. This enables us to have a positive impact on the local community, as well as the global community!

The long term goal is to channel a high proportion of our profits into establishing a foundation to improve working conditions for those employed in the production of consumer goods. We are exploring the most effective ways of assisting the greatest number of people. Currently, the emphasis is on lobbying for changes in legislation, and ensuring those changes are implemented.

Every subscriber wins a prize, and some of those prizes are worth hundreds of pounds. The chance to win big prizes is not the only benefit, though. Every prize is accompanied by a fun postcard with information about the company that supplied the prize, explaining who they are, what they do and what their values are. In this way, subscribers get to learn about fantastic ethical and fair trade products and companies, expanding their knowledge of ethical consumerism and helping them make informed choices.

Dip-A-Dee-Doo-Dah is designed to reward, educate, encourage and inspire people to make consumer choices that are beneficial not only to themselves, but also to others. By adding your support to the campaign you will help us achieve these aims. The price tag attached to the things we buy should never include exploitation or suffering, and together we can make sure resources and producers are respected and valued.

After much searching and some eye-watering quotes, we have found a brilliant web developer who is motivated by being part of projects he believes in, so he has agreed to do the entire build for the fantastic price of just £1,000.00!!
Aside from the website, we need to have the terms and conditions for the website drawn up, which requires a solicitor. The cost of this will be £750.00
The business will largely hinge of marketing and PR. In order to move forward we really need to secure a minimum of two months' fees, which will total £3,000.00.
If the final total comes in below the target, we will focus on creating as much of a buzz as possible with the funds available.
if we exceed the target, we will be putting everything into marketing and PR, in order to attract as many subscribers as possible.

We are offering some great perks for pledges - as well as a fantastic referral contest!

Referral Contest

All gift vouchers are supplied by the ethical and Fairtrade companies we support. All you need to do is refer your friends and choose what you'd like to spend your vouchers on! It's as easy as that! This competition is for UK residents only. To receive your vouchers, please provide us with a UK address using the pink contact link located at the top of the page.

To find out about how to take part in an Indiegogo referral contest, please follow the link: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles... 

The Impact

It's really simple. We need to look after each other and the planet more than we are currently doing. It can be easy not to look at things that we don't want to see. By creating something fun and attractive, we believe that we can encourage people to look, and provide inspiration to see that the choices we make can have a really positive impact.

Overcoming Challenges

We have a wealth of support from some extremely experienced ethical business leaders, whose advice and assistance has already proved invaluable. Responsibility underpins everything that we are building, and we take that responsibility very seriously indeed. The whole ethos is to work together. We believe that by harnessing the strengths and skills of a wide range of people, while maintaining a clear focus on our aims, we ensure that Dip-A-Dee-Doo-Dah has the greatest chance of success.

We know that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially, but when it comes to Dip-A-Dee-Doo-Dah, spreading the word is worth its weight in gold! The more subscribers we have, the more we can achieve! Far beyond this campaign, you can ensure that, together, we make a significant, positive and lasting difference to the quality of life of many people.
