column3: >So you've watched our video, but here's how it is right now...

column1: The opportunity has presented itself for us to set up shop in the heart of beautiful Daylesford. We've quit our full-time jobs, found the perfect shop, completed our business plan and even confirmed some other artists to collaborate with in store. We've never felt so inspired and driven to achieve our goal as we do now and it's so close we can almost taste it!

However, the bank has told us that we are too much of a risk for a business loan and have declined our application for initial funds to start our dream. It's fair to say we're feel pretty low right now, but if theres anything we've learnt from Sam's AVM its to keep fighting and we won't give up on our dream.
So here's where you come in. We need a bit of cash to pay the rental bond, first two month's rent &
column2: bills up front and to purchase some stock from our favourite artists to help fill out the store. The most expensive part is the initial cash outlay and the shop refurbishment, but once we're set up we have no doubt we will succeed.

column1: We've written an extensive budget and worked out that realising our dream is going to cost us around $70,000. We've managed to scrape together just under $10,000 so we're still around $60,000 short. So every dollar you can donate will help as we really need to reach our target if we're going to turn this dream into a reality. See below image of the shop in the main street of Daylesford that we hope to lease:
Every person who donates will have their name written on the wall of our store as a tribute to the kind nature and generosity of strangers. Anyone who has their name on the Bowen &
column2:
Kenneth ""Wall of Love"" will receive a lifetime 5% discount on all products when they visit us in store, and further lifetime discounts for the extremely selfless will also be given. Based on this rewards scheme we think you'll get your money's worth in no time! Plus, when you visit our store you'll be treated like royalty and showered with all the love and gratitude you deserve. 

We understand that no everyone is in a position to help, but please if you believe in our cause, share this page around.

column1: www.BowenKenneth.com
","So you've watched our video, but here's how it is right now...

The opportunity has presented itself for us to set up shop in the heart of beautiful Daylesford. We've quit our full-time jobs, found the perfect shop, completed our business plan and even confirmed some other artists to collaborate with in store. We've never felt so inspired and driven to achieve our goal as we do now and it's so close we can almost taste it!

However, the bank has told us that we are too much of a risk for a business loan and have declined our application for initial funds to start our dream. It's fair to say we're feel pretty low right now, but if theres anything we've learnt from Sam's AVM its to keep fighting and we won't give up on our dream.

So here's where you come in. We need a bit of cash to pay the rental bond, first two month's rent & bills up front and to purchase some stock from our favourite artists to help fill out the store. The most expensive part is the initial cash outlay and the shop refurbishment, but once we're set up we have no doubt we will succeed.

We've written an extensive budget and worked out that realising our dream is going to cost us around $70,000. We've managed to scrape together just under $10,000 so we're still around $60,000 short. So every dollar you can donate will help as we really need to reach our target if we're going to turn this dream into a reality. See below image of the shop in the main street of Daylesford that we hope to lease:

Every person who donates will have their name written on the wall of our store as a tribute to the kind nature and generosity of strangers. Anyone who has their name on the Bowen & Kenneth ""Wall of Love"" will receive a lifetime 5% discount on all products when they visit us in store, and further lifetime discounts for the extremely selfless will also be given. Based on this rewards scheme we think you'll get your money's worth in no time! Plus, when you visit our store you'll be treated like royalty and showered with all the love and gratitude you deserve.  We understand that no everyone is in a position to help, but please if you believe in our cause, share this page around.

I aim to bring a modern approach to my grandfather's work of providing accessible housing to people with low income. In order to bring this vision to fruition, I will need to build a model of the design I can offer to display the possibilities of aesthetics and practicality through green building techniques, sacred geometry design and intentional building. Though this vision is solid and on a strong foundation of ability and skill, I need your help! Despite solid motivation, I lack the resources to start, let alone complete, this project
column2: as I cannot manifest this alone, I am asking for your assistance in achieving this dream.

column1: My name is Casey Attebery, and I am a father, carpenter, teacher, therapeutic sound-worker, scientist and dreamer. Throughout much of my life I have been one to strive to live and work in service to my community, which has mostly come in a day-to-day form. For several years I have had a dream of living in, and building for others, a tiny home in which to live in small communities
column2: meanwhile, I have also been seeking ways to bring my passions through this body in ways to serve my greater community. I believe the answer is in building micro-campers for people in need of housing, using sacred geometry and intention in the design with green building techniques. This can also extend to custom builds, however I wish to begin a small business whose guiding principle is building practical and inexpensive portable living spaces. My goal with this campaign is to plant a seed to starting a small business that can grow with the community, and perhaps beyond, serving those in need along the way. I feel it is my time to set a solid foot into this Earth, to be a grounded example for my daughter, and the generations to come.

column1: The pictures shown here are of others' designs, but I believe practicality and aesthetic beauty can both be maximized under the heading ""inexpensive"". With the funds earned from this campaign, I will afford the materials needed for a model build. The estimated cost for a trailer, framing lumber, insulation, interior/exterior siding, windows/door, flooring, roofing, hardware, fixtures, shelving and storage is about $2,000. I am asking $1,500 for my time and labor, and an additional $500 for small-business startup costs.  If I don't make the full goal, I will still go as far into the build process that I can, and will manifest the fruition as soon as possible. However, if there are any additional funds remaining at the end of the project, they will go towards capital for the next build!

Along the build journey I will take photographs and reflect in a journal about the experience. This information, along with the final model, will serve as a foundation for a book I will write outlining the very simple steps and procedures for anyone to build their own eco-conscious micro-camper or gypsy wagon. I have researched many others' builds on tiny homes, and have consolidated a good list of things to do and things not to do, but I am sure I will still learn a lot in this first build. In the end I will reflect on any and all ways I can minimize building cost without a loss to practicality, aesthetics or function, and pass these tips on in the book. 

With books to deliver and plans to unfold, I, along with whatever team manifests along the way, will forge forth with this vision to build adequate and accessible portable housing to the community. In addition, I envision along this path the offering of portable healing spaces, vending carts, meditation spaces, art nooks, and sound chambers.

I firmly believe not only in completing my goals with passion, but also at each possible moment exceeding those goals as they meet the calls of the community. Thus, in order to fully meet the purpose behind this project, I will be corresponding with local Community Action centers to try to develop a keen sense of what the needs and resources are in the community for portable housing. With a solid history of unique and custom projects, as well as having the drive to help make a difference, I am more than ready to meet this call.

This campaign will run for 34 days, after which I will use the funds to purchase materials and build the model micro-camper. I am also interested in support by means of items/materials! Mostly, I am looking for a trailer (5'x8' or 4'x6' preferred), 2""x3"" lumber, RV windows/door, foam board insulation, siding, etc.
Any and all support is greatly appreciated! Please share this campaign as you're willing and able! Thank you :)

As a yacht chef, I cook for the 1 percent. I also feed the crew who support our owners and guests.

The crew are the most important people on board I cook for. Not to mention the pickiest - they want simplicity, they want variety, sometimes they were grumpy and homesick and wanted something from their home country. Being 3,000 miles away from home, I knew my mission was not just to fuel them, but to provide comfort and excitement during their 19-hour days.

After cooking for countless crew and hungry expats in France, I have compiled all my favorite recipes to open Graze, where EVERYONE can enjoy enjoy nutritious and delicious fare every day of the week. 

Short Summary

I am a chef who has dedicated my life to helping people eat better - for health and for pleasure. My recipes fuel the body and are kind to the planet (Vegans and Vegetarians welcome!) Previously my cuisine was available only to the wealthy, but now the experience will be open to every customer at Graze.

Your contributions will help me achieve my purpose - to bring comfort and nourishment to college kids, single moms, young professionals - anyone who has had an apple and a bag of crisps for dinner this week.

I am a successful entrepreneur who has launched several food ventures. I started Dragon Dinners, Chinese cooking classes for home cooks, in Los Angeles in 2008. Since then I have run cooking classes in Santa Barbara, Calif. and Paris.

My latest project is called Gourmet2Go ! a premium meal delivery service in Paris and the French Riviera. I developed G2G to help busy professionals and families eat wholesome meals during the week. It's all the benefits of a private chef, for less.

My reputation in the luxury yachting industry as a culinary powerhouse means I have a strong and loyal following.

My TV show: Burgers to Baguettes: Real Paris Cuisine

My website: ivydai.com

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We need YOUR help to make it to the very last stretch before opening! We are at the make it or break it moment - without this funding, we cannot open, and the money and time we have invested thus far will be lost.

Expected opening date: October 15

We need a minimum of 25,000 euros to open our storefront. It is located in the heart of Old Town Antibes, steps away from the Hop Store and next door to: the Crew Grapevine, Backpacker Hostel, Onshore Cellars and SeaScope yacht training school.

We have secured a beautiful, 50m2 space which we have renovated and transformed at a low cost. We gutted and reinforced the floors, put in wooden tile, plumbing, electricity, water systems, exposed the walls, plastered and reinforced the ceiling, put in a DOOR (basically took it from the 1900 to the 2000s!)

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES

5,000 euros: electrical wiring for the whole cafe, lights, sockets, internet/phone
column3:
and building a fuse box, grounding cables, by a licensed electrician (mandatory by the city)

2,000 euros - installation of toilet and sink and bathroom door
column4: drilling a hole for the extraction fan, installing 2 more sinks in the kitchen, tiling in the bathroom and kitchen, installing the water heater, general plastering and painting of the whole space
column5:
finishing the front door!

6,000 euros - buying internal air conditioning units (about 1500 euros each) plus paying for the 3,000 euro external unit that has already been advanced to us by the generous owners of the building.

5,000 euros - buying an extraction fan, induction stoves, juicer, blender, freezer, coffee maker, pots, pans, packaging equipment, napkins, a DISHWASHER, a refrigerated glass case to keep food cold to grab and go!

7,000 euros - Buy the first stock of food to keep us going during the first month
column6: maintain and start accounts with wholesalers
column7:
pay rent, permitting and overhead costs (approx 2,000 euros), tables and chairs.

IF WE DON’T MAKE OUR GOAL

We will nix our heating/cooling/ventilation systems and delay the installation of it until we make revenue and get funds in 6 months. We won't build the bathroom, and if necessary will prepare some of our food off-site in a commercial kitchen until we get enough money to finish the work. This of course is not ideal, but we need to get open!

The Impact

The purpose of this cafe is two-fold:

1) Make real food accessible - with an affordable price and convenient opening hours. Eating out in the French Riviera is expensive, and restaurants are closed between 2-7pm, on Sundays. Mondays, in August or whenever employees take a holiday. Our only takeaway options are pizza or kebab sandwiches made with industrial ingredients. If you want real food, you gotta make it yourself (and that's if the market is open!) For those of us from the States, UK, Australia and South Africa, we are spoiled with affordable and tasty takeaway options back home. Let's start by opening ONE place like that here with great food!

2) Introduce California cuisine to the French culinary landscape. Alice Waters opened Chez Panisse in Berkeley in 1971, fusing ethnic flavors with local ingredients and a light, healthy spin. She was largely influenced by the cuisine here in the south of France - Provencal dishes and ingredients like mesclun lettuce, fresh goat cheese and beetroot, flatbreads and grilled vegetables. I will bring California cuisine back to its roots! That includes Asian and Mexican influenced dishes that represent the real melting pot that is America. Think chickpea and ginger burgers with wasabi mayo, or Mexican breakfast wraps with smoked tempeh, salsa and roasted potatoes. red velvet cupcakes and almond milk cappuccinos! Smoothies with protein boosts...'sushiritos'....


Risks &
column8:
Challenges

This is by far the largest business undertaking I have taken on in my career. It's my first brick and mortar business, the French tax system is bewildering and suffocating, and I have overhead.

It is hard getting stuff done in France. Luckily I have been in the country for more than 4 years, speak fluent French, and have a lot of experience wading through the administrative doo-doo. I have compiled a team of savvy accountants, experienced restaurateurs, and efficient technicians.

The biggest primary challenge is getting this place open and surviving for the first few months with large expenditures and waiting for the revenue to come in. I will control this gap by starting slow and steady, with a simple menu and moderate costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing the campaign with others on Facebook, e-mail and word of mouth.
column9:
>Sharing your gifts: financial or construction expertise, interior design, volunteering to paint/tile, being a kitchen helper!

Lending or donating equipment: electric kettles, juicers, coffee machines, blenders, furniture. Offering to build furniture.

Handing out fliers and answering a questionnaire to determine what kind of cuisine and price point would most benefit locals.

column1: The Wynwood Yard is a culinary incubator. It’s a community of entrepreneurs who are passionate about their ideas and who are hustling to make their livelihoods in innovative ways.  Most days you can meet with them face-to- face here at the Yard as they prepare dishes and serve them to you or tend the garden. You can also meet arts, design and culture entrepreneurs as they forge ahead with their start-ups at The Wynwood Yard.

The Yard has maintained an organic garden since its inception in November 2015. With major improvements coming on-line for the first-year anniversary, the garden is being expanded and improved.  The new educational demonstration garden will showcase sustainable, organic growing techniques in an urban setting.  In addition to providing produce and herbs for on-site culinary concepts, the garden will be home to urban farming classes, floral and art workshops, cooking classes and chef demos, and farm-to-table community dinners.

Muriel Olivares and Tiffany Noe, founders of Little River Cooperative, will be curating and tending to our new garden and making sure it’s thriving all year long with seasonal produce, edible flowers and herbs using sustainable farming methods. Here's what the amazing women of LRC have to say about their involvement with The Yard:

“Being part of The Wynwood Yard project has been so inspiring since the very beginning. When we showed up late last summer to revive the garden, it was just an abandoned-looking lot full of weeds and trash. Now it’s the most inspiring hub of entrepreneurial spirit, community involvement and delicious food in all of Miami. Our small farm business couldn’t be more proud to be a part of it all.”

• We're raising funds to cover the following materials and labor needed to renovate, re-plant, and maintain the garden: produce and flower plants, corrugated containers, grading land, new irrigation system, building
column3: > ‘low’ beds, stones, edging, pergola, lighting. furniture (6 tables
column4: 8’ long x 39” wide), and 50 folding beer garden chairs.

column1: • We'd be deeply appreciative for your contribution to this campaign in whatever capacity possible.  Contribution levels range from adopting a seedling to naming the entire garden. Depending on your contribution, perks include everything from digital recognition to a physical plaque on the piece of garden that you sponsored.

By contributing to this campaign, you'll be making a significant and direct impact by propelling the mission of the Yard forward.  The garden will be a focal point that allows our community to connect with where and how our food is grown.  It will educate our guests about the beauty and importance of organic, sustainable farming methods, and create a special space for gathering and celebration.

More about The Wynwood Yard….

The Wynwood Yard was conceptualized as a launchpad for local entrepreneurs seeking less expensive and more iterative approaches to launching their businesses. The vision for The Wynwood Yard was inspired by food trucks, culinary incubators, food halls, and pop-up concepts around the world.  The ecosystem was created by activating five previously vacant lots on NW 29th Street owned by Wynwood developer David Lombardi.

 

The Yard is a new hub of food and culture in Miami. The food yard, events-and-live-music venue and all-day hangout space brings locals and visitors to Miami a smorgasbord of food, fitness, music and other cultural activities.

 

Our turn-key venue has all of the features for hosting large-scale events, private gatherings, and brand activations. Elements include eleven hand-picked culinary concepts, a bar, a covered stage, an organic garden by The Little River Cooperative, an astroturf lawn, a stunning container home by design start-up Wyn-Box, picnic tables, and charming rustic furniture. New features will include Miami’s first full-service container-based restaurant, as well as a design-focused retail airstream.

MAILING LIST: 15K+ subscribers including local influencers, cultural, art, and music enthusiasts

INSTAGRAM: Over 20K followers

MEDIA IMPRESSIONS: An average of 50 media mentions each month in publications with a combined average reach of 2.4 million, with 320K average monthly online impressions of articles specifically mentioning The Wynwood Yard and an average of 5K social shares of those articles, posts, and online mentions.

The Wynwood Yard has been covered in local and national publications including Vogue, Travel + Leisure, New York Post, Paste, Miami Herald, Sun-Sentinel, WSVN 7 Deco Drive, NBC 6 in the Mix, New Tropic, Thrillist, Eater, Miami New Times, Zagat, Time Out, Racked, Where and more.

More about The Wynwood Yard….The Wynwood Yard was conceptualized as a launchpad for local entrepreneurs seeking less expensive and more iterative approaches to launching their businesses. The vision for The Wynwood Yard was inspired by food trucks, culinary incubators, food halls, and pop-up concepts around the world.  The ecosystem was created by activating five previously vacant lots on NW 29th Street owned by Wynwood developer David Lombardi. The Yard is a new hub of food and culture in Miami. The food yard, events-and-live-music venue and all-day hangout space brings locals and visitors to Miami a smorgasbord of food, fitness, music and other cultural activities. Our turn-key venue has all of the features for hosting large-scale events, private gatherings, and brand activations. Elements include eleven hand-picked culinary concepts, a bar, a covered stage, an organic garden by The Little River Cooperative, an astroturf lawn, a stunning container home by design start-up Wyn-Box, picnic tables, and charming rustic furniture. New features will include Miami’s first full-service container-based restaurant, as well as a design-focused retail airstream.MAILING LIST: 15K+ subscribers including local influencers, cultural, art, and music enthusiastsINSTAGRAM: Over 20K followersMEDIA IMPRESSIONS: An average of 50 media mentions each month in publications with a combined average reach of 2.4 million, with 320K average monthly online impressions of articles specifically mentioning The Wynwood Yard and an average of 5K social shares of those articles, posts, and online mentions.The Wynwood Yard has been covered in local and national publications including Vogue, Travel + Leisure, New York Post, Paste, Miami Herald, Sun-Sentinel, WSVN 7 Deco Drive, NBC 6 in the Mix, New Tropic, Thrillist, Eater, Miami New Times, Zagat, Time Out, Racked, Where and more.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"

Who We Are

The Geek Initiative is a website and community about women in geek culture founded in 2013. We strive for an intersectional feminist perspective on geek culture and cover comic books, movies, crowdfunding efforts, gaming, and more.

The Geek Initiative has had a presence at over a dozen conventions including New York Comic Con and WonderCon.

We host the popular “LARP Chat Live” on Blab and The Geek Initiative Podcast.

What Happened

In June of this year, The Geek Initiative sponsored three panels at Wizard World Comic Con Philadelphia (Wizard World Philly) in an effort to contribute to a more inclusive atmosphere. Our panels were listed in the “40(!) Can’t-Miss Panels When Wizard World Invades Philly This Week.” They were:
• The Big Two on the Big Screen: Do DC and Marvel Do Enough?
• Communities of Color: Why People of Color Need Our Own Space in Geek Communities and How to Find or Create These Spaces
• What I Learned by Giving Kids Swords: LARP Life Lessons from Really Smart Kids

During our Communities of Color panel on Saturday, our website went down. With the help of our web host, we determined that it was a hack. Google currently lists the site as potentially hacked as well.

We have backups of the files, but our site’s formatting is gone and we need to re-do it with some increased security measures to ensure this doesn’t happen again.

What Steps We Have Taken

We assessed the damage and costs. We polled our community about whether it was worth it to continue - even though we knew we wanted to. We were met with a resounding ‘yes.’

We reached out to a network specifically designed to assist with these situations (twice), but we did not receive a response or any aid from them.

Crowdfunding this effort is our final option.

How We Can Fix It

We are poised to re-do the site. Our editorial staff and contributors can do most of the work in-house. However, we need to install additional security measures to ensure the stability and security of our website. We have secured pro bono aid from a certified technical expert.

Emergency Costs

These emergency costs have been provided to us by GoDaddy, our editorial team, and our web tech expert.
• Custom CSS and Javascript implementation to improve UX (user experience) and menu navigation, build our mailing list and long-term crowdfunding for sustainability: Estimated $350
• Emergency contingency fund for additional hack attempts or tech support requirements: $350
• WhoIs / ICANN privacy for site owner’s security: $30/year

column2:
>$1814 + $91 (5% Indiegogo Fee) = $1905

Stretch Goals: Maintenance Costs for 2017

Total maintenance costs for May 2017-May 2018--

column1: • SSL Certificate, SiteLock, ongoing tech support, emergency fund, ICANN = $1264

Yes, we pay our editors and contributors as often as possible. There are other publications in this niche who do not pay most contributors even though they have large investments and significant advertising revenue.

More Beyond That? We'll Make...

Future Plans For Funds / Long-Term Funding Solutions

Following this crowdfunding campaign, we will announce our long-term business strategy. Within a year, we will be a self-supporting site.
• Exclusive content for monthly contributors - downloadable RPG adventures and more
• Native and display advertising program: we only endorse products we would truly recommend
We’ve also prepared some fresh, new content:
• More interviews with industry influencers in comics, movies, video games, and more
• Online store with TGI merch available for purchase

Can’t Contribute? You Can Still Help

Please share our campaign on social media and tag us!

Facebook

Twitter

YouTube

G+

What Happens if We Do Not Achieve Emergency Funding?

 

If we do not achieve emergency funding, we will close the site and, with contributors’ permissions, redistribute content or relinquish rights to contributors. We hope the people who hacked our site do not win, but with a pragmatic approach, we recognize that it is a possibility.

If we do not meet the minimum goal, we will roll the funds into a charitable and inclusive organization benefiting women.

column2: >Speaking of being creative...Josh takes his love for culinary innovation and craft beer by blending the two in his home brewery. In the past few years he has crafted various key lime goses, a roasted mandarin orange and vanilla mead, tart cherry wild ales using wine must, and his favorite--a pineapple habanero red ale. In what spare time he has, Josh creates both meads and ales for his 'members only' reserve club that allows members up to 8 different styles ranging from 375ml to 750ml, many with a caged and corked presentation. He also has brewed beers as favors for two weddings last year. Needless to say...food and beer are his 'thing.'

column1: Lastly, BBQ can mean many things ranging from low and slow cooking techniques to hot and fast live fire cooking. True Craft BBQ will be focusing on both. The primary function of the business is to cook most, if not all, of its food over live coals. This ranges from steaks &
column2: burgers to slow smoked brisket and even desserts. The sky is the limit when you have a coal driven pit at your disposal!

column1: you the merging of two passions: True Craft BBQ.

Starting a 'craft' catering and events business will allow Josh to serve (pun intended) a segment of the market that is generally overlooked by many caterers. The catering concept will serve smaller events (40-60 people) and focus on food inspired by its surroundings. Whether it's putting a Florida spin on classic Texas BBQ or crafting a beer and food pairing menu for a local brewery, the catering concept will be unlike any others in the Tampa Bay Area. There will be a huge emphasis on 'cooked on site' so that all attendees can take part and watch how dishes are transformed from standard 'center-of-the-plate' meals to something that will be remembered.

column2: >By keeping the operation small at first, the food and overall experience can be tailored to any client large or small. While larger events are doable, the menus would be more fixed and traditional in nature, something akin to a BBQ picnic. We are aiming for a higher-level of thought for our food. Our goal is to keep events smaller so that we can run wild with awesome menus that will have people wanting more.

What you get

The gallery has a few samples of the perks for backers. We strive to provide top quality, hand crafted goods that are practical and stylish! The goal is to get these to you within 2-3 weeks of the campaign closing! I am working with the vendors to get these ASAP as I know its important to see where you money is going with this type of campaign.
NOTE: All perks available via pickup or shipping. Shipping will be at cost and an estimate can be provided for those out of town folks looking to contribute. I will contact you at the end of the campaign if you indicated that you will need any of the items shipped.
Featured Perks

Stretch Perk 1! Closed!
If we are able to surpass $3,000 by April 20th, every backer who has helped contribute to that goal will receive one of the craft beer cups below. So, if you bought a t-shirt on April 15th, you will get a t-shirt and a craft beer cup for free! If you already bought a two-pack of the cups, your order just got increased by 1. This is only available to those early adopters and those who help us get to $3,000 by Wednesday the 20th!
Another, HUGE stretch perk will be announced once we surpass $3,000.

In-home private cooking lesson                 Catering at Hidden Springs Ale Works

Speaking of being creative...Josh takes his love for culinary innovation and craft beer by blending the two in his home brewery. In the past few years he has crafted various key lime goses, a roasted mandarin orange and vanilla mead, tart cherry wild ales using wine must, and his favorite--a pineapple habanero red ale. In what spare time he has, Josh creates both meads and ales for his 'members only' reserve club that allows members up to 8 different styles ranging from 375ml to 750ml, many with a caged and corked presentation. He also has brewed beers as favors for two weddings last year. Needless to say...food and beer are his 'thing.'

Lastly, BBQ can mean many things ranging from low and slow cooking techniques to hot and fast live fire cooking. True Craft BBQ will be focusing on both. The primary function of the business is to cook most, if not all, of its food over live coals. This ranges from steaks & burgers to slow smoked brisket and even desserts. The sky is the limit when you have a coal driven pit at your disposal!

column2: >My name is Joey Victorian and on our cooking team I’m known as “Dirrty Boss”. Although I was born and raised in Houston, Texas my parents were raised in Louisiana and we spent a significant amount of time there growing up. My mothers Louisiana style cooking had a big influence on me growing up and I've been cooking for as long as I can remember. My mother always told me ""If you don't have a dime on you, you will still be able to cook and feed yourself."" I started competition cooking 10 years ago entering in a number of cooking contests.

column1: My wife, Kelli Victorian, is a talented Marketing Professional and Graphic Designer. She has over 8 years of experience designing for some of the top companies in Houston. Dirrty Swamp won’t have to spend any money on marketing collateral, logo, or package design which can add up quickly for a start up company. Our talents combined will make this company a success.

column2: >Every new business has it's challenges. For us, it actually putting our seasoning to work for the masses. This will require capital to be ready to purchase a food trailer, inventory as needed along with hard work by us which we are ready to handle. In order to get over these hurdles, we need your help. Why are we qualified? We have been developing the Dirrty Swamp brand for nearly a decade now and using our own seasonings to cook for large crowds.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

My name is Joey Victorian and on our cooking team I’m known as “Dirrty Boss”. Although I was born and raised in Houston, Texas my parents were raised in Louisiana and we spent a significant amount of time there growing up. My mothers Louisiana style cooking had a big influence on me growing up and I've been cooking for as long as I can remember. My mother always told me ""If you don't have a dime on you, you will still be able to cook and feed yourself."" I started competition cooking 10 years ago entering in a number of cooking contests.

My wife, Kelli Victorian, is a talented Marketing Professional and Graphic Designer. She has over 8 years of experience designing for some of the top companies in Houston. Dirrty Swamp won’t have to spend any money on marketing collateral, logo, or package design which can add up quickly for a start up company. Our talents combined will make this company a success.

Every new business has it's challenges. For us, it actually putting our seasoning to work for the masses. This will require capital to be ready to purchase a food trailer, inventory as needed along with hard work by us which we are ready to handle. In order to get over these hurdles, we need your help. Why are we qualified? We have been developing the Dirrty Swamp brand for nearly a decade now and using our own seasonings to cook for large crowds.

column2: >Fill your life with experiences, not things. Have stories to tell, not just stuff to show.

column4: low-cost individual or group passenger transport options for particular destinations.

column3: >We also enable transporters to get in touch with passengers.

column2: >The original meaning of the word shuttle is the device used in weaving to carry the weft. By reference to the continual to-and-from motion associated with that, the term was then applied in transportation.

>The last time I took a ride service, was from the Luton airport to the center of London, with quite a bit of luggage that got me sweating by just thinking about going on a crowded bus in the morning, and then train, and then the subway in a worst case scenario. Oh, and I almost forgot about walking with all the luggage in between. Bus + walking + The underground would be a best case public transport scenario I guess. I mean traveling can already be exhausting just with the jet lag, luggage, and haste.

>Also whenever traveling in a larger city, there is always some fear present of getting lost with the public transport somehow. Wouldn't be the first time.
Therefore I and a designer working on the project opted for a private transfer, out of at least 20+ providers operating in London that I found on the web, I checked maybe 5 ? The nonsense of filling out destination, the number of people traveling and time forms over and over again for each provider separately, wasting valuable time and waiting for the replies and confirmations for the transfer... really ? Isn't it 2016 ? Come on, chop chop, there's gotta be a quicker and easier way, no ?
>So I decided to check what Uber though about my need for transport. £48 and no promise for a guaranteed ride. Ok then. And BlaBlaCar can't operate on airports... bummer.

>Decided to make a booking that was guaranteed with a local company, the price was £50. The driver was waiting for us at the airport, the ride was pleasant and comfortable, the luggage fit nicely in the trunk and there was still room in the car for at least 2 more + luggage, that got me thinking again, of just those flights that landed around the same time as ours, there are numerous people also going to the center of London... but I couldn't just pull their sleeve and ask them if they'd like to join, and it would cost them just 16 pounds or less per person for a shared door to door ride for sure. Of course not, there are social rules in existence and we do not do that.

> It would probably be easier if we'd be able to do that online, where there's no fear of getting in an awkward situation with a random stranger.
At least not right off the bat
>Tell us what bugs you most on your travels ? Is it the search for transport, the waiting, prices ? Or is it just the weather every now and then ?
>What will you be able to find on shuttleplanet.com ?
>Most importantly - carpooling and economical group traveling. A web platform and mobile application for passenger road transport, specialized in on-demand travel, either private or shared.
><strong>Through a seamless experience travel to sightseeing points, hotels, airports, get daily commute rides and more. You'll be able to search and choose from private &amp
column3: VIP transfers, rent-a-cars, and our pride and joy system - shared transfers.

column2: >Only the top third of the front page is in the picture*

>From our experience in transport and rent-a-car, there's a lot of logistics and planning needed to properly execute a great on-demand passenger transfer. Finding the cheapest or quickest possible route, calculating the time taking all the possible setbacks into account, and finding the best possible fuel price on long distance routes, especially in Europe (Yes, we're looking at you Norway and Netherlands). Even with electric and self-driving cars, there are a few things we can do better.

>If using shared transport the algorithms we are implementing will help you connect with travelers all over the world that share the time and destination trips, so you can share the trip expenses, yet you still get to keep the professionalism, insurances, and treatment of a customer along with the experience of traveling with other people just like yourself.

>Bring along your pets, skis, bikes, or if you need a transportation service adapted for people with disabilities, we'll find it for you. Shuttle Planet will offer you on-demand shared and private transfers on your travels. Anywhere you go.

>Your time is valuable when you are planning a trip or a holiday, and we know of all the things you have to think about. Save your time in planning on how to get to your destination and rather focus on what you'll be doing on the actual destination.

>Intentional or not, by carpooling you will help lower the emissions produced by fossil fueled vehicles. Trees are responsible for absorbing a fifth of man's climate change emissions, and our forests are in crisis.

>The world has lost half its natural forests – and only a tenth of what’s left is protected. Every year we lose another 130,000 square km – that’s an area the size of England. Cutting down all those trees is speeding up climate change.

>Data source: Reconstruction from ice cores.
Credit: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration
>In that regard, we will be donating 10% of any pledge of 25$ and above to The Woodland Trust, in order to help them maintain, restore and protect our trees and woodlands.
>Our values are that every company's priority should be to bring value to people above anything else.

>We will provide any passenger transport company or even sole proprietors the ability to compete with today's boom of ""ridesharing"" startups, to not just survive, but to increase their profit while simultaneously reduce prices for the passenger. Allowing the insight about passenger statistics for companies, giving them the ability to optimize their routes and vehicles to further reduce the price to the passenger, while simultaneously increasing revenue and profit, creating a win-win situation for both the customer and the transport provider.

>Also increasing the value of local communities with new businesses, creating new real jobs and by advertising, not just the inexhaustible hidden gems and destinations sought out by explorers in their respective countries, but also showing the ease, price, and availability of getting there.
>Simplifying the way we search for transport be it shared, private, or even extravagant, and if desired, giving us the ability to share the expenses of road transport.
>And we also understand that your business is yours, and we'll keep it that way

>To create a connection between people and establish a bridge of trust, sharing and security between travelers.
We are partnering with companies that share our vision.
>Due to the business model each perk can be worth more than your donation, depending on the type of service you will choose, and it's given trip length.

>You can use the perks whenever you're traveling in a country ShuttlePlanet is available, so you don't have to be a resident of one. We will do our best to provide our services wherever you will go. Most of the perks are easily transferable to anyone you want and have no expiration date.

column3: visionaries with unique skills that complement each other. The idea of shuttleplanet.com came out of many years of experience from working in the IT and transport sector and seeing the constant struggle of travelers on their journeys, from commuters to tourists.

column2: >Come and take a look at where we're at :
>Or check us out on social networks :
>Want a perk we're not offering ? Let us know!
>We would also like to give out a sincere thank you to anyone who contributes by donating or sharing and also to those who just put themselves on the invite list on our website.

>When will I be able to use the platform?
We are planning to launch in the second half of December 2016.

>In which countries will I be able to use the platform?
You can use the service when traveling to any country you wish. We will do our best to provide our services wherever you will go. When a nexus threshold will be reached in a given country, we will make our offer permanent in that area.
We will launch in the UK, and shortly after that, along with Canada we plan to be available in most USA states and EU countries. And Koalas and Kangaroos too.

>When will I receive my perks?
Perk pre-orders will begin to be fulfilled at the end of December 2016 to March 2017 on a first-ordered, first-received basis. Complimentary rides will be delivered in December 2016, and discounts in March 2017. Shuttle Planet Ltd will keep you informed of when you will receive your perks.

>How are perks transferable?
You can give any discount or free ride to anyone you like.

>I preordered, but I didn’t get a confirmation email. How can I check the status?
Please refer to this article on How to Check if Your Contribution is Successful. If there is still an issue, you may contact us at info@shuttleplanet.com with the subject line: PREORDER CONFIRMATION.

>There was an error with my contribution. What happened?
Please refer to this article on common contribution errors and steps to resolve: Common Contribution Errors.

>What languages will the platform support?
The platform launches in English - with German following quickly. We will be adding additional languages on a regular basis. We'll keep the community updated.

>Currencies I'll be able to use?
10 of them, right from the start.

>Is there a mobile app?
Yes, the mobile app will be released for iOS and Android soon after the launch of the web-based platform.

>How is my privacy protected?
Guarding our users' privacy is something we take very seriously. We work hard to protect your information from unauthorized access and have designed policies and controls to safeguard the collection, use, and disclosure of your information.

>How secure is this?
We use 2048-bit Extended Validation SSL encryption, which is the highest form of website security, to secure personal data sent to and from the platform. Fully PCI Compliant.

column3: Video, and they are highly recommended by us!

column2:
>Is Shuttle Planet Ltd hiring?
We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team. If you think your background and goals are aligned with ours visit www.shuttleplanet.com/jobs (After Launch) to see our open positions, or you can send an email to info@shuttleplanet.com.

>If I have questions, how can I reach your team?
For questions related to the Indiegogo campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com. 
For all other questions regarding the platform, contact us at support@shuttleplanet.com.

","Fill your life with experiences, not things. Have stories to tell, not just stuff to show.

column1: We find and offer reliable high & low-cost individual or group passenger transport options for particular destinations.
We also enable transporters to get in touch with passengers.

The original meaning of the word shuttle is the device used in weaving to carry the weft. By reference to the continual to-and-from motion associated with that, the term was then applied in transportation.

The last time I took a ride service, was from the Luton airport to the center of London, with quite a bit of luggage that got me sweating by just thinking about going on a crowded bus in the morning, and then train, and then the subway in a worst case scenario. Oh, and I almost forgot about walking with all the luggage in between. Bus + walking + The underground would be a best case public transport scenario I guess. I mean traveling can already be exhausting just with the jet lag, luggage, and haste.

Also whenever traveling in a larger city, there is always some fear present of getting lost with the public transport somehow. Wouldn't be the first time.Therefore I and a designer working on the project opted for a private transfer, out of at least 20+ providers operating in London that I found on the web, I checked maybe 5 ? The nonsense of filling out destination, the number of people traveling and time forms over and over again for each provider separately, wasting valuable time and waiting for the replies and confirmations for the transfer... really ? Isn't it 2016 ? Come on, chop chop, there's gotta be a quicker and easier way, no ?
So I decided to check what Uber though about my need for transport. £48 and no promise for a guaranteed ride. Ok then. And BlaBlaCar can't operate on airports... bummer.

Decided to make a booking that was guaranteed with a local company, the price was £50. The driver was waiting for us at the airport, the ride was pleasant and comfortable, the luggage fit nicely in the trunk and there was still room in the car for at least 2 more + luggage, that got me thinking again, of just those flights that landed around the same time as ours, there are numerous people also going to the center of London... but I couldn't just pull their sleeve and ask them if they'd like to join, and it would cost them just 16 pounds or less per person for a shared door to door ride for sure. Of course not, there are social rules in existence and we do not do that.
It would probably be easier if we'd be able to do that online, where there's no fear of getting in an awkward situation with a random stranger.At least not right off the bat
Tell us what bugs you most on your travels ? Is it the search for transport, the waiting, prices ? Or is it just the weather every now and then ?
What will you be able to find on shuttleplanet.com ?
Most importantly - carpooling and economical group traveling. A web platform and mobile application for passenger road transport, specialized in on-demand travel, either private or shared.

Through a seamless experience travel to sightseeing points, hotels, airports, get daily commute rides and more. You'll be able to search and choose from private & VIP transfers, rent-a-cars, and our pride and joy system - shared transfers.
Only the top third of the front page is in the picture*

From our experience in transport and rent-a-car, there's a lot of logistics and planning needed to properly execute a great on-demand passenger transfer. Finding the cheapest or quickest possible route, calculating the time taking all the possible setbacks into account, and finding the best possible fuel price on long distance routes, especially in Europe (Yes, we're looking at you Norway and Netherlands). Even with electric and self-driving cars, there are a few things we can do better.

If using shared transport the algorithms we are implementing will help you connect with travelers all over the world that share the time and destination trips, so you can share the trip expenses, yet you still get to keep the professionalism, insurances, and treatment of a customer along with the experience of traveling with other people just like yourself.

Bring along your pets, skis, bikes, or if you need a transportation service adapted for people with disabilities, we'll find it for you. Shuttle Planet will offer you on-demand shared and private transfers on your travels. Anywhere you go.

Your time is valuable when you are planning a trip or a holiday, and we know of all the things you have to think about. Save your time in planning on how to get to your destination and rather focus on what you'll be doing on the actual destination.

Intentional or not, by carpooling you will help lower the emissions produced by fossil fueled vehicles. Trees are responsible for absorbing a fifth of man's climate change emissions, and our forests are in crisis.

The world has lost half its natural forests – and only a tenth of what’s left is protected. Every year we lose another 130,000 square km – that’s an area the size of England. Cutting down all those trees is speeding up climate change.
Data source: Reconstruction from ice cores.Credit: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration
In that regard, we will be donating 10% of any pledge of 25$ and above to The Woodland Trust, in order to help them maintain, restore and protect our trees and woodlands.
Our values are that every company's priority should be to bring value to people above anything else.

We will provide any passenger transport company or even sole proprietors the ability to compete with today's boom of ""ridesharing"" startups, to not just survive, but to increase their profit while simultaneously reduce prices for the passenger. Allowing the insight about passenger statistics for companies, giving them the ability to optimize their routes and vehicles to further reduce the price to the passenger, while simultaneously increasing revenue and profit, creating a win-win situation for both the customer and the transport provider.

Also increasing the value of local communities with new businesses, creating new real jobs and by advertising, not just the inexhaustible hidden gems and destinations sought out by explorers in their respective countries, but also showing the ease, price, and availability of getting there.
Simplifying the way we search for transport be it shared, private, or even extravagant, and if desired, giving us the ability to share the expenses of road transport.
And we also understand that your business is yours, and we'll keep it that way
To create a connection between people and establish a bridge of trust, sharing and security between travelers.We are partnering with companies that share our vision.
Due to the business model each perk can be worth more than your donation, depending on the type of service you will choose, and it's given trip length.

You can use the perks whenever you're traveling in a country ShuttlePlanet is available, so you don't have to be a resident of one. We will do our best to provide our services wherever you will go. Most of the perks are easily transferable to anyone you want and have no expiration date.

We're a team of passionate professionals & visionaries with unique skills that complement each other. The idea of shuttleplanet.com came out of many years of experience from working in the IT and transport sector and seeing the constant struggle of travelers on their journeys, from commuters to tourists.
Come and take a look at where we're at :
Or check us out on social networks :
Want a perk we're not offering ? Let us know!
We would also like to give out a sincere thank you to anyone who contributes by donating or sharing and also to those who just put themselves on the invite list on our website.

In which countries will I be able to use the platform?You can use the service when traveling to any country you wish. We will do our best to provide our services wherever you will go. When a nexus threshold will be reached in a given country, we will make our offer permanent in that area.We will launch in the UK, and shortly after that, along with Canada we plan to be available in most USA states and EU countries. And Koalas and Kangaroos too.

When will I receive my perks?Perk pre-orders will begin to be fulfilled at the end of December 2016 to March 2017 on a first-ordered, first-received basis. Complimentary rides will be delivered in December 2016, and discounts in March 2017. Shuttle Planet Ltd will keep you informed of when you will receive your perks.
How are perks transferable?You can give any discount or free ride to anyone you like.

I preordered, but I didn’t get a confirmation email. How can I check the status?Please refer to this article on How to Check if Your Contribution is Successful. If there is still an issue, you may contact us at info@shuttleplanet.com with the subject line: PREORDER CONFIRMATION.
There was an error with my contribution. What happened?Please refer to this article on common contribution errors and steps to resolve: Common Contribution Errors.

What languages will the platform support? The platform launches in English - with German following quickly. We will be adding additional languages on a regular basis. We'll keep the community updated.
Currencies I'll be able to use?10 of them, right from the start.
Is there a mobile app?Yes, the mobile app will be released for iOS and Android soon after the launch of the web-based platform.

How is my privacy protected?Guarding our users' privacy is something we take very seriously. We work hard to protect your information from unauthorized access and have designed policies and controls to safeguard the collection, use, and disclosure of your information.
How secure is this?We use 2048-bit Extended Validation SSL encryption, which is the highest form of website security, to secure personal data sent to and from the platform. Fully PCI Compliant.
Who did your movie?Outdoggy Film & Video, and they are highly recommended by us!

Is Shuttle Planet Ltd hiring?We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team. If you think your background and goals are aligned with ours visit www.shuttleplanet.com/jobs (After Launch) to see our open positions, or you can send an email to info@shuttleplanet.com.

If I have questions, how can I reach your team?For questions related to the Indiegogo campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com. For all other questions regarding the platform, contact us at support@shuttleplanet.com.

Fit Caffeine is a detoxifying and rejuvenating coffee blend of organic herbs and fruits which are formulated to support your immune system, build stamina, reduce inflammation, and facilitate weight loss along with a healthy diet and exercise.
Fit Caffeine is 100% organic and made with 100% natural ingredients.
Fit Caffeine began after an endless battle with weight issues and seeing women like us struggle with feeling and looking good.

After doing the South Beach Diet, the Atkins Diet, the Paleo Diet, and the list goes on, no offense to those “experts” it just didn’t work for us. So, turning to organic herbs and fruits implemented in our coffee, Fit Caffeine was developed to help you feel healthy and Fit.
And all you have to do, is keep drinking your daily coffee!
All natural ingredients with proven qualities. Feel free to click on them to see their health benefits:
We need funding to place a minimum order of 10,000 cans printed with our logo
We also need to order enough coffee to make the product cost efficient.
• Currently seeking $17,000 USD to order 1,500 full packages of our pre-mixed Coffee blend and the minimum order of 10k cans printed.
• If we don't complete our goal, we will still proceed with a smaller order, but obviously at a higher cost.
• What you get, is a chance to pre-order this excellent coffee before anyone else.
• You get to help a company startup and take off.
• You will will have you name listed on the Fit Caffeine website (if you agree)
If we reach out goal of $17,000 USD we can lower our costs per unit, making it possible to finally print our cans, and fill them with 30 sachets of Fit Caffeine blend.
With this funding we will have the product available to deliver mid June 2016.
Our biggest challenge is actually the lack of funds.
The risk stage is gone, since we already have the product developed, certified and approved.
Some people just can't contribute with money because times are tough, here are the other ways you can help:
• Follow us on Twitter
• Like us on Facebook and share our posts and page with your friends
• Follow us on Instagram and tag us on your pictures

Our Story

We have served the public trust for much of our lives, so it’s what we know how to do. We know what it’s like to put on a uniform and do our duty for our community and our country because we’ve been there, done that. So often the men and women in public service don’t get the appreciation they deserve. We’d like let them know that we do appreciate all they do. For keeping us free, safe, and dedicating their lives to make ours better, we will raise a toast to those that serve us, and we’ll brew a beer or two for them.

Our Brand

'Battleshort' is a condition in which some military equipment can be placed so that it won't shut down if circumstances arise that might damage, degrade, or destroy it. It is also known as 'Battle Override'. The origin of the term is to bridge or 'short' the fuses of an electrical apparatus before entering combat so that if the fuses blow, the equipment will not stop operating. When going into battle you don’t know your fate, what the future holds, or even if you’ll come out alive. But you do your duty, and you give it all you’ve got. We brew in Battleshort mode.

Desired Goal

The exact location of Battleshort Brewing Company hasn’t been officially selected yet, but we will be situated in the Charleston, South Carolina regional area. Our business plan is written, and we are actively searching for the right venue to lease!

We have also already acquired about 40% of the total funding that we need, and the remainder we plan to obtain through traditional lending institutions and private investors. So we’re going to be making this dream a reality soon for sure!

But we would like you to help us expedite the process a little, and at the same time you get to show your love and support for craft beer and earn yourself some cool Battleshort Brewery perks!

We are hoping you will help us generate just a small portion of the total funding we need through our crowdfunding campaign. Since this is our first attempt at raising capital through crowdfunding, we’re setting the bar low at 2.5% of our total funding requirement. That’s an amount of $15,000, and it’s not really that much if we can motivate you to chip in with some cool schwag and merch!

Project Timeline

Our projected timeline is to hopefully be completely funded and have acquired a location by the end of 2016. That would put us on track to open sometime late next year. We’re going to focus all our efforts on accomplishing that goal. We feel like it’s a reasonable one, but not without risks. We are actually already negotiating a few possible locations, so if one of those works out, we may even have to accelerate things a bit!

How Funds Will Be Used

Any funding you contribute will be used to help us acquire the venue and make the needed tenant improvements for opening our microbrewery, taproom, and kitchen. This will be an expensive project requiring nearly $600,000 in total funding, so we’re not expecting to get there entirely through public contributions. We want to use this crowdfunding platform to get the word out, gauge interest, and start building a relationship with you, our future customers.

Our Perks

We’ve tried to offer some really cool perks to help drive interest while at the same time giving you your money’s worth. All the perks we are promising here that don’t require the brewery to be in operation will be fulfilled as soon as we can, and in any case, not later than immediately after our crowdfunding goal is achieved. The perks that require the brewery to be operational will be immediately fulfilled as soon after our doors open as possible!

Legal

This is a crowdfunding campaign and does not constitute an offer to buy or sell securities. Battleshort Brewing Company is the trademark of Swamp Fox Brewing Company, LLC. All rights are reserved.

""One day... I will own this shop"",  said a young five year-old Clayton. As the shop owner looked down on the energetic boy he could see the fixed determination in the boy's eyes and could feel an immense loving spirit spilling from his little body.

Little Clayton grew up to become ""Uncle Clay"". He made good on his dream. He took all he had and threw himself into running the humble crack seed and candy shop ""Doe Fang"" nestled in the quiet lush valley of ʻĀina Haina, Oahu.

From 1996, Uncle Clay grew into a beloved figure of the community, serving his sweet treats seven days a week and spreading Pure Aloha with everyone he met.  Yet, the small business struggled, but Uncle Clay never wavered.

Eventually, rising rents and shifting economic conditions had drained all of the earthly resources Uncle Clay had. But his spirit of Pure Aloha and his love for every guest, neighbor, and friend never cracked.
Just when it seemed there was no choice and Uncle Clay was being forced to close the doors to his dreams, his nephew, Bronson, stepped in.
With the same love and spirit of his Uncle, Bronson took Uncle Clay around the shoulders, ""This dream is too important. We can't give up"".
Bronson had a vision and a plan. Uncle Clay's mission to bring our entire One World 'Ohana took a new medium: all-natural, homemade, and handcrafted shave ice.
Bronson heroically rallied family, friends, and patrons, to launch the reimagined vision: Uncle Clay's House of Pure Aloha or ""HOPA"".

Together with the rest of ""Team HOPA"", they share, connect, laugh, cry, and weave together the hearts of every soul that enters their house. Oh yeah, all while delivering the most delicious shave ice!
The dream of a boy, the vision of a true social entrepreneur, and the mission for an entire world needs your help.

In order to serve more people on a daily basis and in order to reach those who cannot visit the House in person as often as they would like, we are making enhancements to share the transcendent experience of Pure Aloha.  Join us!

The full cost to complete our renovation and upgrade project is $17,000.  To ensure we can complete this project, we plan on putting in a lot of our own sweat to deliver these enhancements! We have actually ALREADY secured financing for 50% of this project: HOPA is self-financing $1,000, a private donor has already pledged $1,000,  and our vendor friends who will be executing the various items have generously pledged a whopping $6,500 of pro-bono support!  So now, we're seeking the community's help to complete the last 50% or $8,500 of funding needed to complete the renovations!
Here is the specific breakdown of the project's budget:

Total = $17,000
HOPA Contribution = ($1,000)
Private Donor Contribution: ($1,000)
Pro-Bono Support: ($6,500)
Remaining Funds Needs = $8,500
• redesigning and relocating menu boards for better presentation and easier ordering
• installing guide rails to help traffic flow and line management
• installing a new dedicated retail section for sweet HOPA swag
• modifying shop layout to comfortably accommodate more 'ohana

As HOPA continues to grow, we may serve over 400 guests on our busiest days.  With these in-House renovations, we can ensure our small 560 square foot shop can hum along smoothly as the numbers keep rising!

column2: >handcrafting a brand new ""One World 'Ohana"" bench from a single 16-foot Monkeypod wood slab
>Overall, these furniture upgrades will serve both form and function.  These new furniture installations have been meticulously chosen to both
column3: >maximize House space while providing an incredibly beautiful natural environment

column1: • Countertop True-Brand Freezer - this freezer will provide additional space to improve our storage capacity and logistical planning of frozen goods
• Glass-Door True-Brand Refrigerator - this fridge will provide a proper display and extra space so we can start selling chilled drinks, the most requested item currently unavailable!
We have already identified the appliances to purchase in very good condition at below 50% original retail price.

column2: >launching a new website and mobile app to better connect with our 'Ohana
>launching a full line of apparel options with worldwide e-commerce distribution as well as in-store merchandising

column1: Our original website crashed due to obsolescence, so we need to rebuild a new and optimized website.  Additionally, we will launch a cool mobile app for the mobile generation!  Lastly, our full line of apparel will help bring more Pure Aloha around Hawaii and the world, one t-shirt or hat at a time.

A lot.  In our initial launch back in 2011, we were blown away by the support of the community and friends. We can't express the love we feel every day to do what we do. Yet, we still feel we're just getting started in fulfilling our vision and mission.  By making these upgrades after 5 years of serving our community we know we will be able to take Pure Aloha to the next level for generations to come.
We have done our best to mitigate any challenges and have partnered with great people. However, whatever challenges come our way, we will overcome!

If you are not in a position to contribute financially we would love you to join our 'ohana by joining our mailing list, following and sharing us on social media (@uncleclays), emailing us about your experience, writing a review on Yelp or Trip Advisor, or just sharing Pure Aloha with those around you.

One day... I will own this shop"",  said a young five year-old Clayton. As the shop owner looked down on the energetic boy he could see the fixed determination in the boy's eyes and could feel an immense loving spirit spilling from his little body.

Little Clayton grew up to become ""Uncle Clay"". He made good on his dream. He took all he had and threw himself into running the humble crack seed and candy shop ""Doe Fang"" nestled in the quiet lush valley of ʻĀina Haina, Oahu.

From 1996, Uncle Clay grew into a beloved figure of the community, serving his sweet treats seven days a week and spreading Pure Aloha with everyone he met.  Yet, the small business struggled, but Uncle Clay never wavered.

Eventually, rising rents and shifting economic conditions had drained all of the earthly resources Uncle Clay had. But his spirit of Pure Aloha and his love for every guest, neighbor, and friend never cracked.
Just when it seemed there was no choice and Uncle Clay was being forced to close the doors to his dreams, his nephew, Bronson, stepped in.
With the same love and spirit of his Uncle, Bronson took Uncle Clay around the shoulders, ""This dream is too important. We can't give up"".
Bronson had a vision and a plan. Uncle Clay's mission to bring our entire One World 'Ohana took a new medium: all-natural, homemade, and handcrafted shave ice.
Bronson heroically rallied family, friends, and patrons, to launch the reimagined vision: Uncle Clay's House of Pure Aloha or ""HOPA"".

Together with the rest of ""Team HOPA"", they share, connect, laugh, cry, and weave together the hearts of every soul that enters their house. Oh yeah, all while delivering the most delicious shave ice!
The dream of a boy, the vision of a true social entrepreneur, and the mission for an entire world needs your help.

In order to serve more people on a daily basis and in order to reach those who cannot visit the House in person as often as they would like, we are making enhancements to share the transcendent experience of Pure Aloha.  Join us!

The full cost to complete our renovation and upgrade project is $17,000.  To ensure we can complete this project, we plan on putting in a lot of our own sweat to deliver these enhancements! We have actually ALREADY secured financing for 50% of this project: HOPA is self-financing $1,000, a private donor has already pledged $1,000,  and our vendor friends who will be executing the various items have generously pledged a whopping $6,500 of pro-bono support!  So now, we're seeking the community's help to complete the last 50% or $8,500 of funding needed to complete the renovations!
Here is the specific breakdown of the project's budget:
Total = $17,000HOPA Contribution = ($1,000)Private Donor Contribution: ($1,000)Pro-Bono Support: ($6,500)Remaining Funds Needs = $8,500
What will we do with it?
redesigning and relocating menu boards for better presentation and easier ordering
installing guide rails to help traffic flow and line management
installing a new dedicated retail section for sweet HOPA swag
modifying shop layout to comfortably accommodate more 'ohana

As HOPA continues to grow, we may serve over 400 guests on our busiest days.  With these in-House renovations, we can ensure our small 560 square foot shop can hum along smoothly as the numbers keep rising!
handcrafting a brand new ""One World 'Ohana"" bench from a single 16-foot Monkeypod wood slab
handcrafting FIVE new Monkeypod wood fixed tabletops
handcrafting TEN natural Hawaiian log stools

Overall, these furniture upgrades will serve both form and function.  These new furniture installations have been meticulously chosen to both maximize House space while providing an incredibly beautiful natural environment for guests to enjoy.
Countertop True-Brand Freezer - this freezer will provide additional space to improve our storage capacity and logistical planning of frozen goods
Glass-Door True-Brand Refrigerator - this fridge will provide a proper display and extra space so we can start selling chilled drinks, the most requested item currently unavailable!
We have already identified the appliances to purchase in very good condition at below 50% original retail price.
launching a new website and mobile app to better connect with our 'Ohana
launching a full line of apparel options with worldwide e-commerce distribution as well as in-store merchandising

Our original website crashed due to obsolescence, so we need to rebuild a new and optimized website.  Additionally, we will launch a cool mobile app for the mobile generation!  Lastly, our full line of apparel will help bring more Pure Aloha around Hawaii and the world, one t-shirt or hat at a time.
What this would mean to us?

A lot.  In our initial launch back in 2011, we were blown away by the support of the community and friends. We can't express the love we feel every day to do what we do. Yet, we still feel we're just getting started in fulfilling our vision and mission.  By making these upgrades after 5 years of serving our community we know we will be able to take Pure Aloha to the next level for generations to come.
We have done our best to mitigate any challenges and have partnered with great people. However, whatever challenges come our way, we will overcome!

If you are not in a position to contribute financially we would love you to join our 'ohana by joining our mailing list, following and sharing us on social media (@uncleclays), emailing us about your experience, writing a review on Yelp or Trip Advisor, or just sharing Pure Aloha with those around you.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Summary

Hello!! Team ESLENA here, as you may already know, we are the creators of a certified organic, lemon ginger infused still water. We love our drink, the support we're getting from our local community, and the super cool feedback that we've heard from so many of you. Since our launch in November of 2015, our sales have consistently grown, and because of that track record (and requests from our current customers!), it’s time to grow our brand by rolling out new flavors and work to get this healthy, enhanced water into more hands. That’s why we need you! Your support will give us the financial backing we need to kick our business into the next stratosphere by funding the production of 2 new flavors and allowing us to offer nationwide shipping. Why now? These flavors make us more attractive to grocery stores, coffee shops and bars because more flavors means more shelf space and more shelf space means more attention from consumers. All of which will results in more sales, which allows us to continue doing what we love - producing a truly healthy, enhanced water that makes you feel good - and is fun to drink! We created this drink for those looking for an alternative to the overly sugared, overly caffeinated, artificial and carbonated waters currently out there. Know anyone who's alcohol-free or trying out the paleo lifestyle? This is a great option for them too! 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

50K is our need, and to break it down, your money will go into purchasing quality organic ingredients, designing and printing new packaging that will help us be recognized as a cohesive 3 flavor, enhanced water brand, and completing production of the 2 new flavors that we’re mixing as we speak. A small portion of the proceeds will also go to purchase custom packaging which will allow us to offer nationwide shipping! Whoop!

What do you get? Super cool eslena gear and other fun stuff! We tried to get creative with our perks because we want you to get more than just a thanks for the contribution you're sending our way. Your support directly impacts the success of our business and we won't ever forget that!

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

We’ve already started working towards the goals described above so we’re happy to report that we’ve found suppliers that we want to use. Over the next few weeks, we will be finalizing our new recipes, working with specialists to define the manufacturing process needed to produce our new flavors on a large scale, and ordering enough of each ingredient, and related packaging material, needed to fill the order that we’re planning to run in December. 

What happens if we don't reach our goal? At the end of the day, it all comes down to what we can afford and, let's get real, cashflow for a new business like ours is tight! If necessary, we will consider reducing the size of our production run, only roll out 1 new flavor instead of 2, or get super creative in finding the remaining cash we need. So even if we don’t reach our goal, your donation will be used to achieve the same goals listed above. It just might take us a little longer to do everything.

Other Important Things

We know that you work hard to earn every dollar you have! If you can’t contribute monetarily, please consider sharing our campaign through your Facebook, Linkedin, Twitter or any other social media outlet that you have. Every person we can attract can help us get one step closer to reaching our goal.

THANK YOUS! 

Eslena would like to profusely thank the following people for their support and superhero skills that helped us get this campaign together:

column2: Editing Crew: Carissa Savage, Joshua Bogy

column1: • Actors: The Goddess: Natalie Caradonio, The Boss: Donna Rice, Eslena Man aka 'The Man': Kendall Hibdon, Beer man: Rob Ridgeway, Bartender: Rob Thornton, Beautiful Ladies (left to right): Susanna Thornton, Candace Comer, Kari Hibdon
• Location Love: The Grove on Manchaca (the best place to live in Austin!), 400 Rabbits Bar at Alamo Drafthouse, Slaughter Lane (the best bar in Austin)!

column2:
Stott extended families get an extra special shout out, without you, there would be no us, and without us there’d be no eslena – phew thank God for you guys!

And finally to you, our drinkers, supporters and backers … we love you soooooooooooo much! Your feedback, reviews and contributions keep us going, and to simply say 'thank you' does not come close to reflecting how grateful we are for each and every one of you!

TTFN xoxo

 -  Esther, Leanne &
column3:
Natalie

More about our PERKS:

Below is a copy of the amazing hummingbird print that Natalie drew by hand. More on it's meaning and why we find it special:
column4:
>""...Appearing out of nowhere, the Hummingbird springs joy in the heart, and there is magic in the air in this moment of fleeting serendipity. Iridescent color shimmering in the breeze, she pauses mid-air to drink deeply, the sweet nectar of life. Hummingbird is a symbol of all things good.""  - ref. universeofsymbalism.com

If you select this perk then you'll receive Natalie's hummingbird printed on an 8""x 8"" piece of wood (example of wooden print is also below).

Example of wooden print:

Wondering what we mean by transparent blue plastic visor? Your wait is over! It will look like this....except better because of our logo:

column2: >We keep stating the facts – and now the facts are obvious:
column3: >1 out of every 3 American families is impacted by the collateral consequences of mass incarceration. All Americans.
column4: >No matter how you look, where you live, or how exempt from this reality you feel yourself to be.
column6:
>Yet, the battle trenches are too shallow, the troops are spaced too far apart, and the odds against responsible and compassionate public policy continue to mount.

 

Like never before, now is the time to dig trenches TOGETHER

and tighten the strategic bonds between us.

Encourage and incubate every good idea.

Nurture every aspiring advocate.

Find common support for every noble action.

 

The National Incarceration Association, Inc is not the only comrade in the battle for responsible criminal justice reform. This appeal however, is to you for your generous support to help us plant our feet on more of a solid foundation to help lead this struggle.

 

Please respond with generosity and urgency!  Whatever you can click onto and donate now is critical.  Please visit the joinNIA.com website for more about who we are and how we fight.  Our project dashboard is full of dynamic actions that many expect us to push and make real.  But they will never move without your earnest and immediate support!

Then tune in for strategic coordinated action – one inclusive, yet assertive step at a time.  Listen to the appeals of other advocating organizations like you never have before. Pay attention to miss no clues.  Give to, communicate for, engage with, and help push those ready to take the lead among us – despite the odds
column7:
because of the odds.  

""It should be the highest ambition of every American to extend his views beyond himself, and to bear in mind that his conduct will not only affect himself, his country, and his immediate posterity
column8:
but that its influence may be co-extensive with the world, and stamp political happiness or misery on ages yet unborn.""    George Washington
