column1: We are scientists who see a positive and diverse future for Alberta and for Canada.
We are former colleagues who studied science together in university and became long-time friends who believe that the conversation around energy in Canada is polarized.
We are passionate believers in candid and open discussion. It is our hope that ENERGYminute will engage Canadians to have meaningful dialog that is constructive around energy and energy policy.
There are big questions out there across the political spectrum:
• How long will a shift to renewable energy take? 10 years? 50 years? 100?
• How do global energy markets impact us in Canada?
• Are electric cars actually coming and what are the benefits? Are there any consequences?
• If we want to meet emissions goals - what is the most likely energy source to get us there?

The progression of diversifying energy supply is important for Canada, but the discussion around our future can be a polarizing one.  We would like to create short, concise videos about energy that are interesting and easily digestible so that every Canadian can be properly informed, infographics, and reach out to energy workers in all sectors for informational interviews. We will post them on Facebook, YouTube, our website, and send them to bloggers, and other media outlets across our country.

We live in the age of technology and the internet. There is a lot of misinformation out there, but how can you tell what's true?  ENERGYminute will be a science-based conversation piece that reflects the policy and science behind energy.
These numbers are in USD. Your dollars will help cover the cost of video editing and production( ~3000/3-7+ videos), website upkeep($500), and purchase of AV equipment($1000).
We hope to foster constructive conversations about all types of energy with ENERGYminute.

California is the world leader in innovation. More startups and more venture capital are concentrated here than any other location. Yet the research institutions in the state could produce even more. The intellectual property generated within the state, at all of its combined universities, labs, and independent institutes, represents an engine for future jobs and growth.
+Regularly convening California's world-leading institutions to collaborate on commercial opportunities.
+Showcasing technologies and discoveries from these institutions.
+ Identifying opportunities to create more startups, spin-offs, and expanded economic impact resulting from California's institutions.
+Developing more custom workforce training partnerships for rapid response to urgent industry needs.
+ Identifying more opportunities to leverage federal dollars for expanded economic impact in collaboration with California's institutions.

Rich Rankin of Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory talks about shared goals among California's research labs and universities, including greater collaboration, increased commercialization, and more growth in cutting edge industries in California.
CTC Fellow Glyn Davis, Vice Chancellor at the University of Melbourne, talks about the important work of translating and commercializing more from California's great labs and universities.

CTC Fellow Bill Garner speaks up in support of the campaign to establish the foundation for advancing California technology, and its effort to improve translation and commercialization of discoveries from research institutions in the state.
+ Please help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with a simple click! See social media sharing tools in the top right corner of this page.

To push innovation and creativity in Vancouver WA and help the coworking community build out a new, larger location in the heart of Vancouver WA. By helping one small business, you help hundreds more.

A small business resource, and the first  coworking community in Vancouver WA. A collective of diverse companies, freelancers, remote workers, non-profits and other creative individuals, all working under one roof. Started by two regular dudes who couldn’t find a good shared office environment and refused to waste time commuting to Portland. They saw a need and decided to make it happen. Once they launched Columbia Collective it grew rapidly from 2 to 50 members, and it's continuing to grow. They quickly outgrew their first space and so, decided to make a move to a larger, more open facility, a place that can have an even bigger impact on our economy here in Vancouver.
• Flex desks, lounges, and a myriad of different working areas
• Choose to work sitting or standing with out sit/stand electronic desks or many bars.
• Conference rooms, meeting areas, and phone booths.
• Private offices, a kitchen, and a reading corner.
• Your choice of coffee, espresso machine, drip and more.

Most importantly it's a place where there is an open and supportive community for entrepreneurs to be able to go and fulfill their dreams, and do what they love, in a constructive and collaborative way.
There are enormous benefits to coworking, but why listen to us?  Hear what other organizations like the Huffington Post and GCUC have to say:
This infographic was crafted with love by Officevibe, the platform foremployee surveys to improve company culture and employee happiness.

Your generosity and support will help fuel innovation and creativity for many years to come. We'll be able to provide essentials like ergonomic chairs, electronic sit/stand desks, private phone booths, and a photo studio,
Your support means that you understand the good business leaders are risk takers and they should be encouraged and supported,
• Good office furniture is expensive, and we'd like to prove the best possible working environment, so that people can be happy and productive.

column2: steel offices custom furniture like bars, and conference table.

column1: • Creating an atmosphere where small businesses will feel around to invite their clients and prospects.

We admit it. We're a small local company brimming with a passion for economic development in our town, but without the large pockets of a corporation. That's why we are turning to the public for support.
• A 5200 Square foot building isn't easy to build out and furnish when you have to write checks out of your personal account, but that's exactly what we've been doing for the past 8 months.
• At the new space there will be 15 dedicated desk work stations, 7 private offices and 3 conference rooms,

Besides street-cred and the bragging rights associated with knowing you made something awesome happen, you'll get the good feeling that you did something right. An investment in the future of your town's economy is something you won't regret. In return for your generosity here are a few perks such as super rad and very limited T-Shirts, mugs, and stickers. You could also get your name engraved on our founders' wall, our website, or even on our store front.
(final mug style may differ from above)

Besides backing this campaign, spreading the word is the very next best thing you can do to help us reach our goal. Please take a moment and share this with anyone you think would support the growth of Vancouver's entrepreneurial and startup community.
Share our campaign link via email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Slack and any other social media platform. When you share, you maximize your impact!
What happens if this campaign makes more than its goal?

It's hard to imagine such a thing, however if that happens all of the proceed would simply go to pay off the fixtures, and go towards improving the existing space as well. The $15,000 we wish to raise from this campaign is a small portion of the actual costs of remodeling and improving this space in order to make it be place where people would want to com not work. We would put any extra funding to great use to pay for fixtures and other improvements to the existing space. And of course, ether is the real possibility of an East Vancovuer location opening up at some point, so additional funding could help get that off the ground, too!

At the new space there will be 15 dedicated desk work stations, 7 private offices and 3 conference rooms,

Besides street-cred and the bragging rights associated with knowing you made something awesome happen, you'll get the good feeling that you did something right. An investment in the future of your town's economy is something you won't regret. In return for your generosity here are a few perks such as super rad and very limited T-Shirts, mugs, and stickers. You could also get your name engraved on our founders' wall, our website, or even on our store front.
(final mug style may differ from above)

Besides backing this campaign, spreading the word is the very next best thing you can do to help us reach our goal. Please take a moment and share this with anyone you think would support the growth of Vancouver's entrepreneurial and startup community.
Share our campaign link via email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Slack and any other social media platform. When you share, you maximize your impact!
What happens if this campaign makes more than its goal?

It's hard to imagine such a thing, however if that happens all of the proceed would simply go to pay off the fixtures, and go towards improving the existing space as well. The $15,000 we wish to raise from this campaign is a small portion of the actual costs of remodeling and improving this space in order to make it be place where people would want to com not work. We would put any extra funding to great use to pay for fixtures and other improvements to the existing space. And of course, ether is the real possibility of an East Vancovuer location opening up at some point, so additional funding could help get that off the ground, too!",5.0,1,"1 Campaign

column2:
Canines is creating a dog daycare sanctuary staffed by Veterans

Lets pair our four-legged friends with Veterans in need and begin ""healing our heroes"".

Our Mission

Our mission is to heal our Veterans through a dog's loving companionship, help them rediscover themselves by giving them purpose again!
column5:
/>

 

We have over 1,100 Veterans in San Diego that are homeless and/or coping with PTSD.  Cammies &
column6:
Canines will help them transition and become productive citizens again.

Our Story

My name is Kalani Creutzburg.  I am a ten year Marine Corps Veteran and I know the struggles of depression, suicidal thoughts and homelessness first hand.  Upon return from my last deployment I found myself struggling.  With the help of fellow Marines, my family/friends, and resources I prevailed.  After getting back on my feet I looked at the challenges I endured and decided to do all I can to help other Veterans through their struggles.  

What we've accomplished so far
column9:
/>We started by using our own money and teamed up with other Veterans to manufacture dog leashes and collars.  We've been selling our products to raising money, building our brand amongst the community, and spread the word about our cause!  And we're excited to say that our products are now sold in several retail stores throughout San Diego.  The money we earn is used to distribute care packages to homeless Veterans containing new socks, new shirt, toothpaste, toothbrush, and a meal.

Soon afterwards, we began employing homeless Veterans by teaching them a new skill that's both safe and therapeutic -- sewing.  Our Veterans have been sewing dog toys using recycled military gear.  We call it ""repurposing with a purpose"" - turning donated uniforms into stuffed dog toys!  Just like we're repurposing used military items into something that's useful again, we're working hard to repurpose our homeless Veterans into a purposeful asset that our community needs and wants!

Our efforts have already been recognized by:

column1: • TV show ""Right This Minute!"" *watch video
• San Diego's Small Business Award Finalist (Cinderella Story)
• San Diego Chamber of Commerce Veteran's Honor Roll

column5:
>
 

A Veteran owned and operated organization - we refuse to leave another Veteran behind.  Through the use of our community of Veterans and supporters we now provide 24/7 crisis support,  1-on-1 mentoring teaching emotional intelligence and more.  There's still more we can do to help our Veterans.  The missing puzzle piece... a dogs loving companionship.

Studies have been done on the emotional benefits when Veterans interact with dogs.  The unconditional love that dogs provide can help Veterans overcome some of their challenges, fears and depression through playful, non-stress interaction, and loving dependency. 

Where we're headed next

We are opening a doggy daycare sanctuary operated by Veterans - taking care of dogs while simultaneously healing our Heroes!
column8:
/>

Our dog daycare 'sanctuary' will be a drug/alcohol free environment staffed by Veterans struggling with homelessness or coping with service-connected disabilities.   Our Veterans will have a place they belong,  a place to escape the harshness of the streets, and a place they'll be able to discover themselves again. 

Our dog daycare sanctuary will give them a place to be around fellow service members and to interact with loving canines from their community - giving them a greater sense of hope and being. 

Having a place for these men and women to feel loved and accepted is imperative in their growth and reintegration. With a sense of purpose and a job we can eliminate 3 evils:  boredom, vice, and poverty. 

How we're going to get there

We're creating a non-profit!  100% of the funds will be used to open the doors of our sanctuary, create jobs for our Veterans and help them find healing through a dog's loving companionship.
column11:
/>We're looking to raise $50,000.  Specifically, this will go toward:

1) Help pay for initial legal fees as we set up our non-profit designation.

2) Acquiring a property that's well suited for the sanctuary and a place where Veterans can come to get support and connection. (The sanctuary will be an indoor/outdoor facility and we'll need a relatively good sized yard as well as enough space to house dogs overnight for those who are blessing us for more than one day.)

3) Help finance the first 6 months of expenses.

We are asking for your help. Together we can change the lives of our Veterans in more ways than they can imagine. Help us raise the funding to accelerate the opening our first dog daycare sanctuary. Join our generous community, help raise funds and awareness, and come with us on this incredible journey!
column12: >Please pledge and consider contributing. Your contributions will go straight to making this project happen.  Every dollar counts in taking us a step closer. And in return, we want to thank you with one of our fantastic perks!  And we'll definitely be recognizing you amongst our community!!
column13: >*COSTS AND EXPENSES WILL  BE SENT TO DONORS FOR TRANSPARENCY*
column14:
>

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but still want to support Cammies &
column15: Canines Campaign. You can help us by:

column1: <li>Spreading the word among your friends and families and see if they want to contribute
column2: tell them every bit makes a difference! =)

column1: • Sharing and spreading the campaign on social media
• Writing to us at Kalani@cammiesandcanines.com if you feel like getting involved in any way
• Organizing fundraising events amongst your circle of influence!

Please contribute and help us accelerate the development of our dog daycare sanctuary and witness firsthand the positive impact we make!

Spread the word, get loud and make some noise about our campaign.

THANK YOU for joining us on this incredible journey! We're excited about building the Cammies &
column2:
Canines community into a large high impact force creating goodness for everyone!

Very respectfully,

Kalani Creutzburg

As a 15-year-old aspiring businessman, Clear Your Junk is my first business, and currently it is making a profit. I'm incredibly interested in business, and it's important to make markets as good as possible. This is where Clear Your Junk comes in, to help you make more money from your unwanted goods, and making sure that they find a new home. Facebook is a good selling tool, but to expand business further, a website which takes the business national with shipping and credit card payment automatic with the website is essential in my view. I have an incredible motivation to make this business work, and therefore this is why I would like to grow the business. A provisional website with not all features added as of yet is ready to publish and sell on, however the £10.10 a month that needs to be paid to Wix needs to be signed up for before e-commerce sales can be activated. Take a look: http://reviewtij12.wixsite.com/clearyourjunk
*£500 is the minimum that you can have as a target using IndieGogo, however using flexible funding means that I keep all funds raised in the 60 day period*

we could employ 13 youth  a week with one coffee bike
I am a 2016  Community solutions program global leader from Uganda, along with being an entrepreneur, Youth Coach and an Agriculturalist.

This idea thrives on the goal of operating an organic mobile coffee shop on wheels, owing to the coffee-bikes’ self operating mode, Coffee/snack lovers would access the finest hot beverages at the most unusual locations in daily or weekly markets at street corner, park and or for booked or catering s and events. The bike is equipped with a professional coffee maker machine (Portafilter)
column2: coffee grinder, juice squeezer and storage space and is a perfect full-value of a mobile shop business with low capital investment. It is environmentally friendly besides

column1: The mobile coffee bikes will be attached to one youth and he/she will work four hours per day Monday to Wednesday. There will be five shifts per day: shift one: 5:00-9:00Am, shift Two:  10:00 AM – 1:00Pm, shift three 2:00-5:00Pm, shift four 6:00-9:00Pm shift five 10:00-1:00Pm. This means that one Bike will be run by  5 youth a day and like wise for a Thursday to Saturday 5 youth employed.  There will only be a Sunday special team whose shift is hours, the Sunday special will have 3 shifts (5:00-10:00am, 11:00-4:00Pm and 5:00-10Pm shift. One bike on a Sunday will be run by 3 youth. With one Bikes we could employ 13 youth a weak, and 26 youth a month if they work fortnightly.
• To get started help us acquire one bike worth $2500.
• Your generosity will be recognized in our Donor list and Idea kick starters
• If we don't reach our Goal we will use it to purchase part of the units of the coffee bike - like micro wave, juice blender or coffee maker as we slowly assemble pieces for success.
• Creating Employment opportunity to 13 Youth a week and 26 Youth a month with a fortnight working schedule.
• Increase youth Capacity to work less hours and grow economically.
• The project will brake barriers and attitudes towards decent jobs.
• Provide direct Market for Agro-products- Coffee Beans, Vegetables and fruits
The project may have the following risks:
• Slow conception of the idea and support from backers, we will try to explain how unemployment is a huge gap in Uganda.
• Competition from established restaurants, we will mitigate this by building superior customer care.
• Sharing this page in your networks and social media.
• Pattern and be in our mailing list

Hello, my Name is Stephen Itiakorit, a community Solutions program leader from Uganda. I bring 9 years of  Livelihood work with civil society to this project along being a Visionary Entrepreneur,Mentor and a vocalist in Uganda, Africa.

As the government of Uganda together with Her development Partners is making strides in Improving Education Sector, my country has registered steady progress in quality and quantity of education leading a steep rise of 62% graduate employment. Estimates from Uganda Investment Authority indicate that 250,000 graduates are unemployed annually. This  has a huge influence of social and economic relationships making youth more vulnerable to poor working conditions, low wages, frustration and stigma as well as drug and alcohol abuse. Also because many are at home after graduation this is a discouragement to others in the education pipeline.

With the establishment of a social enterprise , I am convinced of  us building together with youth a local understanding of overcoming unemployement  for youth to use their talents credibility, share gifts to better their world, and be empowered to start up and manage business in a supportive, safe and Positive environment. The social enterprise will consist of a coffee shop with complimentary Wi-Fi and fresh graduate will work in shifts through Mobile coffee bike, Cart, Van and other aspects of the business with hands business management  mentorship and this business as well will serve as a social environment for them to work, hangout with friends and discuss ideas and opportunities. This is key in creating decent jobs and driving Uganda economic growth as many youth will be inspired and encouraged to put resources together, build relationships/networks and be responsible citizens hence reducing the unemployment gap.
I ask you to be kind and share with us through donating to this cause for No act of kindness is small.
• We need $35,000. This will be used to purchase Mobile coffee bike, Carts ,Van and renting office space. This amount to include account transaction charges.

• All our donors will get atomic spot to having their potrates pictures or Names , Dedication of spaces/rooms in name of them, thank you letters and pictures from direct beneficiaries, opportunity to visit the project, Progress reports and documentaries
• If we don't realize our fund Goal, we will prioritize the installation of the project as per the available funds and start with a coffee shop.
With this support we expect to change and touch lives in the following ways:
• We envision to employ 136 youth directly from this project using the 4 hourly shift work arrrangement and two shifts a week.
• Mentor at least 20 complementary business innovations to the project.
• 30% increase in confidence and attitudes of graduates about decent jobs and paying jobs
<li>Prior to my placement in the US exchange program, we Have been Mentoring Innovations in Kyangwali refugee settlement for soap making, Food crops value addition as seen below
The Picture Above shows some of the products  and innovation in Uganda as part of my former work during  a trade fare.
Because we together value transparency I fore see the following risks and obstacles  on our way to achieving our goal.

• Limited start up Funds  for modeling the project and I hope to overcome this through Fund prioritization by seeing it that the project will be scaled down to fit the resource basket. I also to hope to invest part of my savings in supporting installation of the project.
• I fore see youth attitude towards decent jobs, i hope to conduct visioning exercises in building teams and make the centre a friendly handout joint.
• High Initial operating cost is a mother risk as the enterprise but we will minimize costs as much as possible by getting to spend on that which need funds on.

• Competition from established enterprise and we will overcome this by investing our energy to honesty,integrity and competence of our team and products by making our products, environment and services simple but not fancy.
Yes  we also like you to share with us non-monetary donations and these could be:
• Sharing this page in your cycles using  this sight.
• Material donations ( coffee shop equipment and utensils, TV, Decoder, Wi-fi, art frames for donors, name tags, cables, music systems, tables, shelves, microwave, cooker ETC)
• Attending our future keynote  speaker  as part of our visioning events in Uganda.
• Technical mentoring and coaching of youth in Entrepreneurship.

We can't thank you enough as you reach out to our help.

Our Campaign

As a startup, our biggest obstacle can often be funding. The goal behind our campaign is to obtain enough funds to begin runs of our first product: the Chi Stick™ - our high-grade cannabis vape cartridge. Backers of this campaign who DONATE $100 OR MORE will also receive a voucher for a unique vape pen with custom packaging, cartridge and charger. Finally, your donation also helps fund our primary business: building America's cannabis aficionado's chain of store-fronts and products.

The CANNABIS CLASSIC Award Winning Chi Stick™

Our Chief Product Officer, master grower and owner of Alaska Thunder Skunk farms, Andrew Campbell won Cannabis Classic 1st place: Concentrates for the Chi Stick Lemon Delight vape cartridge.

 

Cheeky Monkey™ Product / Perks

 

Why A Vape Cartridge?
• Vaping is one of the quickest growing smoking markets worldwide. The majority of adults currently trend toward vaping and edibles over traditional smoking.
• Vaping is more health conscious, and less ""offensive"" to non-smoking crowds smoking option and is a quick effective method of public consumption for those entering the scene.

• Our vape cartridge oil is made of the highest grade (up to 60% or more) THC+CBD extracts: 100% Colorado made, tested, and produced. We believe the taste and experience is second to none in today's cannabis vape market!

• A Cheeky Monkey™ LoungeStore™ works as either a vape-only store, OR a vape and cannabis dispensary depending on what's legal in your state. You could open as vape only at first and expand to cannabis as legalization grows!

• At Cheeky Monkey™, we've made our brand our priority. We strive for all locations to be: friendly, open, bright, and community-minded environments that promote bringing cannabis into a socially acceptable format.
• Already have a location or store? Perfect! Converting your business to a Cheeky Monkey™ LoungeStore™ is a great way to expand your brand, your connections and your reach!
• Our Cheeky Monkey™ executive team has top-notch business and marketing experience in addition to cannabis grow and product experience - we know what it takes to launch a successful  business!
• Cheeky Monkey™ focuses on quality: we want visitors from novice users to cannabis experts to know they get the consistency, quality and care they want from every product and service we offer.

What Do You Get When You Participate?

Donations of any size help our cause greatly!

Hitting our goal of $150,000 will allow us to produce a full order of the Chi Stick™ which will not only fullfill orders for our backers, it will allow us to distribute this amazing product to local Colorado dispensaries and greatly speed up the goal of increasing our marketing funds in order to capture a large investment to open our flagship store in Denver, Colorado. This is your opportunity to say you helped make that goal happen!

All donators will be placed on the Cheeky Monkey membership list and initial backers will receive discounts and priority membership once our first location is opened. Backers who donate at our perk levels will also receive their items once our campaign is complete.

A Cheeky Monkey™ LoungeStore™ works as either a vape-only store, OR a vape and cannabis dispensary depending on what's legal in your state. You could open as vape only at first and expand to cannabis as legalization grows!

At Cheeky Monkey™, we've made our brand our priority. We strive for all locations to be: friendly, open, bright, and community-minded environments that promote bringing cannabis into a socially acceptable format.
Already have a location or store? Perfect! Converting your business to a Cheeky Monkey™ LoungeStore™ is a great way to expand your brand, your connections and your reach!
Our Cheeky Monkey™ executive team has top-notch business and marketing experience in addition to cannabis grow and product experience - we know what it takes to launch a successful  business!
Cheeky Monkey™ focuses on quality: we want visitors from novice users to cannabis experts to know they get the consistency, quality and care they want from every product and service we offer.

What Do You Get When You Participate?Donations of any size help our cause greatly!Hitting our goal of $150,000 will allow us to produce a full order of the Chi Stick™ which will not only fullfill orders for our backers, it will allow us to distribute this amazing product to local Colorado dispensaries and greatly speed up the goal of increasing our marketing funds in order to capture a large investment to open our flagship store in Denver, Colorado. This is your opportunity to say you helped make that goal happen!All donators will be placed on the Cheeky Monkey membership list and initial backers will receive discounts and priority membership once our first location is opened. Backers who donate at our perk levels will also receive their items once our campaign is complete.",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hi! I am Denise Muniz, Chief Alpha Dog, of Bad Dog Bistro. I have spent the past 10+ years as a nonprofit fundraising executive for various healthcare organizations and have successfully raised more than $50 million for these organizations. Previous to my nonprofit career, I worked in banking as a client manager, managing a $75 million client portfolio. Although I have had a very gratifying career, I have such a love and passion for both dogs &
column2: cooking that I knew I had something more to offer. When I discovered my current organization was going through a major consolidation, I decided it was time to pursue my dreams. My experience in banking and as a business executive will allow me to successfully run a business with fiscal transparency, strong projections, and a strategic business plan.

column1: A few months ago, my 6-month old German Shepherd, Moose, stopped eating the commercial dog food I was feeding him. I was desperate to get him to eat, as he was too skinny, so I was left to get creative. I tried all types of commercial dog food (dry, wet, ""fresh""), but nothing worked. He didn't want any of it. I also have a senior Pitbull/Border Collie mix, Guinness, who really never liked eating and was also underweight. Meanwhile, Bud (another senior mixed breed) would scarf up Moose &
column2: Guinness' food the minute I turned my back. Bud was becoming really obese, and my other dogs were too skinny.

column1: Desperate for a solution, I started searching the internet for answers &
column2: decided that I would cook food for all of my dogs. The change was immediate &amp
column3: amazing! All three dogs are so excited for their meals that I have to gate them out of the kitchen while I make their food. When I open the gate, it's a race to their bowls. Truly amazing! Bud is no longer obese, and both Moose &amp
column4: Guinness are back to normal weight. There are other notable changes. They drink only a third of the water they used to, as they are getting water from food. Also, they are digesting more food with the result being less poo!

column1: Seeing all of the positive effects homemade, all-natural dog food was having on my dogs helped me see there was a need to provide all-natural, homemade food to other dogs and Bad Dog Bistro was born. Along with the Bad Dog Bistro mobile Dog House, we will also be offering a monthly subscription service within the Greater Los Angeles Area that includes home delivery. My goal is a world filled with healthier, happier dogs! Good dogs are boring, and bad dogs need good food!
There are so many start-up costs relating to launching a business like this. Below, I have listed budgeted expenses that donations will support.
Bad Dog Bistro is launching in Los Angeles in June 2017. We will first launch in farmer's markets &
column2: flea markets throughout the city. Beginning in August, the Bad Dog's Bistro Dog House will be on the road. Please make sure you subscribe to our email list on the Bad Dog Bistro website, so you can be kept up-to-date on locations where we will be selling each week.

column1: People like cool stuff! I like cool stuff! You like cool stuff, so we are giving you cool Bad Dog Bistro stuff for every donation that is $25+. The higher the donation...the more cool stuff you get! Make a donation and get some cool stuff!

This is a huge project to launch, and I cannot do this without the support of my family and friends. Our dogs are part of our family. We do not have children...we have dogs. Like us, many of you have pets who are part of your family. It is important that we provide these family members with the highest quality food, in order for them to live long, happy, and healthy lives.

Bad Dog Bistro provides the nutrition our dogs need. Launching Bad Dog Bistro is the first step to creating a world filled with healthier, happier dogs. You can be an integral part of this exciting venture by making a donation today!

I know some of you are able to contribute more than others. So, those of you who can contribute more (you know who you are) - please contribute more! But seriously...contribute what you can. All donations help me get one step closer to putting Bad Dog Bistro on the road!
Can't contribute? No worries. There are a ton of other ways you can help!!! Below is a list of other ways to help launch Bad Dog Bistro.
<li>Share Bad Dog Bistro with your social media followers &amp
• Introduce me to people who can contribute and/or invest
<li>Volunteer - You don't have cash, but you have time? Perfect! <ul>
• Let me know the talents you can lend to the launch.
<li>Examples: staff a farmer's market boot with me
column2: volunteer to work on the truck for a day
column3: help me cook up batches of meals &amp
column5: help me market Bad Dog Bistro

column1:
I would like to thank each of you for taking the time to visit my fundraising page! And, to those who are able to contribute - THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! I cannot do this without your help. Please make sure to follow Bad Dog Bistro on social media (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook - @baddogbistro) to stay up-to-date on the launch and other exciting news!

 

Featured photo is design ideas for the Bad Dog Bistro mobile Dog House.

","Short Summary

Hi! I am Denise Muniz, Chief Alpha Dog, of Bad Dog Bistro. I have spent the past 10+ years as a nonprofit fundraising executive for various healthcare organizations and have successfully raised more than $50 million for these organizations. Previous to my nonprofit career, I worked in banking as a client manager, managing a $75 million client portfolio. Although I have had a very gratifying career, I have such a love and passion for both dogs & cooking that I knew I had something more to offer. When I discovered my current organization was going through a major consolidation, I decided it was time to pursue my dreams. My experience in banking and as a business executive will allow me to successfully run a business with fiscal transparency, strong projections, and a strategic business plan.

A few months ago, my 6-month old German Shepherd, Moose, stopped eating the commercial dog food I was feeding him. I was desperate to get him to eat, as he was too skinny, so I was left to get creative. I tried all types of commercial dog food (dry, wet, ""fresh""), but nothing worked. He didn't want any of it. I also have a senior Pitbull/Border Collie mix, Guinness, who really never liked eating and was also underweight. Meanwhile, Bud (another senior mixed breed) would scarf up Moose & Guinness' food the minute I turned my back. Bud was becoming really obese, and my other dogs were too skinny.

Desperate for a solution, I started searching the internet for answers & decided that I would cook food for all of my dogs. The change was immediate & amazing! All three dogs are so excited for their meals that I have to gate them out of the kitchen while I make their food. When I open the gate, it's a race to their bowls. Truly amazing! Bud is no longer obese, and both Moose & Guinness are back to normal weight. There are other notable changes. They drink only a third of the water they used to, as they are getting water from food. Also, they are digesting more food with the result being less poo!

Seeing all of the positive effects homemade, all-natural dog food was having on my dogs helped me see there was a need to provide all-natural, homemade food to other dogs and Bad Dog Bistro was born. Along with the Bad Dog Bistro mobile Dog House, we will also be offering a monthly subscription service within the Greater Los Angeles Area that includes home delivery. My goal is a world filled with healthier, happier dogs! Good dogs are boring, and bad dogs need good food!
There are so many start-up costs relating to launching a business like this. Below, I have listed budgeted expenses that donations will support.

Bad Dog Bistro is launching in Los Angeles in June 2017. We will first launch in farmer's markets & flea markets throughout the city. Beginning in August, the Bad Dog's Bistro Dog House will be on the road. Please make sure you subscribe to our email list on the Bad Dog Bistro website, so you can be kept up-to-date on locations where we will be selling each week.

People like cool stuff! I like cool stuff! You like cool stuff, so we are giving you cool Bad Dog Bistro stuff for every donation that is $25+. The higher the donation...the more cool stuff you get! Make a donation and get some cool stuff!

This is a huge project to launch, and I cannot do this without the support of my family and friends. Our dogs are part of our family. We do not have children...we have dogs. Like us, many of you have pets who are part of your family. It is important that we provide these family members with the highest quality food, in order for them to live long, happy, and healthy lives.

Bad Dog Bistro provides the nutrition our dogs need. Launching Bad Dog Bistro is the first step to creating a world filled with healthier, happier dogs. You can be an integral part of this exciting venture by making a donation today!

I know some of you are able to contribute more than others. So, those of you who can contribute more (you know who you are) - please contribute more! But seriously...contribute what you can. All donations help me get one step closer to putting Bad Dog Bistro on the road!
Can't contribute? No worries. There are a ton of other ways you can help!!! Below is a list of other ways to help launch Bad Dog Bistro.
Share Bad Dog Bistro with your social media followers & friendsTwitter: @baddogbistro
Introduce me to people who can contribute and/or invest
Volunteer - You don't have cash, but you have time? Perfect!
Let me know the talents you can lend to the launch.

We are a group of young professionals with more than 15 years of experience in the tourism sector. After launching a successful boutique digital agency for the travel and tourism industry we noticed something was missing. Puerto Rico and the Caribbean was in need of new tourism product. On 2015, Local Guest was conceived as an idea for economic development, a new digital platform that curates tourism experiences and connects travelers to genuine experience hosts. We want to diversify Puerto Rico’s tourism product and foster economic development but on September 20th, 2017 Hurricane Maria hit Puerto Rico and brought great devastation so the team has decided to shift its goal toward relief efforts.
The Local Guest team is developing a Three Phase Relief effort to rebuild a new sustainable Puerto Rico.

1. Relief: We will work on providing food, clean water and cleaning crews to hard-hit communities that haven't received any aid. Create mobile food-drives, clean key streets for safe passage and provide medical attentions to families that have loss greatly after the Category 4 hurricane hit.

2. Sustainability: Provide educational workshop for the sustentable growth of the community. Some would include: health, nutrition, CPR, survival skills, meditation, dealing with PTSD, solar power, recycling, home gardens, and so on.
2. Bloom: We will provide new sustainable tourism experiences in conjunction with voluntourism opportunities for travelers seeking ways to help and connect with communities.

These new travelers seek inspiration and the opportunity to help and a bit of self-discovery in everything they do.  Experience tourism is not just born from the need to evolve beyond mass tourism and create an authentic connection to the destination, but is also based on the sustainable development of everybody involved and the strengthening of communities.
Our hosts are passionate experts that are eager to showcase our beautiful island.
Meet Our Hosts Chapter 1 from Local Guest on Vimeo.

Our business model uses as a starting point the development of experiences in island municipalities with the most distressing poverty levels. In conjunction with the area host, we seek to develop authentically local tourism experiences that stimulate visitor traffic and generate employment. With your contribution we will be able to provide relief efforts, long-term sustainability and new economic development for the island.
We need funding to be able to deploy our relief efforts as soon as possible. People need our help and are desesperate for a ray of hope.
What we will use our money for:
- Food: non-perishable and prepared food will be delivered. We are also buying crops from local farmers that have to sell before they go bad and to help them rebuild
- Gas/Diesel: To move our trucks to hard to reach areas
- Biodegradable plates and utensils to diminish the waste and bio-waste
- Professional: Any professional personal we may need to efficiently provide aid
All of our perks are experience related, check them out!
Even if we don't reach our goal the funding will be allocated to mostly food and water.

Local Guest has been a year and a half of hard work and building relationships but now we need your help to help these beautiful communities we have grown to love. The world needs sustainable tourism were locals and travelers interact to broaden their horizons and create bridges for the future.
Please donate and help us in rebuilding a better Puerto Rico for the future.

Our main challenges are the political and financial uncertainty of the island but with projects like Local Guest we know we can generate a foundation for hands on, proactive relief. Since the beginning of this project we have been in contact with industry stakeholders (hoteliers, small inns, DMC, associations, tourism boards, and so on) and local non-profits that will ensure a more seamless and less burocratic way of bringing aid direclty to those who need it.
If you can't help us financial at least share our campaign video and our website so that more can contribute to our sustainable growth! Wander with us!

Thank you for taking the time to read about my business venture. A little about me and what qualifies me for this company.

I have worked at a local cat rescue the past year doing care taking, working the foster program and helping with advocacy in the community to make our shelters no kill. While we have had great success, there are still cats being euthanized daily that are adoptable.

My dream is to open a Cat Café Wine Bar. This will be a great place to relax and enjoy the company of cats that have been rescued from the local shelters. My goal is to get cats off the euthanasia list that are adoptable and give them a second chance in an open adoption area. They will live here and be loved and pampered by fellow cat lovers in the community while the humans relax and unwind with wine. I will offer adoptions as well as foster opportunities. This will be unlike any other cat café and also help the community by rescuing more cats that may not have had a chance.

In order to make this dream work, there will be two parts to my business. One will be the for profit wine bar and the other will be a non-profit cat adoption center. First, building needs to be funded, the rest is easy but I CAN'T DO IT WITHOUT YOU!

Short Summary

Global Dialogue Foundation (GDF) is supporting the Lopit people in this endeavour. GDF initiates and promotes dialogue among communities to support improving lives, particularly in developing countries. GDF is Associated with DPI (UN), works in collaboration with UN Alliance of Civilizations, local governments and businesses around the world to strengthen the citizen sector and build intercultural, inclusive and sustainable societies.

This campaign aims to build a primary healthcare centre in Longiro, which is located in the Western Lopit Mountains, South Sudan - a peaceful, yet undeveloped area. Lopit community members (20) now living in Australia have outlined and are implementing an action plan, starting with the goal to end avoidable death and suffering for mothers and children during birth.

The mortality rate in the Lopit Mountains is currently 1 out of 7 women during childbirth, and 35% of children before  reaching age 5. Your contribution will significantly lower this rate.

What We Need &
column2: What You GetThe Lopit community needs $60,000 to buy the materials and an ambulance and to build the centre. Here's a breakdown of the equipment needed for this phase:

column1:
• $35, 000 - Construction materials
    Cement, iron sheets, timbers, wheelbarrow, metal spades, roofing nails, big nails,  doors, H2 water tanks, fencing and barbed wire, jembe, axe, hammer, panga, tables, jerrycans, plastic bags, generators, iron bars, racks, agricultural water tube, digging bars, solar panels &
column2: equipment, tape measure, hand-saw, paint, pipes, fittings,

column1: • $3,000 - Transport of materials (from Kenya and Uganda)

In case of not reaching our entire goal, the funds will go towards each of the next stages of the healthcare center construction. E.g., the bricks are ready and land (500mtrs X 450mtrs) is allocated. The next stage  is to buy the cement and build the center. Then the roof.. etc.,  and we will continue, using all funds received to build each of the next stages.

If the funds received exceed the target, then we will proceed with Stage 2, which is to construct a classroom for primary education in Longiro. Approximately 200 children are currently learning English in an outdoor classroom.

The Impact

Primarily, you will help reduce the mortality rate. However, we anticipate your contribution support development in the Lopit Mountain region. This includes reducing the mortality rate for all 57 villages in the region, building schools, establishing rehabilitation centers for people suffering from Leprosy, developing farming and agriculture to improve food security and establish financial sustainability.
Several NGO's are operating aid projects in the Lopit Mountains. These include UNICEF, Save The Children, Norwegian Church Aid and Association for Aid &
column2: Relief, Japan. Your contribution will encourage and help to stimulate all efforts.

column1: By contributing, you will play an important role in helping save and give life to people in the Lopit.
The violence that erupted on 15 December 2013 between armed forces
loyal to President Salva Kiir and armed forces loyal to Former Vice President Riek
Machar in Juba, the capital city of South Sudan, has resulted in numerous challenges
to government programs, including reform of the country's poor healthcare
Despite making significant gains in promoting awareness of
health and wellness in South Sudan, preventable diseases remain a serious
issue. Malaria is one of the country's biggest problems, with thousands of
children dying daily from this treatable disease. Although rates of HIV and
AIDS infection have slowed in recent years, many families are impacted by these
Also poor sanitation in the  Lopit Mountain areas and the lack of
affordable medication further contributes to the spread of disease, and many women

and children do not have access to even basic medical treatment.

A key challenge will be to provide trained healthcare staff and/ or volunteers on the ground. Although there's lots of goodwill for providing this support, it is yet to be confirmed.

Another challenge will be to ensure that equipment shipped can be used and ongoing supply sustained. Plans to develop agriculture as a means for building sustainability are also in the initiative stage.
The exciting aspect though is that this project is being driven and implemented by the Lopit Community itself. Primarily, it is their 'determination' driving it forward to help their motherland.

For at least a couple of years, the Lopit Community in Australia has been building its network, presenting the situation to various organisations and is receiving ongoing support. As a result of these efforts in 2012, a 40' container of supplies was loaded in Melbourne and shipped to the Lopit Mountains. It contained:
<li>Food items (including rice, lentils, milk powder, beans, tuna, oil, sugar
• Kitchenware (cooking utensils and pots, bowls and cups)
• Cloth/fabric (of any sort, that can be made into clothing)
• Organic seed for grain and vegetable crops
• Hand tools for agriculture and also for building

The Lopit Community in Australia raised an initial $8,000 and sent 3 representatives to the Lopit area to assess the situation and return with their findings. This entire project is based on moving in the direction of development as determined by the Lopit people, and coupled with support garnered in Australia and partnerships established with international organisations, are major factors for overcoming these and other hurdles along the way.

A variety of approaches for solving these challenges and saving lives in Lopit region include:

• Major health interventions will work even in the poorest remote areas of Lopit by building healthcare and schools facilities across the region and train members of Lopit community to manage the system and Providing universal healthcare access to all women and children.

• Involvement of volunteers from around the world will play significant role in lowering mortality rate in the peaceful region of Lopit Mountain. Your involvement as a volunteer is very important to set a good example that will lead to success for locals to follow.

• Introduction of programs in many forms, e.g, health awareness, workshops across the region and adequate funding from both international and local sources for improving women and children’s access to healthcare and education.

• Good management on the ground and effective use of information will decrease the risk of infection to slow down the spread and decreasing vulnerability to reduce risk and impact. Sustainable Donor funding will save lives and money
• Partnerships with Lopit community, NGOs, and private companies can be powerful.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Lopit Community in Australia raised an initial $8,000 and sent 3 representatives to the Lopit area to assess the situation and return with their findings. This entire project is based on moving in the direction of development as determined by the Lopit people, and coupled with support garnered in Australia and partnerships established with international organisations, are major factors for overcoming these and other hurdles along the way.A variety of approaches for solving these challenges and saving lives in Lopit region include:

Major health interventions will work even in the poorest remote areas of Lopit by building healthcare and schools facilities across the region and train members of Lopit community to manage the system and Providing universal healthcare access to all women and children.

Involvement of volunteers from around the world will play significant role in lowering mortality rate in the peaceful region of Lopit Mountain. Your involvement as a volunteer is very important to set a good example that will lead to success for  locals to follow.

Introduction of programs in many forms, e.g, health awareness, workshops across the region and adequate funding from both international and local sources for improving women and children’s access to healthcare and education.

Good management on the ground and effective use of information will decrease the risk of infection to slow down the spread and decreasing vulnerability to reduce risk and impact. Sustainable Donor funding will save lives and money
Partnerships with Lopit community, NGOs, and private companies can be powerful.
Other Ways You Can Help If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:  Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns

column2: >During last weekend, some vandals ripped the mirrors off of the Horsham Sea Cadets' minibus.
>This has rendered the van illegal to road-use meaning the group cannot attend any of the events they were due to go as a group.
>Please help us by giving generously to enable the vehicle to be repaired and if possible a temporary vehicle hired for events over the next couple of weeks until the repair is possible.

column1: The first Sea Cadet unit was established in 1854 at Whitstable in Kent, created by communities wanting to give young people instruction on a naval theme. Traditionally old seafarers provided training while local businessmen funded the Unit Headquarters.

The tradition of community - based Sea Cadet Units continues today with 400 across the UK each with charitable status enabling them to raise funds to meet their running costs. All Units are members of the Sea Cadet Corps and are governed by the national charity MSSC - the Marine Society &

We work partnership with the Royal Navy under a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) and receive corporate support from commercial shipping companies and the Maritime sector. Our core purpose is to celebrate Britain's maritime heritage and contribute to its future development by supporting young people as Sea Cadets.

Horsham unit is based in Broadbridge Heath on the outskirts of Horsham.  Our cadets come from a range of towns and villages around the region including Billingshurst, Slindon and Roffey as well as Horsham.

A year ago, when we made the decision to buy The Olive Leaf, we were already loyal customers and fans, and we knew it would be the perfect marriage with our other business, Peacetree Mountain Truffles.
But we didn't know how much we would fall in love with The Olive Leaf and its customers as we progressed through the year. We can't imagine loving what we do any more than this!

From working on new recipes, to educating people on how healthy (as well as tasty!) our oils and balsamics are, to packing a custom box of truffles, to helping people pick out the perfect gift and then shipping it for them - we love every single part of this business.
We believe we offer the best tasting, highest quality oils, balsamics, and chocolates you can find in America today! We are passionate about what we sell and won't compromise on that ever!
Our Reputation has grown and brought us a new opportunity!

We have been asked by a major retail center to come to the west side of Indianapolis and open another store there. They have nothing like what we offer anywhere on the west side, and they want it. We would be part of the center's campaign to bring in quality, locally owned businesses that will be interspersed with major retailers.
We are thrilled about this! Being able to introduce a whole new set of customers to our products makes us proud and excited.

You can see we have a lot of work to do! For the store itself, a little paint and some new carpet squares will put the look of the store right where we want it. (See our photo gallery for more detailed descriptions and pictures of what we have planned.) But you can also see from the pictures that it's just an empty space!

So, to make this new store a reality, we need a little help. We have everything else covered, but we need to outfit the store with all the trimmings that make our store here in Bloomington so much fun to walk into.

We need a checkout counter, tables, and silver fustis for all of the products so everyone there can enjoy the experience of tasting our fresh product straight from the tap as they browse through the store. And of course, we need the fresh oils and balsamics to fill those fustis up! Opening inventory is a huge challenge!
We want to be open in the new location by the end of August!

We're asking your help to raise $12,000 over the next 30 days, to complete opening the new store. This amount only represents a part of our startup costs (such as licenses, permits, leasing, remodeling the existing space, adding a chocolate counter, etc.) and it's all we need to finish realizing a beautiful, inviting space where a whole new group of people can come to know and love our exquisite oils, balsamics, and truffles.
But we're not just asking for your money - we want you to get great value for yourself! So we've put together some great savings for you as well as some special treats we don't normally carry!

column2: >EVERYONE who donates to our project will get a personal invitation to attend our Pre-opening private party at the new store where we will unveil our new space and will be serving food, drawing for great door prizes, and more!
>We have discounts on our gift certificates - good for anything in our store
column3: oils, balsamics, truffles, pastas, seasonings, Indiana products like Noodles, Mustards, and BBQ sauces.

column2: >We have savings on our ever popular sample bottles - redeem them all now, or spread them out over a year!
>We have a Limited Edition Holiday Truffle Collection - brand new for 2015. The
column4: >Collection will feature a truffle for each of the 12 Days of Christmas song. 8 Maids a Milking = smooth, soft milk chocolate truffle. 6 Geese a Laying - what are they laying? Eggs = Creamy Eggnog Truffle. 3 French Hens = French Silk Truffle. 1 truffle for each of the 12 Days as well as 4 classic Peppermint Truffles rounds out this 16 piece truffle collection. Unique and delicious, this Truffle Collection will be packaged in a special Christmas box and is perfect for gift giving. Reserve yours now!

column2: >And we have some extra special bottles of prized gourmet balsamic in special bottles, imported straight from Italy!  Read about this highly prized imported Balsamic below.

column1: The Traditional Balsamic we carry in the store is absolutely delicious! But have you ever tasted a rich, thick, syrupy balsamic that's been aged for 25 years in casks made of oak, chestnut, mulberry, cherry, ash, and juniper, each one yielding a particular aroma to the vinegar, rendering it unique? This is one perk you won't want to miss!

""Aged Balsamic Vinegar of Reggio Emilia must come directly from the pressing of grapes traditionally cultivated in the Reggio Emilia province. This prized balsamic is extraordinarily complex and possesses an intricate layering of flavors that represents generations of craftsmanship and respects rigorous traditions.
<div>Rare and unequaled, a few drops will add glorious flavors to sauces, cheeses, and salads. Those who prefer savories will relish it with
their best, mature cheese. Dessert lovers will savor its combination with custard cream, chocolate desserts, ice cream, fruits, and as the supreme ingredient in fillings for panettone and strudel.

To experience the full complexity of its noble and highly intense combination of perfumes and scents, try some on its own in a small glass: it should be sipped like a wine for meditation at the end of a meal. ""

Our perks are fabulous and we have learned how much you love our bargain days! So we anticipate raising more than our initial goal, and have thought ahead and committed to some further business enhancements.
OUR ADDITIONAL FUNDING GOALS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:

1. Stretch Goal - an additional $5000. If our perks prove popular, meeting our stretch goal will allow us to purchase a larger chocolate tempering machine, which our head chocolatier would LOVE! It would go a long way towards helping her keep up with the demand for truffles for 2 stores! We fully expect the truffles to be as popular up there as they are down here and know she will be extremely busy. She never complains, but we would certainly love to be able to buy this for her!

It's been a great year, learning the ropes and getting to know all of our fabulous customers - and we mean that from the bottom of our hearts. We have the BEST customers in the world and that's what makes owning The Olive Leaf so fun and rewarding.
So we want to say ""Thanks"" right now to everyone for helping us with our expansion! We can't do it without you and we appreciate you more than we could ever convey!
We are blessed to know all of you.

A year ago, when we made the decision to buy The Olive Leaf, we were already loyal customers and fans, and we knew it would be the perfect marriage with our other business, Peacetree Mountain Truffles.

We are thrilled about this! Being able to introduce a whole new set of customers to our products makes us proud and excited.

You can see we have a lot of work to do! For the store itself, a little paint and some new carpet squares will put the look of the store right where we want it. (See our photo gallery for more detailed descriptions and pictures of what we have planned.) But you can also see from the pictures that it's just an empty space!

So, to make this new store a reality, we need a little help. We have everything else covered, but we need to outfit the store with all the trimmings that make our store here in Bloomington so much fun to walk into.

We need a checkout counter, tables, and silver fustis for all of the products so everyone there can enjoy the experience of tasting our fresh product straight from the tap as they browse through the store. And of course, we need the fresh oils and balsamics to fill those fustis up! Opening inventory is a huge challenge!
We want to be open in the new location by the end of August!

We're asking your help to raise $12,000 over the next 30 days, to complete opening the new store. This amount only represents a part of our startup costs (such as licenses, permits, leasing, remodeling the existing space, adding a chocolate counter, etc.) and it's all we need to finish realizing a beautiful, inviting space where a whole new group of people can come to know and love our exquisite oils, balsamics, and truffles.
But we're not just asking for your money - we want you to get great value for yourself! So we've put together some great savings for you as well as some special treats we don't normally carry!

EVERYONE who donates to our project will get a personal invitation to attend our Pre-opening private party at the new store where we will unveil our new space and will be serving food, drawing for great door prizes, and more!
We have discounts on our gift certificates - good for anything in our store

and with your help, I will continue developing my loc expertise and expand my services to all natural hair including: loose natural hair, braids, twists, and extensions!

I Loc'ed my hair when I was 16 and have been a champion of quality care for black hair ever since! Once I moved to Philadelphia for college, I began doing locs all around the city and now as a graduate, I am relaunching Joi's Locing Services to better accommodate the variety of clients that I will have the privilege to work with!

column3:

South Africa to work for a whole year at Kwa.Mama Care Center, a community
center in the township Shakashead. Kwa.Mama runs a free preschool,  a
soup kitchen for the elderly and the fragile people and developed a youth program.
Among all the people I met, one boy immediately gained my special attention
because he was in need of more help than the others: Ghawe, the wild child.
He was only a toddler when he showed
up at the center for the first time. Years ago he came to the gate, with barely
any clothes on. Nobody could come near him. He would always eat his food very
quickly, on a safe distance from everybody. But after a while he started to
come more often. He began to trust our place. He started playing with the
others. He even started to wash himself.
Since a month he doesn't go to 'home' anymore. We learned that the shoes
column5: > we had given to him, had been sold by

column1: his own grandmother. We heard that at 'home' he had to sleep on the ground,
without a blanket. We saw him swallowing a whole bread on his way home. We
discovered that he is being beaten very often.
us the permission to keep Ghawe here at Kwa.Mama. We talked to his mother
who lives far away, in the Eastern Cape. At this moment in her life she can't
take fully responsibility for Ghawe. But Ntombi didn't need much time
to decide that she wanted to be his foster mother.
room number ten, together with her children Vusi of ten years old,  Themba, who
is six, and Nomonde, fifteen. She's a single mother who works at Kwa.Mama
during the day. At Kwa.Mama she does not earn any money, but works for tokens.
These tokens can be exchanged every friday for tins of food or second hand
clothes that are being donated to us very often. Two days a week she works
outside to do some mowing for a bus company, to earn some money. After her work
she goes to the evening school: she wants to get her diploma and later go on
with studying to become a nurse. But actually, she already is a nurse. She
is the running force of our home care program, she looks after the sick and old
people of this community . And since July she also looks after our six year old
I want to give Ghawe a home,
a safe and clear structure where he can grow. During the day he attends our
preschool till he can go to primary school. In the evenings he lives with his
new family. He learns to follow the rules, learns to share, to listen, to
financially in this task. With a small amount of money her life would be so
much easier. She wouldn't have to worry how to feed her family every evening.
With this help, I believe that Ntombi will be able to stay at Kwa.Mama and
would not have to leave on the hunt for another job. So, with this campaign you also support the old and fragile people of Shakashead.
fifty euro for the daily expenses. This means I would need six hundred euro for
a whole year. The rest of the money serves to be able to pay extras, like a
school uniform or some money for traveling, so Ghawe can visit his mother

column5: >Upon my return in Belgium, I will

column1: keep following Kwa.Mama closely. Everybody who supports this campaign,
will be informed by my blog, saravanderstappen.wordpress.com. I will send you by mail an invitation to subscribe so you will get the new posts. In that way you'll be able to see that even a
little amount of money can make a huge difference.
up to support Ghawe and Ntombi during a whole year. But of course it won't
end there. If more money is raised, than needed for one year, it will  be used the year after.

column1: It seems like every week we add something new or improve her in some way, and she's a rolling rocking pizza-making, appetite-kidnapping, fire breathing and parading machine.

With her support ship the ""Jalape-Nina II"" in tow we are able to cook 4 pizzas at a time, preparing them on 30+ sq/ft of stainless steel folding integrated work table space, and she is capable of serving hundreds of slices a shift.

In 2014 we were fortunate to be invited by Katrina Brees to join the Krewe of Kolossas art bicycles as they paraded with the Krewe of Muses for Mardi Gras 2013.  Muses is hands down one of the most popular and our favorite Mardi Gras parade, and we went again this year.  Both times we've had the time of our lives, and this year we brought a new guy with us.

The most recent addition was when Sir Bartholomew ""Iron Jaw"" El Fuego joined our Krewe.  ""Iron Jaw Bart"" as we call him, was born in an Obtainium Mine and raised to manhood by the hand of Andres Alchemy, and he's a magnificent Pirate.

column16: >Once Ironjaw Bart joined our Krewe,. we immediately upgraded him to include fire blazing through his skull.  We fitted him to ride on the bow for Parade days, and act as a hand warmer for our customers when we're out.  If you pull his trigger, he gets a little ""fiery""

column6: >This year for the Krewe of Muses Parade, it was like having a volume control for the crowd, I'd pull the trigger, Bart's head would go ablaze, and the crowd would ROAR!
>One of our rewards is a ""Petite Bartholomew"" votive holder we're crafting just for our backers.

column5: >This campaign is for $50,000.00, and our project objectives are to build a Bike Shop Pizza Kitchen and expand our fleet of Pizza Ships.

column1: • We've taken over the lease at the existing bicycle shop location where The Pizza Maria was created, negotiated the use of an additional 700+ sq/ft of outdoor area adjacent to the building.  We plan to build out a full service Pizzeria Kitchen with seating for 12 inside.  We will also be building an outdoor covered area to accommodate seating for 30, a meat grilling and smoking area, and utility area for Pizza Ship storage.  After we build the kitchen, we plan to include take out and delivery service.    We already own a mixer, a double Deck Blodget 5 ft Pizza Oven, Refrigeration, and a majority of the every day equipment to operate.  Most of the budget is in the construction and permitting of the project.  90% of Budget
<ul><li> Build 2 support ""vessels"" as the next ships in our fleet
column2:
1 Hybrid Human/Electric powered Tricycle Pirate Tow Ship, 1 BBQ Treasure Chest Pirate Trailer Ship like the Jalapa-Nina to tow behind it, .  This would increase the current cooking capacity by 2 additional pizzas for a total of 6 pizzas cooking simultaneously, averaging 3-7 minutes per cook cycle, depending on the temperature outside and wind.  It would also double the amount of food we could pedal into an event with the on board storage built into the design.  With this addition we could be setup on the street AND at a private event, with Pirate ships in both places, going where Food Trucks cannot, but bikes can, like your back yard party.  Pirates like to be flexible. 10% of Budget
We anticipate creating an additional 3-6 full time jobs and 3-5 part time jobs with this project, depending on business activity and special event requirements.

column1: This is our first Crowdfunding Project, and we have other visions for the growth of our business including bigger better Pirate Pizza Ships and delivery ships that cook your pizza in front of your house,, but this storefront is where we will launch those projects from.  This is a unique and symbiotic combination of 2 traditional business concepts into one model that is like Pirate Pizza Nola, a New Orleans original.

column5:
>Our Perks include Pizza, T-shirts, Hoodies, Parade Throws, Original Artwork, Custom Pirate Bikes, Catering, and Amazing Experiences.  Check them out, we've got something for everyone.

Please remember to share this campaign with your friends and family!

column1:
Unleash the inner Pirate in You, and become supporter today!


","Pirate Pizza Nola, LLC is a New Orleans pop-up pizzeria and mobile food vendor, and we're building a storefront as unique as our Food Bike.  We've put Pirates, Pizza, Bikes, and Parading together and into a truly innovative Mobile Food solution and experience that is as Artistic, Creative, Delicious, and Fun as the Creswcent City, and now we want to build a Bike Shop Pizzeria, Bakery, & Cafe business concept.

First off, our Pizza is delicious.  Like ridiculously good.  We hand make Roma style pizzas with a ""razor thin"" crust, robust original recipe sauces, slow smoked BBQ and specialty meats, a 4 cheese blend, and fresh market produce.  Check out our website for menus and our Facebook page for the latest updates & more.  We also cater a wide variety of menu options.

We got our first start in 2012 at one of the best reviewed craft cocktail/neighborhood dive bars in New Orleans, ""Twelve Mile Limit"" in Mid City, thanks to owner T. Cole Newton and Chef Chris Shortall (Now at Latitude 29 in Nola), and we still do Sunday nights at Twelve Mile Limit from 6-10.

Pirate Pizza Nola has also popped up at some of the best neighborhood bars in New Orleans like Pals Lounge in Mid City, BJ's in the Bywater, & outside the R Bar in the Marigny.  We've been well received and well reviewed, and both locals and visitors love our product.

Pirate Pizza Nola is the creator and home of the world's first ""Tricycle Pirate Pizza Ship "" that is shown in our videos.  Her nameless bones rolled out 2 years ago this last New Years, and since then she's evolved  into ""The Pizza Maria"", you can see in our pictures and videos.
It seems like every week we add something new or improve her in some way, and she's a rolling rocking pizza-making, appetite-kidnapping, fire breathing and parading machine.

With her support ship the ""Jalape-Nina II"" in tow we are able to cook 4 pizzas at a time, preparing them on 30+ sq/ft of stainless steel folding integrated work table space, and she is capable of serving hundreds of slices a shift.

In 2014 we were fortunate to be invited by Katrina Brees to join the Krewe of Kolossas art bicycles as they paraded with the Krewe of Muses for Mardi Gras 2013.  Muses is hands down one of the most popular and our favorite Mardi Gras parade, and we went again this year.  Both times we've had the time of our lives, and this year we brought a new guy with us.

The most recent addition was when Sir Bartholomew ""Iron Jaw"" El Fuego joined our Krewe.  ""Iron Jaw Bart"" as we call him, was born in an Obtainium Mine and raised to manhood by the hand of Andres Alchemy, and he's a magnificent Pirate.

Once Ironjaw Bart joined our Krewe,. we immediately upgraded him to include fire blazing through his skull.  We fitted him to ride on the bow for Parade days, and act as a hand warmer for our customers when we're out.  If you pull his trigger, he gets a little ""fiery""
This year for the Krewe of Muses Parade, it was like having a volume control for the crowd, I'd pull the trigger, Bart's head would go ablaze, and the crowd would ROAR!
One of our rewards is a ""Petite Bartholomew"" votive holder we're crafting just for our backers.
This campaign is for $50,000.00, and our project objectives are to build a Bike Shop Pizza Kitchen and expand our fleet of Pizza Ships.

We've taken over the lease at the existing bicycle shop location where The Pizza Maria was created, negotiated the use of an additional 700+ sq/ft of outdoor area adjacent to the building.  We plan to build out a full service Pizzeria Kitchen with seating for 12 inside.  We will also be building an outdoor covered area to accommodate seating for 30, a meat grilling and smoking area, and utility area for Pizza Ship storage.  After we build the kitchen, we plan to include take out and delivery service.    We already own a mixer, a double Deck Blodget 5 ft Pizza Oven, Refrigeration, and a majority of the every day equipment to operate.  Most of the budget is in the construction and permitting of the project.  90% of Budget
Build 2 support ""vessels"" as the next ships in our fleet
column2: 1 Hybrid Human/Electric powered Tricycle Pirate Tow Ship, 1 BBQ Treasure Chest Pirate Trailer Ship like the Jalapa-Nina to tow behind it, .  This would increase the current cooking capacity by 2 additional pizzas for a total of 6 pizzas cooking simultaneously, averaging 3-7 minutes per cook cycle, depending on the temperature outside and wind.  It would also double the amount of food we could pedal into an event with the on board storage built into the design.  With this addition we could be setup on the street AND at a private event, with Pirate ships in both places, going where Food Trucks cannot, but bikes can, like your back yard party.  Pirates like to be flexible. 10% of BudgetWe anticipate creating an additional 3-6 full time jobs and 3-5 part time jobs with this project, depending on business activity and special event requirements.
