column2: >I began to use LinkedIn early in college because it had become the new hot standard for students to nurture their professional presence. As a

column1: disciplined young student, I began to work on my LinkedIn profile religiously
for the next few years. Eventually students began to ask me to review their
profiles. I knew things were serious when working professionals began to ask for my feedback.

column2: > received a dinner invitation from LinkedIn because they noticed my profile. LinkedIn invited 10 undergraduates from all of UC Berkeley (26,000 undergraduate students) for dinner. They explained LinkedIn was recruiting undergraduates for their company and chose the best profiles in the area.

column1: After countless hours I spent revising my personal LinkedIn profile, I gained confidence from this experience and I began to share my best practices.
I soon began advising other professionals on best
strategies for using their LinkedIn profile, only to realize a few people knew how to fully harvest the power of LinkedIn.
After numerous workshops and one-on-one coaching, I found the value of sharing
my knowledge to help others grow professionally. As my expertise grew—LinkedIn

LinkedIn Profile 360 is designed to capture your personality traits and professional skills to create a professional online persona. Through an intricate interview process and a personalized mentorship service, you can optimize your LinkedIn Profile. Check out the following ""summary"" example:
This service will largely focus on creating a compelling summary, professional experience, and volunteer experience section.

Full Disclosure: Students, please remember that you have free resources in the Career Center and LinkedIn has free online resources. If you're interested in making your own profile from scratch, then please try it first. If you have difficulties, then please consider our service.
LinkedIn makes you think about who you are and who
self-reflection process is invaluable when you begin to talk about yourself
during interviews, coffee chats, and during work.
The service is designed for people who already
went through this self-reflection process and do not have the time and energy
to create or revise a profile.

LinkedIn is an amazing tool that helps connect others. If used properly, then you can connect with people across the globe to share skills, experiences, and information. LinkedIn profile 360 helps you gain visibility and works with you to  create strategies to maximize the power of LinkedIn.
column2: >Here are a few facts that highlight the value of LinkedIn:

column1: * 89% of all recruiters report having hired someone through LinkedIn.
*94% of recruiters plan to use LinkedIn  or other social media.
*Employers who use social media to hire found a 49% improvement in the quality of candidates.
The money fundraised will help design our website, hire a temporary graphic designer, and pay other initial costs.
We will work closely with you on how to effectively present your:
Mentorship: Do you want a new profile, help with your LinkedIn Strategy, and help seeking employment? Click the ""Mentorship"" perk (a $300 value).
Profile Creation: Do you not have a summary section or an experience section? Please Choose the ""Profile Creation"" perk (a $150 value).
Hybrid: Do you not have a summary section, but you have a professional experience section completed? Please choose the ""Hybrid"" perk (a $110 value).
Profile Revision: Do you already have a summary section and experience section, but need to refine your profile? Choose the ""Profile Revision"" Perk (a $75 value).
Please support this initiative, even if you have a strong LinkedIn Profile. Any amount of support helps.

This project requires our clients to give us the best glimpse of their personality and professional accomplishments. Results may vary depending on the level of connection and communication between clients and writers.

column1: LinkedIn Profile 360 is an entrepreneurial effort to help other people revise and create their LinkedIn profiles and improve their online presence.
is the fastest growing professional network with 364 million members and 187 million unique monthly visitors to their website.

This venture began with a dinner invitation from LinkedIn. I began to use LinkedIn early in college because it had become the new hot standard for students to nurture their professional presence. As a
disciplined young student, I began to work on my LinkedIn profile religiously
for the next few years. Eventually students began to ask me to review their
profiles. I knew things were serious when working professionals began to ask for my feedback.

In Fall 2014, I received a dinner invitation from LinkedIn because they noticed my profile. LinkedIn invited 10 undergraduates from all of UC Berkeley (26,000 undergraduate students) for dinner. They explained LinkedIn was recruiting undergraduates for their company and chose the best profiles in the area.
After countless hours I spent revising my personal LinkedIn profile, I gained confidence from this experience and I began to share my best practices.
I soon began advising other professionals on best
strategies for using their LinkedIn profile, only to realize a few people knew how to fully harvest the power of LinkedIn.
After numerous workshops and one-on-one coaching, I found the value of sharing
my knowledge to help others grow professionally. As my expertise grew—LinkedIn
Profile 360 was born.   How this works:

Full Disclosure: Students, please remember that you have free resources in the Career Center and LinkedIn has free online resources. If you're interested in making your own profile from scratch, then please try it first. If you have difficulties, then please consider our service.

you want to be publically. This
self-reflection process is invaluable when you begin to talk about yourself
during interviews, coffee chats, and during work.
The service is designed for people who already
went through this self-reflection process and do not have the time and energy
to create or revise a profile.

column4: '>I need your help to bring the Briar Challenge to life!

column1: The Briar Challenges are Mixed Reality Adventures that can turn a typical

afternoon into murder mystery, treasure hunt, a fantasy quest, and more!  

This campaign is my way of getting the word out and finding the founding members for Club Thorn! The first 100 people who become members will earn the title ""Legendary Founders"" and those who join by the end of 2015 will be the rest of the founding members.

These aren't board games or video games! They are played in the real world, but they contain a mix of elements from those traditional games with the addition of geocaching (location based play) and augmented reality. I'm also going to add in some activities and projects for members of Club Thorn.
Each Briar Challenge can be linked to a local cause, so people who play will be

supporting their community while having fun! In a few months they will be playable using a smartphone app called Clue Keeper, the company just needs to finish upgrading their code to handle the augmented reality clues I'm creating.
Using Spherical video (360 x 360 full sphere panorama)
and your smart phone, it's possible to enter another world entirely or replay a
scene filmed where you stand.  Music Videos are already being filmed using
these cameras, Taylor Swift and Walk Off The Earth are two you might have seen,
but there are many more out there!
I already have a camera capable of doing this, but it has limitations and I'm hoping
to raise enough to upgrade to professional equipment that can do more. I also need to upgrade my computer, printing, and recording equipment to increase the quality of the game content.
The Briar Challenges combine this type of video with geocaching and add all the
fun of an elaborate quest to create an adventure in your own backyard or around
Sussex County's points of interest.  You
might discover local spots that you've never heard of and you will definitely
have fun trying to solve the clues, finding the hiding spots, and unraveling
There will be three different ways to play a Briar Challenge and as more people
play, more Challenges will be released for each version.  The money I raise here will go to help create better quality game content and more Briar Challenges to play.
This contains everything you need to host a quest in your own backyard or a
local park. Reusable for future Challenges.  There will be an option to
turn a family event into a fundraiser for a cause of your choice using
These will be located across Sussex County and available for purchase through
the Clue Keeper App for Smartphones and Tablets. My goal is to have the first
of these ready for Halloween this year! I want to have a new Challenge every Month!
These will be one day skill competitions with entry fees, cash prizes for the
finalists, and so much fun!  It's a chance to raise lots of funds for
local causes and basically another excuse to throw a party! This type of event may have to wait until I can get enough funding to hire a lawyer - otherwise I'll get stuck in red tape...
Regardless of which way you decide to play, you get to
have fun while doing good for the community. Help me spread the word, the
more people who see my posts, the higher the probability I'll find the backers
I need to do this right.
to look professional, that requires a computer that won't threaten to
commit suicide by spontaneous combustion  as my current
laptop does. A Sprout PC is my goal, but the price starts at
• Making unique containers and gadgets to create
really interesting Hiding Spots for clues will take on a level of magic if I add a
3D Printer to my arsenal. A Dremel 3D Printer is my goal, but that
• I have a Ricoh Theta m15 to take video, it's
great but has built in limitations, to upgrade this will cost the biggest
chunk of change and is presented in hopes of hitting it as a stretch goal if the funding nears the $15,000 mark. However expensive it seems, it is actually cheap
considering it would enable me to record in 3D Spherical Video at a level of quality that makes it worth pulling out your Oculus or Google Cardboard to play. It would
require 14 Go Pros + 360 rigs + Software + Accessories = ~10,000

column1: Need a different way to get people excited about your Business, Organization, or Event? I will create a custom geocache using my mixed reality tricks that will get your target market smiling!

column3:

column1:
• $500 = Club Thorn Local Hero - Automatic Entry in Everything All Year!
    Bonus Reward: A Custom Briar Challenge for your Business or Event!
When can you play a Briar Challenge?
with two companies, ClueKeeper in California and Zappar in the UK. At the
moment they are working on ways to integrate their technology to make
it possible to play the Briar Challenge on any smart phone or tablet that plays
android or apple apps.  We hope to be ready by October, but definately by Christmas!!!
Until then, I want to see if I can increase my
capabilities so that when Cluekeeper is ready for the first Briar Challenge,

it's ready to be played! Zappar's technology is what I am using to add a layer of virtual reality over real life objects - like posters and cards, so every reward I sell through this campaign will come to life using their free app.

Instead of making rewards that require the equipment I'd like to buy, I am giving rewards with what I can already do now.

If this campaign passes the $5,000 mark, I will add stretch goals rewards that reflect what I can do with a better computer and a 3D printer.

If this campaign passes the $15,000 mark and I don't die of shock, I can buy all the tech tools on my list,as well as add more stretch goal rewards that will enable me to give a BIG CASH PRIZE to the finalists of the 1st HOSTED Briar Challenge (tentatively scheduled for December)! Hey, a girl can dream, right!

If this campaign goes viral, I will freak out... After I regain consciousness...
       I'll buy 8 acres of Forest I've had my eye on and build Thorn Park,
A ""Members Only"" park where we can create a private Paradise and use it to reward those members who are helping our community to be a happier, safer, and more welcoming place! Depending on how crazy the funding gets - we could make magic!
<li>Get the word out and make some noise about this
campaign by telling people about it on social media, or recruit your friends and
skills and want to help create some awesome geocache hides? Contact me and
let's see what magic we can make together!
<li>Volunteer to be an actor in my videos, offer a
location to shoot videos, or places to hide clues and geocaches! There are
so many ways to help make this happen!

If this campaign passes the $5,000 mark, I will add stretch goals rewards that reflect what I can do with a better computer and a 3D printer. If this campaign passes the $15,000 mark and I don't die of shock, I can buy all the tech tools on my list,as well as add more stretch goal rewards that will enable me to give a BIG CASH PRIZE to the finalists of the 1st HOSTED Briar Challenge (tentatively scheduled for December)! Hey, a girl can dream, right!If this campaign goes viral, I will freak out... After I regain consciousness...       I'll buy 8 acres of Forest I've had my eye on and build Thorn Park,A ""Members Only"" park where we can create a private Paradise and use it to reward those members who are helping our community to be a happier, safer, and more welcoming place! Depending on how crazy the funding gets - we could make magic!
Get the word out and make some noise about this
campaign by telling people about it on social media, or recruit your friends and
Have woodworking, engineering, or other random
skills and want to help create some awesome geocache hides? Contact me and
let's see what magic we can make together!
Volunteer to be an actor in my videos, offer a
location to shoot videos, or places to hide clues and geocaches! There are
so many ways to help make this happen!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hi everyone my name is Hunter Eckert and I am 18 year old photographer from California. The ocean has been an absolute fascination of mine and this is where I take most of my photos. I am constantly looking to expand my photography in more interesting and creative ways. My current setup is a canon 70d with two lenses one of which is a telephoto. Although I feel incredibly blessed to have the equipment I do, I still feel the need to expand it further. My speciality is surf photography and I feel I am ready to take that next step to further myself in the surf industry.

With the help of you all I plan on using 100% of my campaign donations on an underwater housing in order to get as close as I can to the action I will be filming in the water. With your donations I will purchase the following: Aquatech Underwater Housing for Canon 70d, 8 inch dome port for the housing, and an 8-15 mm Canon Fisheye Lense.

With these items I feel I will not only be able to get in the water comfortably, but with great success to follow. This will truly be a life changing experience and I hope you will support and follow me throughout this great journey.

THANK YOU!

Short Summary

During the last couple of weeks hudreds and thousands of immigrants are arriving into Hungary from countries like Afghanistan, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, etc.  Small groups of them are staying on the various squares and in the parks of Budapest. They only stay a few days or weeks in Hungary as their main aim is to reach a more well to do EU country.  A couple of times we provided them with some food from our own pockets. However they would  need help on a constant basis.
* food on regular basis
* blankets
* facility for taking showers

Segítsünk azoknak a menekülteknek, akik az utóbbi napokban, hetekben érkeztek Magyarországra. Az EU és az ENSZ helyett nem tudjuk megoldani a menekültügyi kérdést, de abban tudunk segíteni, hogy a Magyarországon töltött, sokszor tereken, parkokban eltöltött napokat, éjszakákat kicsit emberibbé tegyük.  Az esetlegesen bejövő adományokat ételre, takarókra és egyéb szükséges dologra költenénk. Minden vásárlást számlákkal dokumentálunk!!!  Amennyiben a helyzet közben megoldódna és nem lennének ideiglenesen itt  tartózkodó menekültek, akkor az összeget az ENSZ-nek adományozzuk. Akár 500 forint vagy 2 USD is számít!!!

column2:
What You Get

We would appreciate any help

  • We would need fund to cover the cost of providing cold and hot food.

column1: • Blankets as they spend the nights in the parks, on squares
• Any other item needed for their transit stay in Hungary.
• In case the problem of the immigrants is solved meanwhile, the rest of the amount would be offered to UNHCR  (UN Refugee Agency)

The Impact

This is an individual  initiative to help people in need.
*with your funding you help someone in need, someone seeking a better life, someone escaping from a country in war.

column2:
Challenges

  • Every penny spent will be documented and all the receipts will be published.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

You may also help with food, with fruits, balnkets, cleaning materials, etc.

the belief that healthy eating can be enjoyable, “The Start Kitchen” will scour
for nutritious ingredients and serve up delicious and healthy sandwiches and
the exhilaration to help people, “The Start Kitchen” will employ and train

column8: >Hey guys my name is Brandon Weiss, and I have decided to give this ago. February 2015 I had the honor of marrying into a family, headed by one of the nicest, most respectable men in existence. His name was Don Malmborg, my Grandpa. He did a lot for the community of Deleon Springs, Fl, such as having a fuel tank buried under the main highway that was poisoning the water table removed, and was even labeled by local media the ""unofficial mayor of Deleon Springs"". Together with other members of the Deleon Springs Community Association, Mr. Malmborg has wanted to build a community center for the residents of Deleon Springs. He has put on multiple festivals and other events to raise money for the building. In November 2014, the County of Volusia approved a plot of land for the community center, with conditions it must be built within 5 years or they get the land back.

column1:
Unfortunately, on the morning of June 27, 2015 we had received the news that Don Malmborg had left us in his sleep. Through you all, I hope to be able to raise the funds to hand over to the Deleon Springs Community Association Inc. To see his biggest dream be followed through with, and placed in his honor!

What We Need

The best answer to this, is YOU! We need you. ANY and ALL monies raised through this campaign will be given directly to the association to begin the construction process to ensure the land will not be lost due to inactivity. I have set the goal at $200,000 but please any and all contributions will be rewarded to them.

The Impact

Through your contribution, we can make Don's dream a reality in bringing this community center to Deleon Springs. This building would provide a location for local events, parties, weddings, small concerts as well as a plan to incorporate a section of the building to be a County Public Library. This center would do so much for the community as a whole by giving the residents a place to hold events in a place they all call home.

column2:
Challenges

The challenges have already been hurdled and the center has been approved in a location. Now the only challenge that lies ahead of us is funding.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but would like to volunteer your time, or perhaps you own a business and would like to offer your services to assist in the construction of this building, PLEASE feel free to message me at any time and we will be in contact.

Gardiner Liquid Mercantile

My name is Gable Erenzo and I am a former LLC Member of New York State's Pioneer Farm Distillery, Tuthilltown Spirits.  After 10 years of growing this family business, I have stepped out on the plank to pursue my dream of distilling on a hyper local and extremely small scale, and creating a hub for all the amazing farm beverage producers in the immediate vicinity of my home, Gardiner, NY.

This project has two distinct priorities, make amazing, innovative and experimental spirits at our nano-distillery located at Kettleborough Cider House on Dressel's Orchards, and create New York's first Farm Beverage eating and drinking establishment, tasting room and retail shop on Main Street in Gardiner.

column5: >By now I am sure you have caught wind of the exciting world of Farm and Craft Distilling.  With new distillers opening their doors daily in every state across the Nation, its a great time to explore what your locale has to offer.  Now take minute and lets step back to look at Farm Beverages in general.  Here in New York State we have a thriving Agricultural Community finding new avenue's for it's harvests in local wine, cider, beer and spirits.  Up until now, most of these producers must either build a small sales team and self distribute, or find themselves a distributor that is willing to take on their products.  For the fortunate brands that arrange distribution, the fight for shelf space begins.
>The 2014 Craft Act has created a new opportunity for Craft

column1: Beverage producers in New York State.  The
amended D Farm Distillery License now allows for a distillery branch office and
sale of beverages by the glass for on premise consumption. Within the
distillery branch office all legal rights of a icensed distillery are extended
of up to 75k gallons of liquor made from NYS Fruit or Grain
liquor for both on (cocktails and spirits by the  glass) and off premise consumption
sale of NYS branded wine, beer, cider for off-premise consumption

column2: drinking establishment on or adjacent  to satellite location

column1: license to serve wine and beer for on premise consumption
Previous to this act, there were no provisions to acquire
license for both a manufacturing facility and an onsite consumption
establishment, and are therefor no currently operational competitors.  This project continues the pioneering efforts
of the Erenzo family within the NYS distilling movement.
GLM aims to be the first licensed distillery to open a satellite
location with the addition of a Tavern Wine License, creating a locally focused
eating and drinking establishment on the same premises as a retail store with
the ability to sell all NYS branded beer, wine, cider and liquor for both on
and off premise consumption, as well as wholesale distilled products to
wineries, breweries, cideries and commercial bars, restaurants and retailers
interested in limited and obscure small batch spirits.

Gable Erenzo, CSS

As a former Principle at Tuthilltown Spirits, a Distiller and Ambassador, Gable has divided the past 10 years between production, management of Tuthilltown, and the national roll out of Hudson Whiskey. With over 20 years in production and national event management, an associate’s degree from CU, a BS in Business Management from SUNY New Paltz, and a CSS (Certified Spirits Specialist) certification he brings considerable business knowledge and industry experience to his company. Gable’s prior position as Head Distiller and Production Manager at the Tuthilltown educated him about all aspects of the distillation process, preparing him for his role as National Hudson Brand Ambassador and now as Founder and Managing Member of Gardiner Liquid Mercantile. A rock climber and outdoor enthusiast from the very start, Gable has been climbing in the “Gunks” for over 20 years. He is happy to be working at something he loves, surrounded by friends and family.
GLM has purchased a building in a Hamlet
Commercial zone on main street, in the heart of Gardiner.  The building has been gutted and comes with
all building and zoning permit approvals for an eating and drinking establishment.  With a recently renovated historic commercial
space next door, a high-end market across the street, the Wallkill Valley
Rail-trail steps away, attractive buildings throughout the village, and the
extraordinary traffic through town (44/55 traffic on this stretch was last
measured in 2003 with average daily traffic at 5129 cars) to all the areas
attractions, Gardiner is ripe for a business of this type.
The current building has professional approved plans drawn
up to finish the construction in an attractive and useful way for what was to
become a wine bar. In addition to the 1500sq’ of indoor space which includes
two story vaulted ceiling and a pre-approved 10' wide deck facing the sidewalk, there is another 1/8 acre of yard surrounding the
building which through special permitting by the town and patio construction
will allow for additional 3 season outdoor seating.
The proliferation of Craft Distilleries and Breweries in the
Mid Hudson Valley has created an additional tourism draw to the region with
Gardiner as the birthplace of New York State Whiskey and Distilling.  As part of the family and team that pioneered
this industry and built the most successful American craft whiskey brand in the
world, the opening of this establishment will be press worthy news for both
on this attention, GLM will become a draw for fans from near and far while also
creating new media buzz that will share our story with new consumers within
With this Main Street location, GLM will capture the tourist traffic from this category as well as the numerous
other attractions in Gardiner, including but not limited to:
activities, including highest traffic climbing area in the country)
A year round business cannot survive on tourism alone, particularly in
the harsh climate of the North East.
Attracting locals and regionals will be essential to the success and
growth of the business. By offering a one stop shop for all local beverage
products as well as extremely limited house made spirits only available for
retail and consumption at this one location, GLM creates a unique draw for both
locals and visitors.  In addition to
retail sales and beverages by the glass, we will offer small plates using
seasonal local ingredients prepared on site by a local chef.
will open its doors by purchasing product from local distilleries, wineries,
products will be sold both by the bottle and by the glass, with local spirits
offered in mixed drinks for consumption on premises.  Per the D license, we will also serve a
limited menu of high quality local and seasonal faire.  In addition to locally produced beverages (on
and off premise consumption), GLM will retail items such as:
pre-packaged food items (chocolate, pickles, salsa, jam, etc)
While Phase 1 is underway, GLM Partner Distiller, Joel Elder will focus on
development and production of distilled beverages to be sold directly through
storefront and bar.  With combined distilling
experience of the team, small batches of various spirits and spirit based
beverages will be produced with the goal of fully stocking the bar and shelves
with all categories of spirit.  Aside
from the consumer draw of a bar and store that produce all their own liquor,
this is also the financial key to attaining unheard of margins on both retail
and bar sales. With typical markups of 30% for both distributor and retailer,
these two middlemen are removed and this margin is absorbed into the
As revenue increases we will increase capacity of distillery
with the potential to eventually sell wholesale from our store front creating a
unique draw for craft bartenders and retail shops that are known for obscure
high quality spirits, along with NYS Farm Wineries, Breweries and Cideries
which are also allowed to sell NYS branded Liquor.  House distilled products will include but not
be limited to the following spirits, made from all local and seasonal fruit and
General aesthetic of GLM, signage and branding will reflect
the historic nature of the products we are selling and the village we call
distilling equipment (tools, barrels, etc) along with historic photos, signs
and business materials will be the starting point in designing an identity that
Seasoned barn wood, patina copper, Edison light bulbs, antique bottles, period
glassware and bar tools, and other eclectic finds will be used to accent a
repurposed wood bar with brass foot rail and complimentary bar stools.
Retail shelving, checkout counter and displays will be built
from repurposed materials collected as locally as possible.
Signage will be the key to capturing vehicle traffic and
should visually tell a story of our pioneering efforts in the Distilling
Revolution while also reflecting the agricultural past of the area.
An idea that began its evolution over a year ago is now in the final stages of realization.  Here is a quick list of the hurdles we have cleared so far.
• Corporate bank accounts and credit cards opened
• Certificate of Authority, EIN, Surety Bond are all received and filed
• TTB (Federal Regulatory Body for Alcohol Production) Approval for Bonded Distillery
• SLA (State Liquor Authority of NY) Approval for Farm Distillery License, Class D
• Space secured for distillery within the Kettleborough Cider House on Dressel's Farm
<li>Building purchased on Main Street for the Farm Bar &amp
column2: Cafe, Tasting Room and Retail Shop

column1: • Contractors secured and architectural drawings under way for final building permit
• Logo complete and design work for packaging and interior of building under way
With the heavy lifting complete, now the fun begins.

Though we are asking for $45k, you will see in the budget below this is only a portion of the funding necessary.  All other capital is coming from my personal savings.  Every penny I have saved and some I have borrowed will be invested into the project.  The hope is that this level of commitment and confidence illustrates my personal drive to utilize all my skills, contacts, experience, and ability to bring this project to a successful and sustainable outcome.
BUDGET PHASE 1

Now, $45k is a lot to ask, I know.  And if we reach this goal, all is peach brandy!  If we don't, nothing changes other than the amount of hustle, wheel and deal Ill be doing while also trying to balance the tasks at hand in Phase 1.  In other words, even if I don't hit the goal, all the money will be invested into the business and an accounting of how that is spent will be sent out to all who contributed.
And regardless of whether the goal is reached, those who do lend a hand will receive lots of awesomeness in the form of perks.  Perks will range from hugs to the naming rights of our first born (not really).  Kidding aside, we think there are some fun incentives to help out, so please keep on moving through the campaign and be a diamond star supporter!

restaurant or food & drinking establishment on or adjacent  to satellite location
Right to apply for Tavern Wine
license to serve wine and beer for on premise consumption
Previous to this act, there were no provisions to acquire
license for both a manufacturing facility and an onsite consumption
establishment, and are therefor no currently operational competitors.  This project continues the pioneering efforts
of the Erenzo family within the NYS distilling movement.
GLM aims to be the first licensed distillery to open a satellite
location with the addition of a Tavern Wine License, creating a locally focused
eating and drinking establishment on the same premises as a retail store with
the ability to sell all NYS branded beer, wine, cider and liquor for both on
and off premise consumption, as well as wholesale distilled products to
wineries, breweries, cideries and commercial bars, restaurants and retailers
interested in limited and obscure small batch spirits.

Gable Erenzo, CSSAs a former Principle at Tuthilltown Spirits, a Distiller and Ambassador, Gable has divided the past 10 years between production, management of Tuthilltown, and the national roll out of Hudson Whiskey. With over 20 years in production and national event management, an associate’s degree from CU, a BS in Business Management from SUNY New Paltz, and a CSS (Certified Spirits Specialist) certification he brings considerable business knowledge and industry experience to his company. Gable’s prior position as Head Distiller and Production Manager at the Tuthilltown educated him about all aspects of the distillation process, preparing him for his role as National Hudson Brand Ambassador and now as Founder and Managing Member of Gardiner Liquid Mercantile. A rock climber and outdoor enthusiast from the very start, Gable has been climbing in the “Gunks” for over 20 years. He is happy to be working at something he loves, surrounded by friends and family.
GLM has purchased a building in a Hamlet
Commercial zone on main street, in the heart of Gardiner.  The building has been gutted and comes with
all building and zoning permit approvals for an eating and drinking establishment.  With a recently renovated historic commercial
space next door, a high-end market across the street, the Wallkill Valley
Rail-trail steps away, attractive buildings throughout the village, and the
extraordinary traffic through town (44/55 traffic on this stretch was last
measured in 2003 with average daily traffic at 5129 cars) to all the areas
attractions, Gardiner is ripe for a business of this type.
The current building has professional approved plans drawn
up to finish the construction in an attractive and useful way for what was to
become a wine bar. In addition to the 1500sq’ of indoor space which includes
two story vaulted ceiling and a pre-approved 10' wide deck facing the sidewalk, there is another 1/8 acre of yard surrounding the
building which through special permitting by the town and patio construction
will allow for additional 3 season outdoor seating.
The proliferation of Craft Distilleries and Breweries in the
Mid Hudson Valley has created an additional tourism draw to the region with
Gardiner as the birthplace of New York State Whiskey and Distilling.  As part of the family and team that pioneered
this industry and built the most successful American craft whiskey brand in the
world, the opening of this establishment will be press worthy news for both
on this attention, GLM will become a draw for fans from near and far while also
creating new media buzz that will share our story with new consumers within
With this Main Street location, GLM will capture the tourist traffic from this category as well as the numerous
other attractions in Gardiner, including but not limited to:
Folley Cidery (Jenkins & Leuken Orchard and Farm Stand)
activities, including highest traffic climbing area in the country)
A year round business cannot survive on tourism alone, particularly in
the harsh climate of the North East.
Attracting locals and regionals will be essential to the success and
growth of the business. By offering a one stop shop for all local beverage
products as well as extremely limited house made spirits only available for
retail and consumption at this one location, GLM creates a unique draw for both
locals and visitors.  In addition to
retail sales and beverages by the glass, we will offer small plates using
seasonal local ingredients prepared on site by a local chef.
will open its doors by purchasing product from local distilleries, wineries,
products will be sold both by the bottle and by the glass, with local spirits
offered in mixed drinks for consumption on premises.  Per the D license, we will also serve a
limited menu of high quality local and seasonal faire.  In addition to locally produced beverages (on
and off premise consumption), GLM will retail items such as:
pre-packaged food items (chocolate, pickles, salsa, jam, etc)
While Phase 1 is underway, GLM Partner Distiller, Joel Elder will focus on
development and production of distilled beverages to be sold directly through
storefront and bar.  With combined distilling
experience of the team, small batches of various spirits and spirit based
beverages will be produced with the goal of fully stocking the bar and shelves
with all categories of spirit.  Aside
from the consumer draw of a bar and store that produce all their own liquor,
this is also the financial key to attaining unheard of margins on both retail
and bar sales. With typical markups of 30% for both distributor and retailer,
these two middlemen are removed and this margin is absorbed into the
As revenue increases we will increase capacity of distillery
with the potential to eventually sell wholesale from our store front creating a
unique draw for craft bartenders and retail shops that are known for obscure
high quality spirits, along with NYS Farm Wineries, Breweries and Cideries
which are also allowed to sell NYS branded Liquor.  House distilled products will include but not
be limited to the following spirits, made from all local and seasonal fruit and
General aesthetic of GLM, signage and branding will reflect
the historic nature of the products we are selling and the village we call
distilling equipment (tools, barrels, etc) along with historic photos, signs
and business materials will be the starting point in designing an identity that
Seasoned barn wood, patina copper, Edison light bulbs, antique bottles, period
glassware and bar tools, and other eclectic finds will be used to accent a
repurposed wood bar with brass foot rail and complimentary bar stools.
Retail shelving, checkout counter and displays will be built
from repurposed materials collected as locally as possible.
Signage will be the key to capturing vehicle traffic and
should visually tell a story of our pioneering efforts in the Distilling
Revolution while also reflecting the agricultural past of the area.
An idea that began its evolution over a year ago is now in the final stages of realization.  Here is a quick list of the hurdles we have cleared so far.
Incorporated as Gardiner Liquid Mercantile, LLC
Corporate bank accounts and credit cards opened
Certificate of Authority, EIN, Surety Bond are all received and filed
TTB (Federal Regulatory Body for Alcohol Production) Approval for Bonded Distillery
SLA (State Liquor Authority of NY) Approval for Farm Distillery License, Class D
Space secured for distillery within the Kettleborough Cider House on Dressel's Farm
Building purchased on Main Street for the Farm Bar & Cafe, Tasting Room and Retail Shop
Contractors secured and architectural drawings under way for final building permit
Logo complete and design work for packaging and interior of building under way
With the heavy lifting complete, now the fun begins.
What We Need, What You Want

Though we are asking for $45k, you will see in the budget below this is only a portion of the funding necessary.  All other capital is coming from my personal savings.  Every penny I have saved and some I have borrowed will be invested into the project.  The hope is that this level of commitment and confidence illustrates my personal drive to utilize all my skills, contacts, experience, and ability to bring this project to a successful and sustainable outcome.BUDGET PHASE 1

Now, $45k is a lot to ask, I know.  And if we reach this goal, all is peach brandy!  If we don't, nothing changes other than the amount of hustle, wheel and deal Ill be doing while also trying to balance the tasks at hand in Phase 1.  In other words, even if I don't hit the goal, all the money will be invested into the business and an accounting of how that is spent will be sent out to all who contributed.And regardless of whether the goal is reached, those who do lend a hand will receive lots of awesomeness in the form of perks.  Perks will range from hugs to the naming rights of our first born (not really).  Kidding aside, we think there are some fun incentives to help out, so please keep on moving through the campaign and be a diamond star supporter!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Ducking Ducks is a rubber duck delivery service for any occasion. The cost of sending a rubber duck to someone is much less than sending flowers or fruit and it has just as much of an impact if not more.

We need your help to launch this company and make it a popular reality. With the funding we will be able to do proper marketing and have the finished top notch.

One of my passionate ways to express myself is through the art of Food. I am a chef, a foodie, a lover of the art of food and creating food master pieces. I love to serve others and I truly love to get in the kitchen a just cook... it’s my place of peace. With the encouragement of family and friends and the drive to do more it became clear... time to start a small business. Today I introduce to you all my small business venture Infuzion Food! 

The donations that I raise here will help me with the start up cost to jump start the business. This will allow Infuzion Food to get licensed, insured, and complete all legal paper work, and any certifications in order to become an official small business. It will also go toward fueling the start up funds for different culinary materials, and advertisement to promote, share and build the business name.  I thank you all in advance for sharing, donating, and being a part of making a dream come true. 

From catering, to personal chef on to training programs and all in between Infuzion Food &
column2: Chef K is here to serve...

column1: Infuzion Food takes you on a journey that embarks onto a unique experience in the art expression of food and service. Infuzion Food is the experience of passion and taste in food and service. Infuzion Food is not just food it is an unique experience in the art of food service, food experience, food education and food expression.

Chef K’s hope in the growth of Infuzion Food is health and wellness food education, superior food service, expansion in food business and favorable tasteful food experiences. From nutritional education, entertainment cooking, personal chef &
column3: cooking classes Infusion Food will be an unique savory experience.

column1: Infuzion Food will offer a variety of unique services through Chef K’s passions in the art of food service and education.

Chef K plans to not only give his clients a unique savory food experience and display his passion for food and service. Chef K also plans to educate on cooking techniques, nutritional values, food art and so much more. He longs to dominate his quest in the art of food and show how it brings families, friends and people together around the table for amazing food, uplifting laughter, and contagious fun.

Infuzion Food a unique savory experience! 

Infuzion Food Introduces Chef K:

Hello my name is Kevin Gilmore originally from Toledo, Ohio moved to Columbus Ohio in 2007. I graduated from culinary school in 2009 and I have been living, breathing, bleeding food and service to others all my life. I come form a cooking family with a love to cook, eat and enjoy each other around the kitchen table. People ask me what is your favorite meal to prepare?... My response is what do you like to eat? What is your favorite dish?... Anything that allows me to create, express and gives joy to others and myself! 

It is simple this whole love for the art of food is a generational blessing that has been passed down to me. It is now my job to share with the world experiences, techniques and the history of love and passion through food and service of others. 

Chef K says lets create, express and eat... for the love of food!!!

aren't many non-profitable initiatives that would swim for hours in
the Alaskan Pacific with pods of Orcas lurking in the depths. There aren’t
many, if any, non-profits putting their lives at risk for children who
a group of daring South African open water swimmers who swim for children in need. They do crazy swims all over the world that put food on tables, support children in health crisis, enable
education and provide opportunities. Each time swimmers take to the water they face deadly threats
- frozen waters, currents, sharks. But danger is the point. ""By risking
our lives we are investing everything. If we don't, how can we
expect our donors to invest in children who deserve a better chance? Facing threats might mean that we're mad...but
we have to be even madder not to care!""
honeymoon in 2000, Jean Craven stood on the Rock of Gibraltar looking
across the water to Morocco thinking “I’m sure I can swim this”. Nine
years later, a bet of R100,000 (ZAR) among friends saw him and a friend Tim Ziehl
swim the       17 km Strait of Gibraltar in just over four hours. Feeling sorry for

taking betting money from friends, they donated the money to charity. That planted the idea of annual swims to help change disadvantaged children's lives. Madswimmer registered as a non-profit organisation in 2009 and since then completed all 6 recognised intercontinental swims and various daring others that <b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
We are no different, we are everyday people:  Parents, partners, breadwinners who sacrifice our
time and money to prove what normal people can do when they put their
life-changing money. We’ll swim among killer whales, exhaust
our physical and mental strength and test the limits of what is possible.
Danger: Our swims are not easy - icy weather, sharks, walruses, currents. But danger is the draw card.
accomplished various world firsts. Among them the 1st ever series of
possible swims connecting all continents.  Our swim on Mt Ojos del Salado in December 2015 will be the highest in the world at 6400 m above sea level - 1100 m higher than base camp Mt Everest.
benefit selected registered children's charities.  Read more about our charities here  http://www.madswimmer.com/our-cause/ or watch this clip:
2013: North to South America 21.3km (Isthmus of Panama)
2011: Asia to Oceana / Australasia 23.3km (Papua New Guinea to Indonesia)
also crossed Lake Tanganyika (38km, 12h swim), Sterkfontein
Dam (17km), the Knysna Lagoon (14.5km in winter and during
shark week!), Lewis Tarn, the highest lake in Africa on Mt
Kenya at 4700m above sea level and were the first ever to cross the Swahili Channel (35km) from Tanzania to Zanzibar.

column2: >NOW, THE HIGHEST SWIM, EVER

column1: December 2015 Madswimmer will take on the highest swim on top of the world's highest
volcano, Mt Ojos del Salado in Chile. This will be a world record breaking physical
experience, swimming at 6400 m above sea level. Nobody has attempted such extreme levels of altitude and cold before as far as we know.
column2: >Have a look at what we are about to attempt:

column6: > The combination of hypothermia (dangerously low body temperature) and altitude sickness (decreased availability of oxygen at high altitudes) can cause acute health problems - wanting to swim fast

column1: to get the cold over, but also, not being able to swim so fast due to altitude
challenges. We will be hiking up a volcano in the Atacama desert and that alone will take 8 days, so dehydration is a real risk. And we will be extremely remote - 500km from the
CHALLENGES: The swim is 1.1km higher than Lewis Pugh's ice swim record in Nepal, which is quite a big difference at this altitude. Then we are not sure
if the pool will be frozen or not - so we are taking chain saws with just in case
to cut open a lane in the ice. Night temperatures of minus 20<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
mountain and the water could be near freezing point. Swimmers will
attempt the swim in Speedo's only! <b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

THE TEAM: The expedition will consist of eight Madswimmers and a media and medical support team. Our medical experts are Dr Sean Gottschalk, from ER Consulting Inc, who also accompanied world known swimmer Lewis Pugh on his ice swim in Nepal, and Dr Darryl Wood, both specialists in altitude acclimatization and hypothermia treatment. Charl Rorich of Media Ventures is our camera man and Sean Disney of Adventure Dynamics International our expedition leader. Sean has summited the 7 highest volcanoes in the world as well as Mt Everest.
SWIMMERS: Jean Craven (founder), Milton Brest, Evan Feldman, Chris Marthinusen,  Herman van der Westhuizen, Robert Graaff, Juandre Human.

column10: />

column1: EXPENSES for the swimmers' trip is carried by themselves, which is their personal contribution to the cause! We are very fortunate to have corporate sponsors helping us cover the remainder of expenses including the safety costs so that donations benefit our charities 100%.

As we go for the extreme, we need to contribute where it counts. We will do the highest swim to bring change in desperate children's lives. And we hope to inspire you to donate towards this highest cause.

Complementary to additional fundraising drives, we hope to raise $30 000 (400 000 ZAR) with our Indiegogo campaignto benefit Madswimmer's selected registered children's charities. This is your chance to donate!

column6: >A contribution could qualify you for any of our cool perks like the proud Madswimmer t-shirt below.

column1: However, Thomas James said: ""Act as what you do makes a difference. It does."" Contributing towards our cause earns you these amazing testimonies by our charities - the real gift behind the smokescreens of our perks:
Hospivision: ""One of the most distressing things that can happen to a family is when a child

is diagnosed with a life-threatening illness such as cancer or aids.  Madswimmer funds enable us to provide care, counselling and hope for disadvantaged, sick children and their families in state hospitals.""
Miles for Mercia: ""Funding therapeutic equipment, like the bike for little Mason, brought relief and abundant joy for many cerebral palsy sufferers and their parents""

column3: />

column1: Seal Trust: ""Your contributions provided swimming programmes among disadvantaged communities where drowning of children is a frequent reality""
NSRI Waterwise: ""Your money save lives. We teach children in poor communities basic water safety and how to rescue a friend in trouble""

Chilren's Hospital Trust: ""Fahiema was left paralyzed after being hit by a taxi in 2014.  Madswimmer helped fund her rehabilitation and now, one year later, she is able to walk, talk and eat by herself again.

Bram Fischer Trust: ""Your funds benefited a very talented young gentleman at Grey College. He is an excellent rugby player and athlete who represented the Free State in both activities. He comes from a humble shack in the Goldfields where he lives with his 85 year old grandmother. Without your help this gifted child's talents might have been buried with his deceased parents"".

SAFV: ""Madswimmer support enables us to enroll children's home matriculants for tertiary studies after leaving the safe haven of the children's home. There is a fine line between being on track or on the street. Your funds help to keep them on track and to look forward to a brighter future!""
WACDT:  ""Madswimmer funding enabled the Waenhuiskrans/Arniston Community Development
Trust to award study bursaries to Amanda Afrika (BSc), Roxzanne Flynn (nursing) and Bevan Arendse (secondary school). These students excelled in their studies and have hope for the future.""
Foodbank: ""Your contributions help us to feed over 110 000 people a day who can't afford proper meals. 44% of our beneficiaries are children between 0 and 13.""

Jan Hofmeyer Trust: Thank you Madswimmer for helping us to provide pre-school development for 24 children from the Jan Hofmeyer community who, without your support, would not have had access to this essential foundation.""

ORT SA: With Madswimmer support we trained young learners at the Hector Peterson Secondary School in an extremely poor area outside Kraaifontein to understand the basics of critical thinking to succeed in mathematics and science. One member, now in matric, plans to become a pilot!""
Lets call it a joint effort: Madswimmer inspires, one stroke at a time and donors are the enablers that lead our children into greatness.

All our swims pose risks. Otherwise we wouldn't have done it! But with at least 10 daring attempts under our belt, giving up is not an option. The financial risk is the swimmers' own. Public money benefits registered children's charities 100%.
Please donate and of course there are other ways you can also help:
• Please spread the word, use the Indiegogo share tools to tell friends

December 2015 Madswimmer will take on the highest swim on top of the world's highest
volcano, Mt Ojos del Salado in Chile. This will be a world record breaking physical
experience, swimming at 6400 m above sea level. Nobody has attempted such extreme levels of altitude and cold before as far as we know.  Have a look at what we are about to attempt:

DANGERS:  The combination of hypothermia (dangerously low body temperature) and altitude sickness (decreased availability of oxygen at high altitudes) can cause acute health problems - wanting to swim fast
to get the cold over, but also, not being able to swim so fast due to altitude
challenges. We will be hiking up a volcano in the Atacama desert and that alone will take 8 days, so dehydration is a real risk. And we will be extremely remote - 500km from the
CHALLENGES: The swim is 1.1km higher than Lewis Pugh's ice swim record in Nepal, which is quite a big difference at this altitude. Then we are not sure
if the pool will be frozen or not - so we are taking chain saws with just in case
to cut open a lane in the ice. Night temperatures of minus 20°C could be expected on the
mountain and the water could be near freezing point. Swimmers will
attempt the swim in Speedo's only! All in aid of vulnerable children.

THE TEAM: The expedition will consist of eight Madswimmers and a media and medical support team. Our medical experts are Dr Sean Gottschalk, from ER Consulting Inc, who also accompanied world known swimmer Lewis Pugh on his ice swim in Nepal, and Dr Darryl Wood, both specialists in altitude acclimatization and hypothermia treatment. Charl Rorich of Media Ventures is our camera man and Sean Disney of Adventure Dynamics International our expedition leader. Sean has summited the 7 highest volcanoes in the world as well as Mt Everest.

Jan Hofmeyer Trust: Thank you Madswimmer for helping us to provide pre-school development for 24 children from the Jan Hofmeyer community who, without your support, would not have had access to this essential foundation.""

ORT SA: With Madswimmer support we trained young learners at the Hector Peterson Secondary School in an extremely poor area outside Kraaifontein to understand the basics of critical thinking to succeed in mathematics and science. One member, now in matric, plans to become a pilot!""
Lets call it a joint effort: Madswimmer inspires, one stroke at a time and donors are the enablers that lead our children into greatness.

All our swims pose risks. Otherwise we wouldn't have done it! But with at least 10 daring attempts under our belt, giving up is not an option. The financial risk is the swimmers' own. Public money benefits registered children's charities 100%.
Please donate and of course there are other ways you can also help:
Please spread the word, use the Indiegogo share tools to tell friends
Become a Madswimmer and join any of our 2016 swims posted on Facebook: http://tinyurl.com/pauf6wj",29.0,2,"1 Campaign

Why did we start this company?

TGM Entertainment was founded on the belief that good, clean, entertainment has the power to enrich the lives of and inspire youth. K-Pop is a sleek, chic and clean musical genre that has in the past 10 years amassed a growing global following. The fact that it is in a completely different language has not prevented its growth but in reverse opened the door to millions choosing to learn the language. This, and the rising popularity of K-Pop has resulted in a boost of visitors from around the world to South Korea to be at the epicenter of this thriving industry, and of course, get a closer look at the K-Pop stars that they love. 

At TGM Entertainment, we want to make K-Pop concerts and acts more accessible to the rest of the world. We want to bring great concerts out of South Korea and replicate them in different areas of the world, focusing on Southeast Asia and North America which are strong, developing markets. We plan to venture out into Europe and the United Kingdom in 2015.

Our aim is to grow this industry beyond what it is today to not only ensure the sustainability of our business, but to generate more opportunities for other businesses and individuals to be a part of this cultural phenomenon.

To procure acts and bring them across the globe, there are a multitude of costs involved. While the return is extremely rewarding, the risks are high. The business of concert promotion relies on an airtight marketing and financial strategy to sell tickets and hit targets, which is ultimately how we generate profit.

The way that investment into a concert series works, is that promoters will fund the entire cost beforehand and recoup their investment through ticket sales. Without the right team to promote the event and the experience to keep a reign on budgets, many inexperienced promoters have phased out after just one project because they take such a major financial hit.

This campaign mitigates the risk of upcoming projects by giving us a ready market to approach with a concert. The more funding we have, the more cities we can head to. 

While fans are spread out across different cities in America, funding will allow us to do more shows and more frequently, so the chance of a K-Pop concert coming to a city close to you as opposed to just major cities, is much higher.

How Much Do We Need and What Do You Get?

  • On average, a typical idol group concert costs $150,000 per city to produce. Promoters tend to shy away from producing shows if they do not foresee the potential in making their money back. A city like New York or Los Angeles, is more likely to sell more tickets, therefore a higher volume of concerts in those cities. We are looking to raise just half of what is needed for a five-city tour that we have planned with a popular male idol group that we have worked with previously. We want this to be a joint effort, half funded by us and half funded by fans. We plan to take the tour to New York, Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas and San Francisco/Los Angeles.

• VIP tickets typically range from $200 - $120 dollars and are also the most difficult to acquire as the competition to purchase these tickets is high. Purchasing ahead of time ensures that you get your ticket first with a number of other perks like early entry to the concert, meet and greet with the artist and discounts on merchandise. You also have the option of redeeming a free Standard or General Admission ticket for a friend to the same concert, or redeeming a free Standard or General Admission ticket for yourself to attend another TGM Entertainment Event, even if it is before this particular tour.

column2:
>If we do not meet our funding goal, the money you have contributed will still go towards funding this tour. However, we will remove one stop from the five-city plan. It is important that you include your address in your contribution, because it lets us know where in the USA you are and the higher the chance of us coming closer to you!

The Impact

How does this make a difference? 

  • Every contribution to this project is not only a pledge of trust by you to us, but also a commitment and investment to helping us make this project succeed. The more successful this project, the better chance we have of returning quickly with another project. Typically, we have one show every other month. We have not had a track record of remaining stagnant with no shows. Even if you are not a K-Pop fan, do come out and experience something completely new! We promise it will be a ton of fun.

column1:
• We have not been in this industry for a long time, but every concert that we have done, we have had an amazing track record with fans. We do our absolute best to keep fans and our artists happy because we know that we would not be here without either of you. We are known to be a company that treats the artists and their fans with the utmost respect and we want to continue doing this.

    • Why Us?

    We know that there are risks, and that we are not able to please everybody, however our business is not to cut out risks and prevent challenges, but to solve the problems that come our way. 

    • Our team is comprised of extremely experienced individuals who have a very specific set of skills that tackle problems that come our way quickly and with no fuss. We believe in clear communication between ourselves, the artists and their agency as well as the fans who come to our shows.

• Our team has always been behind the scenes of K-Pop events in the USA, the large scale ones to standalone tours. We provide artist care and coordination as well as the stage and technical production for different promoters and have seen the problems and challenges fans and media go through. Through a successful campaign, the power is put in our hands to change things and make things better. We aim to do the things other promoters have done in the past, but we want to do it right.

    • Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that not everyone has the means to contribute, but we thank you for your time anyway. If this is something you believe in, you can help us by spreading the word. Every bit of exposure helps!

    • Every 5 contributors you refer to us, you get one free GA/Standard ticket. The contributor will need to e-mail us at hello@tgmevents.com with proof of their contribution, and state your name and e-mail address as the beneficiary of the free concert ticket. Once 5 contributors have e-mailed us with your name, we will send you an e-mail notifying you of your free ticket.
    • OR! If you are a group of contributors that know of someone who deserves a ticket, you can also nominate a person to receive a free ticket from us. We want to repay your generosity towards us, with generosity towards someone else. Let's keep giving!

column3: >I am Monique Massiah. I am a photojournalist working in Western Canada. I love Canada and I like my photos to share a bit of that feeling. This month I'm starting a new photography business and I need a little help to get studio/office space and marketing.
>(you can check out a few of my images at my brand new website www.moniquemassiahphotography.com here or on flickr at www.flickr.com/photos/moniquemassiah
>I've been taking photos for other people since 2008. This campaign is aimed at helping me buy new studio space and marketing.

>In exchange I will send you professional print or digital images, offer a personal photoshoot to the top five contributers located in Calgary, Alberta, and merchandise via my Red Bubble page, like a MMP t-shirt, or sweatshirt.
>Any help is appreciated, so if you can't help out financially it's ok too. Please share my campaign via social media with your friends!

column1: I am Monique Massiah. I am a photojournalist working in Western Canada. I love Canada and I like my photos to share a bit of that feeling. This month I'm starting a new photography business and I need a little help to get studio/office space and marketing.
(you can check out a few of my images at my brand new website www.moniquemassiahphotography.com here or on flickr at www.flickr.com/photos/moniquemassiah )
I've been taking photos for other people since 2008. This campaign is aimed at helping me buy new studio space and marketing.

In exchange I will send you professional print or digital images, offer a personal photoshoot to the top five contributers located in Calgary, Alberta, and merchandise via my Red Bubble page, like a MMP t-shirt, or sweatshirt.
Any help is appreciated, so if you can't help out financially it's ok too. Please share my campaign via social media with your friends!
Thanks to everyone for your support.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column6:
Why What We're Doing Is Important

At RUXAK TM,

column1: a group of U.S. Military Veterans have come together, <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

outdoor adventures.  All too often, truly experiencing the outdoors remains out of reach for a lot people.  Quality gear is expensive, and learning the necessary outdoor recreational skills comes with its own challenges.  We want to change that!

At
RUXAK <sup>TM</sup>, we will tap into a nationwide network of veteran
instructors to implement a curriculum of tactical field and survival skills training,
coupled with the use of highly efficient and multifunctional equipment
through a series of high-octane competitive courses rooted in a long tradition of military
training and unsurpassed camaraderie.  Each course builds upon the skills achieved in the previous ones.  Those skills include:
All of our courses are designed to push our clients to a higher level of experience

and mentally demanding while delivering a one-of-a-kind, rewarding experience.

Our equipment solutions include high-quality equipment suited just for your excursion.
column2: >We are even bringing together our own RUXAK

column4: >lines of light-weight, extremely durable packs and light-weight, compressible sleeping bag systems that
column5: >bring together durability, comfort and tactical efficiency.  What we do not offer in our own lines, we will provide through trustworthy authorized retailer agreements with the most highly respected brands in the industry.
column6: >In addition to the course's tactical field &amp
column7: survival skills and our efficient equipment solutions, we will also strengthen the personal courage, confidence, and capability awareness of each of our clients.  We will
column8: >equip you to triumph in your outdoor adventures.

column10: >, we are firmly committed to being a role model for how businesses can and should act and will:

column2: >Work diligently to expand and operate in

column1: a healthy, responsible, and sustainable manner
employment opportunities for our fellow veterans

column2: >Keeping true to our honor of never leaving our

column1: brothers or sisters behind by donating to veteran-centered non-profits

column2: >Make considerable donations to the National Park Foundation

column1: from our military training is that we know how to work together as one cohesive
unit in order to accomplish a mission.
We are also trained to be able to do more with less.  However, in order to accomplish the goals we
have set, and overcome the startup obstacles that are before us, we will need
you to “cover our six.”  Only with your
generous and much needed support, will we be able to make this company, and all
the positive change we hope to accomplish through it, a reality.  We invite you to join in camaraderie with RUXAK
TM to help us serve both people and planet!
this campaign is to raise $150,000—with hope that your generosity will take us
above and beyond that amount.  The target
amount will cover some of the startup costs for RUXAK <sup>TM</sup> and provide other opportunities for funding.
Having just recently transitioned from active duty as a U.S. Marine and
finishing my degree, and with two of our partners still serving on active duty
until later this year, we just simply do not have access to this kind of
generous support, we will be able to secure:
/ warehouse space required and funds for our operational expenses
for finishing our website development and design
ability to cover additional IT expenses needed for conducting business
which are the bulk of the startup costs
and testing for our innovative lines of lightweight, durable, efficiency packs

column5:
>Your Impact

While the amount left over, after the

column1: campaign's costs have been deducted, will not cover everything we need, your
help will still allow us at RUXAK <sup>TM</sup> to make huge progress in achieving
success in business and fulfillment in service to others.  You will expedite our ability provide
opportunities for more people to chase after their adventures and develop a
deep and lasting respect for the world in which we all live.  More importantly, you will ultimately make a
lasting impact in the lives of struggling veterans, for whom we will always fight.
For that, we salute you and will never
be able to completely show our immense gratitude.  However, as a small token of our appreciation,
we have some amazing perks to offer!

column4: >Perks! Make sure to check out each perk selection, listed on the right hand side, for any additional information associated with each one!

column2:
Challenges We Still Face

In spite of this campaign, and your generosity, we still face many challenges.  Firstly, even if we hit our goal in this campaign, we still will need considerably more funding to become fully operational.  Hitting our goal of $150,000 will be quite the accomplishment, but we will only net an approximate $64,500 from it after taxes, the cost of perks, and campaign fees.  We want to maintain strong financial health and reduce any amount of debt that we will inevitably have to take on to reach our actually projected $119,000 startup costs.

column1: Secondly, this is our first business venture and there is a lot to learn.  We have strong educations in business, and even stronger leadership and management experience, but all new entrepreneurs find themselves confronted with unique challenges associated with running a business.

Thirdly, we are doing what we can to partner with the best people to help us develop our prototypes, and ultimately our final renditions, for our new product lines as well as find high quality manufacturers that abide by a strong social responsibility to produce them.  Developing these partnerships, as with any form of relationship between two separate entities, presents its own challenges.  We want to make sure that we are aligned with the right people, so that the development iterations are kept to a minimum and we can deliver the best product to our customers as soon as possible.

We also know that aside from our education and experience, our passion and the innate ability to adapt and overcome, developed from many years of serving in the armed forces, allows us a strong position to overcome these challenges.  We are confident that we will succeed, as evident especially due to the strong support we have gained from you.  Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  There are many ways that partnering with us can still be achieved, which will ultimately help on two fronts.  It will assist people in gaining a better understanding, relationship and respect for the great outdoors through our equipment and educational solutions.  It will also help us both serve those that have served us—veterans—many of which are in need of help now, while also allowing us to stand guard and keep a watchful over our environment.  Some ways to partner with us include:

column2: >Getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign
column3: both by word of mouth and through all forms of social media.

column1:
Like our Facebook page, follow us on Twitter, and invite your friends to do so as well!  That way everyone can keep up with what we are doing.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!


    • Once again, for all your support we salute you!!!
