All of our courses are designed to push our clients to a higher level of experience

and mentally demanding while delivering a one-of-a-kind, rewarding experience.Our equipment solutions include high-quality equipment suited just for your excursion.  We are even bringing together our own RUXAK

TM lines of light-weight, extremely durable packs and light-weight, compressible sleeping bag systems that bring together durability, comfort and tactical efficiency.  What we do not offer in our own lines, we will provide through trustworthy authorized retailer agreements with the most highly respected brands in the industry.  In addition to the course's tactical field & survival skills and our efficient equipment solutions, we will also strengthen the personal courage, confidence, and capability awareness of each of our clients.  We will equip you to triumph in your outdoor adventures.
At RUXAK TM, we are firmly committed to being a role model for how businesses can and should act and will:
Work diligently to expand and operate in
a healthy, responsible, and sustainable manner
employment opportunities for our fellow veterans
Keeping true to our honor of never leaving our
brothers or sisters behind by donating to veteran-centered non-profits
Make considerable donations to the National Park Foundation
from our military training is that we know how to work together as one cohesive
unit in order to accomplish a mission.
We are also trained to be able to do more with less.  However, in order to accomplish the goals we
have set, and overcome the startup obstacles that are before us, we will need
you to “cover our six.”  Only with your
generous and much needed support, will we be able to make this company, and all
the positive change we hope to accomplish through it, a reality.  We invite you to join in camaraderie with RUXAK
TM to help us serve both people and planet!
this campaign is to raise $150,000—with hope that your generosity will take us
above and beyond that amount.  The target
amount will cover some of the startup costs for RUXAK TM and provide other opportunities for funding.
Having just recently transitioned from active duty as a U.S. Marine and
finishing my degree, and with two of our partners still serving on active duty
until later this year, we just simply do not have access to this kind of
generous support, we will be able to secure:
/ warehouse space required and funds for our operational expenses
for finishing our website development and design
ability to cover additional IT expenses needed for conducting business
which are the bulk of the startup costs
and testing for our innovative lines of lightweight, durable, efficiency packs
Your ImpactWhile the amount left over, after the
campaign's costs have been deducted, will not cover everything we need, your
help will still allow us at RUXAK TM to make huge progress in achieving
success in business and fulfillment in service to others.  You will expedite our ability provide
opportunities for more people to chase after their adventures and develop a
deep and lasting respect for the world in which we all live.  More importantly, you will ultimately make a
lasting impact in the lives of struggling veterans, for whom we will always fight.
For that, we salute you and will never
be able to completely show our immense gratitude.  However, as a small token of our appreciation,
we have some amazing perks to offer!
Perks! Make sure to check out each perk selection, listed on the right hand side, for any additional information associated with each one!

Risks & Challenges We Still Face  In spite of this campaign, and your generosity, we still face many challenges.  Firstly, even if we hit our goal in this campaign, we still will need considerably more funding to become fully operational.  Hitting our goal of $150,000 will be quite the accomplishment, but we will only net an approximate $64,500 from it after taxes, the cost of perks, and campaign fees.  We want to maintain strong financial health and reduce any amount of debt that we will inevitably have to take on to reach our actually projected $119,000 startup costs.

Secondly, this is our first business venture and there is a lot to learn.  We have strong educations in business, and even stronger leadership and management experience, but all new entrepreneurs find themselves confronted with unique challenges associated with running a business.

Thirdly, we are doing what we can to partner with the best people to help us develop our prototypes, and ultimately our final renditions, for our new product lines as well as find high quality manufacturers that abide by a strong social responsibility to produce them.  Developing these partnerships, as with any form of relationship between two separate entities, presents its own challenges.  We want to make sure that we are aligned with the right people, so that the development iterations are kept to a minimum and we can deliver the best product to our customers as soon as possible.

We also know that aside from our education and experience, our passion and the innate ability to adapt and overcome, developed from many years of serving in the armed forces, allows us a strong position to overcome these challenges.  We are confident that we will succeed, as evident especially due to the strong support we have gained from you.  Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help We understand that some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  There are many ways that partnering with us can still be achieved, which will ultimately help on two fronts.  It will assist people in gaining a better understanding, relationship and respect for the great outdoors through our equipment and educational solutions.  It will also help us both serve those that have served us—veterans—many of which are in need of help now, while also allowing us to stand guard and keep a watchful over our environment.  Some ways to partner with us include:
Getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign
column2: both by word of mouth and through all forms of social media.

column1: Like our Facebook page, follow us on Twitter, and invite your friends to do so as well!  That way everyone can keep up with what we are doing. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!   Once again, for all your support we salute you!!!",6.0,1,"1 Campaign

column6:
>Mezoco is Fun
Mezoco is Fresh 
Mezoco is Community

column1: Think Carnitas... slow fried pork shoulder, melting in your mouth.
Think Steak... spice rubbed, tender, with a perfect kick for you heat seekers.
Top it off with the Salsas Bar - Verde, Charred Chili, Pico, fresh vegetables, hot sauces, chilis, and more seasonal fresh options than you can load onto a single structurally sound taco...
But we know you'll do your best.

column5: >Best of all, think about all that deliciousness being made in a place that gives back to the community.

>My name is Greg Cuoco and I am a chef, restauranteur, and former United States Marine.  I have over 15 years experience in the food-service industry...I've seen the good, the bad, and the ridiculous.  I've got my bachelors degree in business management from Rutgers University in Newark as well as 2 successful business models I've set up for other companies which are now thriving restaurants

column1: Mezoco was born out of a desire not only to get some great tacos (we really love tacos) but to create a business that grows and flourishes through helping its employees and its community flourish.

column5: >What do these things have to do with each other?

column3: >Great working environments make great restaurant employees.

>By providing comprehensive, ongoing, on-the-job training, creating real growth opportunities within the business and offering a livable wage for our employees we can build the kind of business that people will want to work for. The kind of place that makes people hungry to work (and not just for the tacos).
>When your chef/server/busboy isn't worried about how they're going to make rent, they can put all of their energy into giving you the best taco experience you have ever had.

column1:
If you love Tacos...DONATE!  
If you love helping people...DONATE!  
If you love being at the start of a movement...DONATE!
If you still love Tacos... DONATE AGAIN!
WHAT WORKS FOR SUCCESSFUL BUSINESSES IS SIMPLE:

column3: >It needs to be about the people

column1: <li>Feed people great food at a reasonable price
<li>Give the guest a new best experience every time they walk in the door
<li>Make what we are doing about community, not just profits
• We are already teamed up with the Community FoodBank of New Jersey!!!  We want to make sure EVERYONE gets fed.
What my true inspiration has to say about all this...

column2: >The magnitude of what this can achieve is staggering.  One location gives jobs,  training to roughly 10 people, and gives back to local charities.  That's 10 people making enough money to support themselves and grow.  In addition, for every $1,000 donated to the Community FoodBank of New Jersey that is $10,000 worth of food given to those in need.  Double that and you have 20 people making great money and $20,000 worth of food being provided. AND TWICE AS MANY PEOPLE HAVING ACCESS TO AMAZING TACOS!

column5: >Idealistic. SURE IS! Realistic. DEFINITELY! The only thing stopping so many people from making enough money to live well and grow is an outdated way of doing business.  This gives all people from all walks of life a chance at the American dream.  Not everyone can go to college, but that doesn't mean they aren't hard working.  Train them, set the bar high, and expect nothing less.

column1: Let's help those less fortunate by feeding them great food, great jobs, and the opportunity for a great future.

column2:
What You Get

We are looking to raise $75,000 to help bring this business to life.  We already have $10,000 in the bank of our own money.  This along with all additional proceeds will go directly to start-up costs of equipment, inventory, uniforms, and most importantly, training our staff.

column1: OH the swag!!!  Cooking Lessons, Personal Caterings, Bumper stickers, Pens, Notepads, T-shirts, Hot Sauces, and an Invite to the Grand Opening Party!!!
You also get the satisfaction of a belly full of delicious food while helping those in need!
A few words from the people that know me best...

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest way anyone can help other than by a financial contribution is to get enthusiastic, get loud, and spread the word to everyone you know.
""Nothing great was ever accomplished without enthusiasm."" Ralph Waldo Emerson
Please use all the social media you have available and spread the word about what we are doing here.
Please Donate!!! We need your help to feed those in need AND feed you incredible tacos!
Mezoco is FunMezoco is Fresh Mezoco is Community
Think Carnitas... slow fried pork shoulder, melting in your mouth.
Think Chicken... marinated, zesty, and juicy.
Think Steak... spice rubbed, tender, with a perfect kick for you heat seekers.
Top it off with the Salsas Bar - Verde, Charred Chili, Pico, fresh vegetables, hot sauces, chilis, and more seasonal fresh options than you can load onto a single structurally sound taco...
But we know you'll do your best.
Best of all, think about all that deliciousness being made in a place that gives back to the community.

My name is Greg Cuoco and I am a chef, restauranteur, and former United States Marine.  I have over 15 years experience in the food-service industry...I've seen the good, the bad, and the ridiculous.  I've got my bachelors degree in business management from Rutgers University in Newark as well as 2 successful business models I've set up for other companies which are now thriving restaurants.
Mezoco was born out of a desire not only to get some great tacos (we really love tacos) but to create a business that grows and flourishes through helping its employees and its community flourish.
What do these things have to do with each other?
Great restaurant employees make great food.
Great working environments make great restaurant employees.

By providing comprehensive, ongoing, on-the-job training, creating real growth opportunities within the business and offering a livable wage for our employees we can build the kind of business that people will want to work for. The kind of place that makes people hungry to work (and not just for the tacos).
When your chef/server/busboy isn't worried about how they're going to make rent, they can put all of their energy into giving you the best taco experience you have ever had.
If you love Tacos...DONATE!  If you love helping people...DONATE!  If you love being at the start of a movement...DONATE!If you still love Tacos... DONATE AGAIN!
WHAT WORKS FOR SUCCESSFUL BUSINESSES IS SIMPLE:
It needs to be about the people:
Feed people great food at a reasonable price
Train your staff continuously and comprehensively
Give the guest a new best experience every time they walk in the door
Make what we are doing about community, not just profits
We are already teamed up with the Community FoodBank of New Jersey!!!  We want to make sure EVERYONE gets fed.
What my true inspiration has to say about all this...

The magnitude of what this can achieve is staggering.  One location gives jobs,  training to roughly 10 people, and gives back to local charities.  That's 10 people making enough money to support themselves and grow.  In addition, for every $1,000 donated to the Community FoodBank of New Jersey that is $10,000 worth of food given to those in need.  Double that and you have 20 people making great money and $20,000 worth of food being provided. AND TWICE AS MANY PEOPLE HAVING ACCESS TO AMAZING TACOS!

Idealistic. SURE IS! Realistic. DEFINITELY! The only thing stopping so many people from making enough money to live well and grow is an outdated way of doing business.  This gives all people from all walks of life a chance at the American dream.  Not everyone can go to college, but that doesn't mean they aren't hard working.  Train them, set the bar high, and expect nothing less.
Let's help those less fortunate by feeding them great food, great jobs, and the opportunity for a great future.

What We Need & What You Get We are looking to raise $75,000 to help bring this business to life.  We already have $10,000 in the bank of our own money.  This along with all additional proceeds will go directly to start-up costs of equipment, inventory, uniforms, and most importantly, training our staff.
OH the swag!!!  Cooking Lessons, Personal Caterings, Bumper stickers, Pens, Notepads, T-shirts, Hot Sauces, and an Invite to the Grand Opening Party!!!
You also get the satisfaction of a belly full of delicious food while helping those in need!
A few words from the people that know me best...
Other Ways You Can Help The biggest way anyone can help other than by a financial contribution is to get enthusiastic, get loud, and spread the word to everyone you know.
Nothing great was ever accomplished without enthusiasm."" Ralph Waldo Emerson
Please use all the social media you have available and spread the word about what we are doing here.
Please Donate!!! We need your help to feed those in need AND feed you incredible tacos!",4.0,2,"1 Campaign

column2: >Aloft has risen over the last ten years from humble beginnings to become one of the largest physical theater and contemporary circus schools in the county.  While we love the building we called ""home"" for the past 8 years it has inhibited us in some ways, namely because it is located in an industrial zone.  We're ready to pack up our trapezes and sparkly unitards and move into our own building -- one that will allow us to offer classes to all ages of students, public performances for the community, access for variably-abled persons, and more!  In order to do that we're reaching out to you.  We found the perfect forever home in a 107 year-old church in the Logan Square neighborhood of Chicago and beat out a number of real estate developers vying to turn that church into condos.  We have the down payment covered, but need your help in covering the cost of renovations and re-zoning.

column1: Yes. Seriously. In 2005, Shayna Swanson began Aloft with $5000 in her pocket, a loan from a dedicated student and friend. With that small investment she leased a small garage space in an alley in Humboldt Park. Aloft remained in the space for 2 years, then moved to a small business incubator space on the West Side of Chicago. The company has subsequently expanded to a 13,000 square foot facility in the same building.

However, Aloft has been facing the bittersweet termination of our lease in that incubator space at ICNC. After meeting with our landlords and asking if that was negotiable, and maybe they could just do us a solid and let us stay forever, they said, “Nope, sorry, little birds. It's time to fly out of the nest”. They suggested we begin looking for new places to move as soon as possible to get the ball rolling. It’s not easy to find a building suitable for circus, with 30 foot ceilings, in neighborhoods that are at least as good as the one we are currently in and not in the suburbs and not 800,000 sq ft. There’s a lot of 18 ft barrel truss buildings, but that would be a downgrade. So, we started rolling the ball.
It rolled, pretty quickly, to 3324 W Wrightwood. We made them an offer and they accepted and we’ve gone under contract on the building. We are buying a 107 year old church!

While we love our home for the last 8 years, because of our location in an industrial district, we have been inhibited in some ways. Currently we do not offer classes for students under 18 because our zoning won’t allow it. We would like to offer public performances of our work in a venue licensed for such activities. Additionally, while we are on a good bus line, our distance from the train keeps quite a few students from accessing us. Locating the business in a more populated, bustling neighborhood would not only help us grow, but bring new business to the surrounding area as well. Our space needs are highly specific and very hard to find. In order to maintain the quality and uniqueness of our training we need to have a large open space with ceilings of at least 25 ft. Very few buildings meet these needs, and those that do are often located in industrial areas. Locating in a more central and accessible location will help our visibility in the city really blossom, attracting clients who will hire us for events in Chicago and beyond.
This building is a dream. Help it come true.

The building that we have found is the perfect combination of affordability, structure and accessibility. We've got the loan, we've got the downpayment, we've got a plan that helps us put more money in the ""making awesome shows"" pot, but now we come to you to ask for your help in paying for the renovations. Nothing major is necessary, but rigging in particular, is nothing to do on the cheap. We will be hiring Chicago Flyhouse, one of the country's top rigging companies to do our install. We also need to level the floor and finish out the basement apartment in the 2 flat. Plus little things, like paint, electric and a zoning lawyer.

• $35,000 Rigging. As aerialists, we know that this is not the place to skimp. We will skimp on the pizza budget, but the rigging needs to be top notch, and fitting a 107 year old church with quality rigging is our biggest move in expense.

• $15,000 Ceiling removal. The church currently has the most beautiful tin false ceiling. Our hope is that we can find a antique architectural salvage company to take the ceiling down and pay us for it...in which case this funding will go towards more rigging.

• $20,000 Floor leveling and installation. The floor in the sanctuary slopes to the front over one foot from front to back. While this is great for seeing a church service, it's not so great for doing cyr wheel or tumbling. We need to level that floor out and install a spring dance floor in the basement studio, which is currently tile. Ouch.

• $15,000 Basement apartment renovation. One of the amazing things about this property is the apartment building with 2 apartments. With this we can house students coming to our Full-time training program from out of town, as well as staff and artists who want to live 5 ft from where they train! No other circus school in the country can offer this. We plan to create a 3rd (legal) apartment in the basement. Rent from the apartments offsets our mortgage and allows us to put more money toward making and facilitating amazing work!

• $7,000 Zoning. Unfortunately, you can't just wander into a church and start a circus school without convincing the neighborhood that its in their best interest. Which it OBVIOUSLY is. But, we need to get a zoning change. We have the support of many people in the community, and we have tons of academic research on our side about how much circus can directly benefit a community. It's really either us or condos. We have no doubt that this zoning change will happen...it's just going to cost money to hire a lawyer and file all the papers!
• $8,000 Additional renovations. Namely, having the electric rewired. If we buy this place, the last thing we want if for it to burn down.

For your generosity, you'll see circus grow and bloom in all new ways and places in Chicago. You'll be helping us design a state-of-the-art rigging system and a circus school that's easy to get to and safe to hang out in front of. But, really, what you want to know about are the perks, right? Trust me...no one has better perks.
Your portrait in a giant frame in the lobby
Training for a special appearance in ECC

In circus training, we fail everyday. Failing is part of learning, but you learn to pick yourself up, examine the details of what happened, determine where the problem was, and try again. And again. It's this tenacity that makes circus people different. When we perform, people say, ""DON'T YOU USE A NET!?!"" and are shocked when we say no. We create a system of nets within our own bodies and minds, accustomed to what could go wrong. The apparatus acts as our net by applying the correct wraps and locks. And we don't take a risk until we've determined that we can do something a million times close to the ground safely.

Sometimes, its more of a risk to not take one. To remain stagnant and complacent and not challenge yourself and not move upward. Sometimes staying too close to the ground is more dangerous than climbing. That's were Aloft is. We are at ""grow or die"". We've never been afraid to grow and we know that our community will catch us.

If for some terribly sad reason, we fall short on our goal, no one ever gets to do circus again....just kidding!!! This is circus, we will find a way to make it happen! We will do benefit shows, borrow against our swivel collection...whatever it takes!

When Aloft began we offered 4 classes per week. We now have over 50 classes per week. Two years ago we began a Full-Time Training Program for students who wish to pursue a career in physical theater and contemporary circus. We’ve since graduated two classes, 23 students in total, many of whom are now teaching and performing professionally for our company and others around the country. In our recreational classes, we teach over 250 adult students every week. Aloft employs 25 part time and three full time staff at highly competitive wages, as well as providing performers for events and shows around the world.

Aside from our initial loan of $5000, Aloft has never borrowed money and has grown significantly in gross revenue every year. We’ve never had a year end in the red. We attribute this success to many things--namely a slow, sustainable growth plan and the community environment that we foster in our studio. We have a loyal base of professional artists and students that expands every year. When people come to Aloft, they feel as though they have found more than just an exciting art form that also happens to provides a physical and mental workout...they feel as though they have found a family.

When you contribute to this campaign, you're essentially helping this family grow into the entire city. Leaving the industrial district will help us connect with more people, everyday. Aloft's visablity will grow, we will become part of the cultural landscape of Logan Square and Chicago and our work will be enriched in the process. Plus, you're ensuring that there will be a place for circus lovers to embrace their passion, though learning, performing or teaching for years and years to come.

Even if you, personally, can't donate...we are sure you know someone who can. Won't you please share this with your social media world? Link to us on Facebook or Twitter. Or, come see us do a show, come take a class, or go see a circus whenever you can. It's an art form that needs your support as it grows in this country. Become a circus fan, if you aren't already. You'll be amazed at what's possible when people put their minds to something.

Or, come see us do a show, come take a class, or go see a circus whenever you can. It's an art form that needs your support as it grows in this country. Become a circus fan, if you aren't already. You'll be amazed at what's possible when people put their minds to something.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Why Burly...Why Beverages?

  • My name is Gabriel Aiello, and I'm the head honcho over here at Burly Beverages.  I have a beard and curly hair and I love redwood burls. The business is based in Sacramento, California which is also the city that I call my home sweet home. We hand make and sell small batch, craft, natural sodas, soft drinks, shrubs and switchels.
  • This venture started with a quest for a better ginger beer. As my searches fell short I decided to teach myself to make some from scratch. While learning how to craft these beverages, I fell in love with the process and quickly realized that I was creating something special.
• I currently work for two local small businesses. The owners of each, Tony Espinoza and Jason Poole, have both inspired and encouraged me to turn this idea into a start-up business of my own.

• I previously worked for two lovely ladies at an organic-cold pressed juicery, Molly Brown and Tatiana Kaiser...they have also been a source of inspiration and have encouraged me to follow my passion for food and drink. They allowed me to experiment with flavor combinations and while working for them I learned sooo much about healthy living and the nutritional value of real food.
  • This campaign will assist Burly Beverages in obtaining all of the necessary licensing and permitting required to operate this sort of business. These funds will also facilitate the purchase of logo and branding materials, equipment, ingredients, and the first round of bottles.

• It is my personal mission to use Burly Beverages as a vehicle to promote a quirky and health-minded approach to sodas and soft drinks by using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients, natural sweeteners and a small batch mentality to assure a consistent, high quality product.
<li>Burly Beverages in the Sacramento Business Journal!!! ---&gt
<ul><li>Burly Beverages in the East Sacramento News!!! ---&gt

Break down:

  • I am requesting $6000 for this campaign. The bulk of this will be split between the permitting and licenses, which cost approximately $1500, and the initial bulk bottle purchase is $1000. I am setting aside about $2000 for label design and branding materials imagined and incarnated by the incomparable Sacramento designer David Angstead of Angry City (angrycity.net). Equipment such as pony kegs, CO2 canisters, pressure regulation systems, etc. will cost roughly $700. This leaves approximately $300 for ingredients and $500ish for my perk fulfillment. 
  • I think the perks here speak for themselves...but I'll expand on the details as the campaign progresses.

• I understand that not every campaign makes it to the finish line. While it would be humbling and honoring to surpass my goal, in the event it is not reached,my priorities lie in the permitting and licensing and the branding. 

    • The Impact

    • My mission here is to create an all-natural product that is an alternative to the status quo of today's soft drinks and beverages. These tonics, if you will, are designed using quality ingredients, locally-sourced produce, and REAL sweeteners. While sugar is sugar, and should always be consumed in moderation, the sugars and sweeteners used in these elixirs are in their rawest forms and retain all of their nutritional elements.

• Sodas and soft drinks were, at one time in our history, found in pharmacies across the nation. These beverages may have been recommended by physicians and pharmacists alike in order to ease certain ailments. Burly Beverages is committed to aligning itself with these principles.

column2: >Sacramento is considered one of the leaders in the Farm-to-Fork movement. The current trajectory of local curiosity is inspiring a new generation of culinary pioneers, who focus on high-quality, small batch craft products. I hope to promote this burgeoning culture and celebrate our local innovators
column3: in other words, I would like to nurture and guide other potential entrepreneurs and makers as I have been encouraged by my mentors.

column1: • Recently, Sacramento locals have enjoyed my monthly pop-up dinner event known as Meatless Monday. This tradition began with four close friends trying a new recipe in my apartment, and has grown exponentially in the past year or so.  The last event was held at a local establishment, Old Ironsides, and drew over 100 diners. Old Ironsides has allowed me to utilize these dinners as an opportunity to test market for a variety of my products, used as a mixer for cocktails, or on their own as sodas. At this events, I sold over 100 peach-honey shrub cocktails in under two hours. The success rate continues to increase with each event.

• The main reason I'm doing this is to offer a health minded alternative to the corn syrup, preservative laden sodas and soft drinks that line the shelves in practically every store. Burly Beverages presents a ""more than natural"" option. It's not quite kombucha, but it's closer to kombucha than it is modern sodas.

column2: >Sucanat is an alternative sweetener prepared by crushing the stems of sugar cane to extract the plant’s juice, and then turning the juice in a vacuum tunnel at high temperature to evaporate the water content. The dried whole food product is then milled to a powder that retains the same vitamin and mineral content as the original juice.
column3: >Sucanat is the only truly raw cane sugar product. Most brands of evaporated cane sugar are cooked to some extent. Typically, the extracted juice is boiled to a thick syrup that crystallizes as it cools and dries. Both Sucanat and evaporated cane products are healthier than refined sugar, which is further treated with lime or phosphoric acids, filtered, deodorized and bleached so that all nutrients are removed as molasses and only the simple sucrose remains.
column4: >One cup of whole raw sugar contains 1 g of protein, 1,125 mg of potassium, 1,600 IU of vitamin A, 49.5 mg of vitamin C, 165 mg of calcium, 6.5 mg of iron, 0.2 mg of niacin and 48 mg of phosphorus.

column2: >Vinegar. We've all heard that apple cider vinegar is good for us, it is a ph regulator in our gut and can help the body reach homeostasis by lowering blood sugar and increasing circulation. But, in my research, I've found that ALL vinegars have health benefits and they differ from one another. I take all of this into consideration when tinkering with my recipes. I blend these vinegars with one another to achieve maximum health benefit and flavor.

>Other sweeteners. I also employ, molasses (which is where all of the minerals and nutrients end up after sugar is refined), maple syrup (which contains more anti-oxidents than blueberries) agave syrup and raw honey (the only food known to man that will never spoil).

column1: • Shrubs. Sounds like a small plant. But in this form, a shrub is a method of preserving fruit juice that dates back to the ancient egyptian culture. In our part of the world, shrubs date back to the colonial era. It was the only way to enjoy fruit juice after its prime before refrigeration was invented. The preservation method involves making a syrup of vinegar, fruit juice and sugar. These days, you mostly see shrubs on craft cocktail menus. But, I have found that they make nice refreshing sodas when mixed with seltzer or club soda.

• Switchel. Originally called ""Haymakers Punch"", switchel is a traditionally non-carbonated soft drink not unlike the sports drinks we know today. But, this one ACTUALLY quenches thirst. Mid-day toiling in the hay fields, someone would inevitably bring out a jug of switchel for the workers to enjoy. It can be served warm, room temperature, or, ice cold (my favorite). At its core, switchel is apple cider vinegar. When mixed with molasses, maple syrup, or honey and a variety of spices, the flavor of switchel can vary greatly.

• Help me get the word out! Share, share, share!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
• If you have ANY questions about any of the things that you have read here today I highly encourage you to contact me at burlybeverages@gmail.com.

• Thank you!!!


    • ","Why Burly...Why Beverages? My name is Gabriel Aiello, and I'm the head honcho over here at Burly Beverages.  I have a beard and curly hair and I love redwood burls. The business is based in Sacramento, California which is also the city that I call my home sweet home. We hand make and sell small batch, craft, natural sodas, soft drinks, shrubs and switchels. This venture started with a quest for a better ginger beer. As my searches fell short I decided to teach myself to make some from scratch. While learning how to craft these beverages, I fell in love with the process and quickly realized that I was creating something special.
I currently work for two local small businesses. The owners of each, Tony Espinoza and Jason Poole, have both inspired and encouraged me to turn this idea into a start-up business of my own.

I previously worked for two lovely ladies at an organic-cold pressed juicery, Molly Brown and Tatiana Kaiser...they have also been a source of inspiration and have encouraged me to follow my passion for food and drink. They allowed me to experiment with flavor combinations and while working for them I learned sooo much about healthy living and the nutritional value of real food. This campaign will assist Burly Beverages in obtaining all of the necessary licensing and permitting required to operate this sort of business. These funds will also facilitate the purchase of logo and branding materials, equipment, ingredients, and the first round of bottles.

It is my personal mission to use Burly Beverages as a vehicle to promote a quirky and health-minded approach to sodas and soft drinks by using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients, natural sweeteners and a small batch mentality to assure a consistent, high quality product.

What We Need & What You Get

Break down:  I am requesting $6000 for this campaign. The bulk of this will be split between the permitting and licenses, which cost approximately $1500, and the initial bulk bottle purchase is $1000. I am setting aside about $2000 for label design and branding materials imagined and incarnated by the incomparable Sacramento designer David Angstead of Angry City (angrycity.net). Equipment such as pony kegs, CO2 canisters, pressure regulation systems, etc. will cost roughly $700. This leaves approximately $300 for ingredients and $500ish for my perk fulfillment.  I think the perks here speak for themselves...but I'll expand on the details as the campaign progresses.

I understand that not every campaign makes it to the finish line. While it would be humbling and honoring to surpass my goal, in the event it is not reached,my priorities lie in the permitting and licensing and the branding.     The Impact  My mission here is to create an all-natural product that is an alternative to the status quo of today's soft drinks and beverages. These tonics, if you will, are designed using quality ingredients, locally-sourced produce, and REAL sweeteners. While sugar is sugar, and should always be consumed in moderation, the sugars and sweeteners used in these elixirs are in their rawest forms and retain all of their nutritional elements.

Sodas and soft drinks were, at one time in our history, found in pharmacies across the nation. These beverages may have been recommended by physicians and pharmacists alike in order to ease certain ailments. Burly Beverages is committed to aligning itself with these principles.

Sacramento is considered one of the leaders in the Farm-to-Fork movement. The current trajectory of local curiosity is inspiring a new generation of culinary pioneers, who focus on high-quality, small batch craft products. I hope to promote this burgeoning culture and celebrate our local innovators
column2: in other words, I would like to nurture and guide other potential entrepreneurs and makers as I have been encouraged by my mentors.

column1: Recently, Sacramento locals have enjoyed my monthly pop-up dinner event known as Meatless Monday. This tradition began with four close friends trying a new recipe in my apartment, and has grown exponentially in the past year or so.  The last event was held at a local establishment, Old Ironsides, and drew over 100 diners. Old Ironsides has allowed me to utilize these dinners as an opportunity to test market for a variety of my products, used as a mixer for cocktails, or on their own as sodas. At this events, I sold over 100 peach-honey shrub cocktails in under two hours. The success rate continues to increase with each event.

The main reason I'm doing this is to offer a health minded alternative to the corn syrup, preservative laden sodas and soft drinks that line the shelves in practically every store. Burly Beverages presents a ""more than natural"" option. It's not quite kombucha, but it's closer to kombucha than it is modern sodas.

Sucanat sugar. Sucanat is an alternative sweetener prepared by crushing the stems of sugar cane to extract the plant’s juice, and then turning the juice in a vacuum tunnel at high temperature to evaporate the water content. The dried whole food product is then milled to a powder that retains the same vitamin and mineral content as the original juice. Sucanat is the only truly raw cane sugar product. Most brands of evaporated cane sugar are cooked to some extent. Typically, the extracted juice is boiled to a thick syrup that crystallizes as it cools and dries. Both Sucanat and evaporated cane products are healthier than refined sugar, which is further treated with lime or phosphoric acids, filtered, deodorized and bleached so that all nutrients are removed as molasses and only the simple sucrose remains. One cup of whole raw sugar contains 1 g of protein, 1,125 mg of potassium, 1,600 IU of vitamin A, 49.5 mg of vitamin C, 165 mg of calcium, 6.5 mg of iron, 0.2 mg of niacin and 48 mg of phosphorus.

Vinegar. We've all heard that apple cider vinegar is good for us, it is a ph regulator in our gut and can help the body reach homeostasis by lowering blood sugar and increasing circulation. But, in my research, I've found that ALL vinegars have health benefits and they differ from one another. I take all of this into consideration when tinkering with my recipes. I blend these vinegars with one another to achieve maximum health benefit and flavor.

Other sweeteners. I also employ, molasses (which is where all of the minerals and nutrients end up after sugar is refined), maple syrup (which contains more anti-oxidents than blueberries) agave syrup and raw honey (the only food known to man that will never spoil).

Shrubs. Sounds like a small plant. But in this form, a shrub is a method of preserving fruit juice that dates back to the ancient egyptian culture. In our part of the world, shrubs date back to the colonial era. It was the only way to enjoy fruit juice after its prime before refrigeration was invented. The preservation method involves making a syrup of vinegar, fruit juice and sugar. These days, you mostly see shrubs on craft cocktail menus. But, I have found that they make nice refreshing sodas when mixed with seltzer or club soda.

Switchel. Originally called ""Haymakers Punch"", switchel is a traditionally non-carbonated soft drink not unlike the sports drinks we know today. But, this one ACTUALLY quenches thirst. Mid-day toiling in the hay fields, someone would inevitably bring out a jug of switchel for the workers to enjoy. It can be served warm, room temperature, or, ice cold (my favorite). At its core, switchel is apple cider vinegar. When mixed with molasses, maple syrup, or honey and a variety of spices, the flavor of switchel can vary greatly.

Coffee at it's finest : game-changing coffees that will elevate your coffee experience and change the lives of coffee farmers worldwide! We're all in this together, so we proudly serve coffees that have been sourced from a Direct-Trade model. Please show us your support with a contribution to fund our project, or please contribute your time to letting your friends or networks know about what we are all about here at Nova Coffee Labs, and how they can help us to build our community as a community. Thanks a million in advance- We love you for it

Nova Coffee Labs was founded by two best friends that met in detention, and later when on to starting a band. After college and living in different cities while working all along in specialty coffee shops, they would reunite every year with instruments in Central and South America to learn songs and seek out the best spots for espresso.

The coffee company was a constant discussion on long plane rides or on long hikes, but years later, when they both finally found themselves back home in Virginia looking for answers, there was only one thing left to do. With every penny that they saved from roasting and barista jobs, they bought some nifty coffee equipment and tools and built coffee bars from reclaimed wood and green coffee pallet wood. When they set out to lease a Main St. storefront, they realized it was financially impossible, so they cleaned and painted a residential garage and had it zoned for business storage and training.

They reached out to several friends and local business to host popups, and got busy brewing for folks in Guitar Shops, Wine Bars, Grocery stores, and we were having the time of their lives: just brewing coffee for people and flabbergasting our guests that coffee could truly taste THIS GOOD!

column15: >This campaign is so important to us because it will help us turn our one of a kind ""Coffee Caravan"" into an instant success!

column2: >We have been loading our bar, equipment, and product into 2 compact cars, but was recently reduced to just one, and it's been very time consuming, heavy, and risky for our equipment. Not to mention, we've had limited space in one small car and have had to leave important equipment behind. It has also imposed plenty of limitations on our abilities to make it happen more frequently. We started to receive emails, and text messages wondering where we were going to be several times a day, and led us to conclude that we needed an alternative solution to our mobility issues ~ we needed to build our bar on wheels!

>With a small and portable coffee caravan, we could pull our entire bar out everyday as we are currently working with towns all over Northern Virginia to designate permits to setup as a food truck in the street, and will continue to host popups at vineyards and breweries, concerts, festivals and fairs as well as catering for private and events and parties (to find out more-visit our about section at www.novacoffeelabs.com ). We will also be able to reevaluate our higher prices for private party or wedding catering because it will involve far less setting up and labor.

column1: We have put together a solid team of baristas, techs, artists, videographers, and  and coffee industry professionals from Northern Virginia and Washington D.C. to help in designing our caravan to ensure reliability, convenience, consistency, precision, professionalism and awesome design.
All we need now, is your help.
column2:
>Let's break it down together :
  • We are going to need a total of $ 20,000 to meet our goal.
column3: >THAT'S A LOT! We know tis' and that's why I am happy to explain why it's going to take that to make this whole thing happen.

column2: >""Wait a sec', what happens to my donation if Nova Coffee Labs doesn't meet their goal?""                                                                                                                                    If we don't happen to meet our goal, as much as we don't want to imagine that as a possibility, our mission is to continue to develop the caravan with the necessary equipment, and will definitely slow the sooner release of our caravan all together. We guarantee it will still happen regardless, as we are not all in this for nothing!

>""Well hold on, what's this? You've already met your goal? Why should I contribute at this point?""                                                                                                            If we have met our goal- ALL EXTRA PROCEEDS GO TOWARDS A VEHICLE THAT WILL TOW THE CARAVAN!! :D

>All We Need Is Love

This company is founded on friendship and community and your recommendation is highly appreciated!  Here are a few things that can go a long way:

Nova Coffee Labs was founded by two best friends that met in detention, and later when on to starting a band. After college and living in different cities while working all along in specialty coffee shops, they would reunite every year with instruments in Central and South America to learn songs and seek out the best spots for espresso.

The coffee company was a constant discussion on long plane rides or on long hikes, but years later, when they both finally found themselves back home in Virginia looking for answers, there was only one thing left to do. With every penny that they saved from roasting and barista jobs, they bought some nifty coffee equipment and tools and built coffee bars from reclaimed wood and green coffee pallet wood. When they set out to lease a Main St. storefront, they realized it was financially impossible, so they cleaned and painted a residential garage and had it zoned for business storage and training.

They reached out to several friends and local business to host popups, and got busy brewing for folks in Guitar Shops, Wine Bars, Grocery stores, and we were having the time of their lives: just brewing coffee for people and flabbergasting our guests that coffee could truly taste THIS GOOD!
This campaign is so important to us because it will help us turn our one of a kind ""Coffee Caravan"" into an instant success!

We have been loading our bar, equipment, and product into 2 compact cars, but was recently reduced to just one, and it's been very time consuming, heavy, and risky for our equipment. Not to mention, we've had limited space in one small car and have had to leave important equipment behind. It has also imposed plenty of limitations on our abilities to make it happen more frequently. We started to receive emails, and text messages wondering where we were going to be several times a day, and led us to conclude that we needed an alternative solution to our mobility issues ~ we needed to build our bar on wheels!

With a small and portable coffee caravan, we could pull our entire bar out everyday as we are currently working with towns all over Northern Virginia to designate permits to setup as a food truck in the street, and will continue to host popups at vineyards and breweries, concerts, festivals and fairs as well as catering for private and events and parties (to find out more-visit our about section at www.novacoffeelabs.com ). We will also be able to reevaluate our higher prices for private party or wedding catering because it will involve far less setting up and labor.

The Leadhills and Wanlockhead Railway is Britains highest adhesion railway. Situated in the village of Leadhills in the Lowther Hills, we are a registered charity staffed entirely by volunteers, with the aim of preserving, restoring, and running railway vehicles of historical and industrial significance.
column5: >We also run a train service every weekend from April till September, and enjoy educating visitors of all ages in various aspects of narrow-gauge railway operation.

column1: Our aim is to build a weather-tight storage shed for our rolling stock.  Our site is at 1450ft above sea-level and is subject to extreme weather during the winter.  At the moment we only have one shed in which to store, repair, and preserve all of our locomotives and stock.  As a result, many of our heritage items have to be left outside which leads to much quicker deterioration, and in many cases the loss of entire items of rare stock.  Making our target will mean that we can build a rolling stock shed to house the collection of carriages and locomotives we have and free up the engineering shed to serve the purpose it was intended for: Vehicle maintenance, repair and restoration.  It will also serve to store our items awaiting restoration, thus removing them from the harmful effects of the extreme weather.

column2:
What You Get

The shed we would like to build is of a similar design to our current engineering shed.  It is an arched structure, which is designed to withstand the strong winds we experience up at 1450ft.  It is of aluminium construction, which means it will not rust and it requires minimal maintenance.  The cost of the shed is £18,000 and we would also need to have a ring foundation constructed to secure it to the ground. In total we need £31,000.  The money that we raise will aid us to get match funding from other sources such as the Clyde Wind Farm Fund or the Heritage Lottery Fund.

column1: There are a few ways we would like to thank you for any donations received:
£10 - You will be personally thanked in our regular newsletter.
£30 - You will be granted an Adult Membership of the railway which entitles you to free train rides any weekend during our operating season. (excluding special events)
£50 - You will be granted a Family Membership which entitles you and your immediate family to free train rides any weekend during our operating season. (excluding special events)
£75 - You will be granted an Adult Membership and your choice of a Polo Shirt or a Beanie Hat with the railway logo on it.
£100 - You will be granted an Adult Membership and a Driver Experience day, where you will spend the day at the controls of one of our heritage diesel locomotives.

Any money we raise will be used as match funding, so your contributions will be worth double to the railway.  We have recently been granted money from the Clyde Wind farm to buy a Tamping Machine, which was matched by donations. This was necessary for the maintenance of the track and cost £24,000.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please forward this on to anyone who may be interested in our campaign.
  • Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!


","Who We Are

The Leadhills and Wanlockhead Railway is Britains highest adhesion railway. Situated in the village of Leadhills in the Lowther Hills, we are a registered charity staffed entirely by volunteers, with the aim of preserving, restoring, and running railway vehicles of historical and industrial significance.  We also run a train service every weekend from April till September, and enjoy educating visitors of all ages in various aspects of narrow-gauge railway operation.

Our aim is to build a weather-tight storage shed for our rolling stock.  Our site is at 1450ft above sea-level and is subject to extreme weather during the winter.  At the moment we only have one shed in which to store, repair, and preserve all of our locomotives and stock.  As a result, many of our heritage items have to be left outside which leads to much quicker deterioration, and in many cases the loss of entire items of rare stock.  Making our target will mean that we can build a rolling stock shed to house the collection of carriages and locomotives we have and free up the engineering shed to serve the purpose it was intended for: Vehicle maintenance, repair and restoration.  It will also serve to store our items awaiting restoration, thus removing them from the harmful effects of the extreme weather.

What We Need & What You Get The shed we would like to build is of a similar design to our current engineering shed.  It is an arched structure, which is designed to withstand the strong winds we experience up at 1450ft.  It is of aluminium construction, which means it will not rust and it requires minimal maintenance.  The cost of the shed is £18,000 and we would also need to have a ring foundation constructed to secure it to the ground. In total we need £31,000.  The money that we raise will aid us to get match funding from other sources such as the Clyde Wind Farm Fund or the Heritage Lottery Fund.
There are a few ways we would like to thank you for any donations received:
£10 - You will be personally thanked in our regular newsletter.
£30 - You will be granted an Adult Membership of the railway which entitles you to free train rides any weekend during our operating season. (excluding special events)
£50 - You will be granted a Family Membership which entitles you and your immediate family to free train rides any weekend during our operating season. (excluding special events)
£75 - You will be granted an Adult Membership and your choice of a Polo Shirt or a Beanie Hat with the railway logo on it.
£100 - You will be granted an Adult Membership and a Driver Experience day, where you will spend the day at the controls of one of our heritage diesel locomotives.

Any money we raise will be used as match funding, so your contributions will be worth double to the railway.  We have recently been granted money from the Clyde Wind farm to buy a Tamping Machine, which was matched by donations. This was necessary for the maintenance of the track and cost £24,000.
Other Ways You Can Help  Please forward this on to anyone who may be interested in our campaign. Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

I feel very fortunate to have had the opportunity get my jewelry design business off the ground. Now, as I look ahead to what needs to be done to take Kenneth Pierre Designs to the next level and truly become part of the independent artist community, I need your help. Your financial contributions -- no matter what the amount -- will help me finish the creation of a functional home studio and fund the cost of supplies I need to become a regular presence at art shows and festivals.

• Tools for my studio to allow me to teach lessons on jewelry making and pass on my knowledge of the craft I love.
  • Supplies for art shows and festivals including tables, a tent/canopy, a chair, a sturdy cart, tablecloths, packaging, and business cards.
  • Entry fees for the arts shows and festivals.
• Donations of $5 to $29 receive my heartfelt gratitude!
• Donations of $30 to $59 receive my heartfelt gratitude PLUS your choice of a dog tag for your pup or a charm for a necklace or key chain.
• Donations of $60 to $99 receive my heartfelt gratitude PLUS your  an inspiration cuff with your choice of saying.
• Donations of $100 to $199 receive my heartfelt gratitude PLUS your  choice of a pair of silver earrings shown below.
• Donations of $200 and above receive my heartfelt gratitude PLUS a gift certificate to my shop.

<div>Independent artists have always been an integral part of the fabric of American society. While it used to be common for artists and artisans to make a living at their chosen craft (even if it was a modest one), the shift toward mass consumerism has made this more difficult. Mosts artists are drawn to their craft first and foremost for the love of the work. Some people create art for display
column2: I create wearable art. I am proud to create pieces of jewelry that spring from surprising sources of inspiration (see my Clarendon Line) and that will go on to be part of someone's story. That is why true art is rarely discarded. Far more often, a cherished piece of art is passed on to someone else. It is meaningful because it was created by someone who truly cares about the work as much as the profit. Fortunately, there is a renaissance underway and Americans are rediscovering the joy of owning art that was created by hand, with love. Thank you for helping me be a part of it.

column1: I started making jewelry about 17 years ago with beading and wire wrapping.  I did it on and off for years but never tried to sell my pieces.  Then about 4 years ago I decided I wanted to expand my skills and I took a soldering class.  I was hooked.  I took more classes and practiced my skills whenever I had a free moment.  I absolutely love working with metal and creating what I like to call mini sculptures!
How do you select the materials you work with?

I choose the materials by playing with them.  I usually take out a bunch of materials and push them around together and hold them in different ways. Usually I will get a feeling for what I want to create.  I love to figure out how to make certain materials work together.
What three words describe your design aesthetic?
Three words...  modern, geometrical, industrial.  These are words I have heard others use to describe my pieces and I would agree.
What do you know to be true about creating quality jewelry?

I believe that to create quality jewelry you have to really love what you do.  It is important to me to create pieces that I love.  If I don't love the pieces then how can I expect someone else to.  I also won't create jewelry if I am angry or upset about something.  I know this sounds goofy but i feel like we put our energy into the things we make and I don't want to impart negative energy on anyone.  With that being said, I love creating jewelry so it is rare that I am angry while in my studio.  :)  I also think to create quality jewelry you need to not be afraid to push boundaries and try something new.  It is art and art is never wrong!
Where did the name Kenneth Pierre come from?
Kenneth was my father and Pierre was my grandfather.  The name is my dedication to them!

I feel very fortunate to have had the opportunity get my jewelry design business off the ground. Now, as I look ahead to what needs to be done to take Kenneth Pierre Designs to the next level and truly become part of the independent artist community, I need your help. Your financial contributions -- no matter what the amount -- will help me finish the creation of a functional home studio and fund the cost of supplies I need to become a regular presence at art shows and festivals.

Tools for my studio to allow me to teach lessons on jewelry making and pass on my knowledge of the craft I love. Supplies for art shows and festivals including tables, a tent/canopy, a chair, a sturdy cart, tablecloths, packaging, and business cards. Entry fees for the arts shows and festivals.
Donations of $5 to $29 receive my heartfelt gratitude!
Donations of $30 to $59 receive my heartfelt gratitude PLUS your choice of a dog tag for your pup or a charm for a necklace or key chain.

Donations of $200 and above receive my heartfelt gratitude PLUS a gift certificate to my shop.

pronounced: may-rah-kee -- To do something with soul, creativity, or love
column2: To put “something of yourself” into what you’re doing.

column1: Thousands of individuals all over the planet are in need of a dedicated assistant, but want to save $$$.
Companies with dedicated remote assistant models start with the right idea, but ultimately end up failing.
The main reasons are: burn and high turnover.
Poor planning and lack of knowledgeable staff leads to decisions that cause deep debt.
Poorly treated, unhappy assistants = high turnover and unhappy clients.
A sustainable, profitable model needs to enter the market.

We Need Your Help

Merakii is currently in the fundraising stage - We have an incredible, but expensive vision.

While waiting for the 'big' funding, we could be preparing the smaller details (website launch, partnerships, tool subscriptions, client sign-ups, etc.) - But, we need a pad of funding to get that started.
Anything you can put toward Merakii would help tremendously, even $1.

The Impact

There are currently over 400 assistants that suffered from a recent, massive, unexpected layoff made by a company that sunk into debt. Those assistants' thousands of clients have just lost their help.
Merakii knows exactly why that company went into debt and the CEO tried helping the previous company heal itself - But, was turned away.
Merakii is the result - We will do things right.

I'm raising money to get my mercury amalgam fillings removed, and replaced with safer composite materials. After years of various health problems and generally declining health, I have had no answers from any doctors as to the cause of them. I suffer from many chronic disorders including Tinnitus, TJMD, chronic headaches, skin lesions, fatigue, insomnia, depression, brain fog, muscle pain and several other problems. Over the years that I've had my fillings my mouth has gotten more and more of a metallic taste, and general bad breath. I'm often too sick to work, which in turn has lead to financial problems. it seems like a terrible snowball affect, my health affects my ability to work which in turn affects my ability to save money to better my health.

Here is a documentary done about the dangers of mercury amalgam fillings and why they've been banned in many counrties.
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

It wasn't until recently that I became aware that many of my symptoms could be linked to mercury toxicity from dental amalgams. I currently have 12 mercury amalgam fillings! Although there is much controversy over this topic, many countries have already banned the use of mercury amalgam fillings. I feel like this is the last thing I can do to try to regain my health. I have started to eat healthier which has helped a little, but the real goal I have is to get the toxic mercury out of my head and body. Unfortunately I don't have dental insurance and dental work is extremely expensive for the type of work I need done. I also will be going through a detox system which is rather expensive.

Many people who have had their mercury amalgam fillings removed have seen their chronic illnesses disappear. This is a last resort for me, I really wish I could afford the procedures so that I didn't have to bother anyone with this. I really appreciate any and all donations and even if you can't spare any money I thank you for your support and shares!   

I wish you all the best in your personal journeys to health.

Bring a Great Coffee Roastery to Watsonville

Our mobile coffee business has grown steadily over the past 3 years, and recently we have been looking around for ways to expand. We have found a great location, but the opportunity could be missed if we don't jump quickly!
270 Hanger Way is perfect for our needs in many ways:
Plenty of space: 2700 square feet, divided into a very clean and well lit front showroom (future cafe), plus a large warehouse bay in back.
Lots of potential local customers:  16,000 people work within 1 mile. Foxx Racing Shox, Fedex, and the Watsonville Hospital are all right around the corner.
Easy access from Highway 1: Folks driving between Santa Cruz and Monterey can reach us within 3 minutes of exiting the highway.
Central location: It is is central to the farmer's markets we currently do, which will make it easier for us to prep and load up for markets.

Brand new building: And it is already fully occupied, except this space. Ample parking, clean well lit spaces and entryway, and a good looking building. Not a sketchy warehouse area! Customers will feel comfortable coming here whether they just drove 50 miles our walked in from across the street.
<div>We need to raise money quickly for the lease down payment, permit and to start the design &amp
In addition to the main uses described above, we are filled with ideas for things we can do with a space like this:
• Teaching coffee roasting classes and doing coffee tours/tastings.
• Renting the use of our coffee roasting facility to other craft roasters once built.
• Partnering with local food artisans to do pop-up lunch events weekly or even daily.
• Art openings? Beer and/or wine nights? Commercial kitchen space? There are so many possibilities!

Thanks to supporters of our first Indiegogo campaign about 20 months ago, our Solar Powered Farmer's Market Coffee bar has been very successful. We have gone from just barely breaking even last year to running at a healthy profit this year. I, Amelia Loftus, the owner-operator, have fully supported myself financially with this business for over a year now! We are at 4 different farmer's markets every week. Check out our schedule here.
However, I have nearly reached capacity of what I &
column2: my little 2 pound coffee roaster can handle. I am roasting 6-20 batches a day plus doing 4-5 farmer's markets a week plus a weekly delivery day. This equates to working 80 hour weeks!

column1: To grow I'll need some help. My goal is to open a cafe first to bring in extra revenue and create a few jobs (Barista &
column2: Farmer's Market Manager) so I have skilled help for daily operations. Once this is running smoothly we'll install a larger coffee roaster to speed up production and expand our ability to serve wholesale customers.

column1: Building a Roastery and Cafe is no small project. To make it more attainable, I am planning the project in 3 phases:
Phase 1 by October 1st: Secure space lease, apply for needed permits, and plan the cafe. Cash needed: $10,000. We hope to raise most of this through this Indiegogo campaign &
column2: small private loans from friends and family. If we exceed this goal the additional funds will go towards phase 2.

column1: Phase 2 by January 2016: Get financing to build the cafe and build it. Cash needed: Approximately $35,000. Funding through crowd funding, small loans, and equipment financing.
Phase 3 by April 2016: Get financing to buy the roaster and install it. Cash needed: $100,000. Funding through equipment financing, crowd funding, and business loan.
We do not want something for nothing. However you choose to help, we want to give you full value in return for your investment towards building our dream!

Support our Indiegogo campaign: This is very easy! Choose an amount you are comfortable with and the perk you like. The bonus for us: these contributions count as sales, which will contribute towards a profitable year in 2015. Banks and equipment financiers will like this.

Buy coffee from us: we roast fresh batches to order. Extra orders will help us reach our goal too! You can order online from the Coffee page of our website or you can subscribe to regular coffee deliveries from our Coffee subscription page. Many of the perks for this campaign give you coffee, but ordering direct is a better deal for you.

Consider making a small loan to us: we'll write a simple loan agreement with you for amounts as small as $250. We'll pay you back in the time we agree upon (6 to 24 months) plus simple, non-compounding interest: 1% per month, or 12% per year. If you are interested in doing this, please contact me by Email
Contributions of professional services will help us too! To build a coffee bar and roastery, and to build a brand, we could use:
If you are able to contribute services in exchange for product, free trips to the coffee bar, or future repayment please get in touch!

First and foremost, you will be an amazing part of this exciting project, to bring 3rd wave craft coffee culture to North Watsonville. A coffee bar here will serve people who work here, commuters between Monterey and Santa Cruz, and visitors who meet us at the markets and festivals we do in the area. Our coffee is organic, small farm sourced, lovingly roasted in small batches, and served with real joy :)

Check out our perks, most of which get you some of our amazing coffee. We also plan to print up some stickers of our solar powered farm fresh coffee logo, and every perk will include one of these great stickers. Display it proudly and you will help us build our brand!

column2: >How We Want to Make a Difference

column1: Your support of our project really does directly support small scale farming. Most directly, our own small poultry and fruit tree farm just south of Watsonville. On it's own our farm is not yet profitable but coffee sales for the past few years have made it possible to keep it going.

All our coffee purchases are made as conscientiously as possible: we only buy excellent coffees grown by small scale organic farmers. We want our coffee dollars to support family based, small scale ecologically conscious farming as much as possible. We plan to highlight this in our Watsonville coffee bar. We want to show our own farming community that we support small scale farming everywhere, and it is part of our mission to give back, however we can!
First, we have to build it. I have the experience and the confidence to know we can succeed.

Before I started this small farm based coffee business in early 2012, I spent 15 years at the helm of a homebrew supply business, Seven Bridges Cooperative, in Santa Cruz California. I was an original founding Member and served as the General Manager and Board President until I departed in 2011. I also cut my teeth on coffee roasting at Seven Bridges. I set up and developed the home coffee roasting section of the business. The business is still thriving today. Visit the Seven Bridges Website to learn more about this business.

I have applied this extensive business experience for the past 3 years to building our coffee business which now provides all of my income. By building the coffee bar and roastery, we'll be able to grow the business enough to make it a true family business that can support both myself, my husband Patrick, and a small staff in the years to come.

There are always risks! We have been planning to start down the path of expansion, but were not sure we were ready. This year is the first profitable year we have had on the books, and it is not over yet so we do not have tax returns that show profitability yet. This makes it difficult to qualify for traditional bank financing, even though we are homeowners and have excellent credit ratings.

On the other hand, we have sustained consistent growth of 50% over last year without really adding new sales outlets except a couple of new wholesale accounts. Because of the limited capacity of our coffee roaster, we have just about maxed out what we can handle, and have put seeking out new wholesale accounts on hold.

People love our coffee and keep coming back for more. And telling their friends! It's growing organically. We have been working hard to do our best to make sure every customer is happy with our coffee drinks and roasted coffee, and building it slowly.

column5: >However, this commercial space presents an opportunity we cannot ignore, and to take advantage of the opportunity, we have to jump at the chance. It is the last space in this building, and every instinct I have screams ""THIS IS IT!""

>I know it is a big leap and the next 6 months will provide many challenges. The biggest challenges are financial. But I am confident that if we make the first hurdle, and raise the $10k needed to secure our location, the rest will happen. The ball will be rolling, and I am ready for the ride!

>

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have much time or money, your support really means a lot to me. Your moral support will help sustain us through the challenges ahead. Also you can:

  • Please help get the word out! Share on Facebook, tell your friends, buy a coffee at one of the Farmer's markets.
  • It's easy to share my campaign, just use the Indiegogo share tools.

column1: • If this project inspires you and you have ideas, please share them with us!

More than a year and a half have passed since Resign
launched its first fundraising campaign. Successively gathered more than
$6000usd, invested in getting some tools and material, renting out a workplace,
to try and experiment upcycling waste, turning it into useful products…then the results were amazing.
The products were unique and satisfying, and more people
started to trust Resign's work. We went into making decorations, furniture,
participated in many exhibitions, and conducting several training sessions and
workshops, involving more people in this great project which wouldn’t have came
to life without the trust given from people to me as a person, Ala Hilu.
After 3 years of working on developing new ways to treat
waste, creating many useful things out of different kinds of waste, observing
the process of creation, and understanding the relation between what is possible
and what is available as in machinery, human capacity and waste (raw material),
I have reached several conclusions that can make Resign a better place with
better service and better products, in addition, With a wider vision to spread upcycling
faster and make it more accessible for people. This needs your support again…
We need to get specialized Tools and machinery that would
get the place to be more tidy, more organized and more professional . Its true we have done so much with the basic
tools we have, but having more professional and powerful tools, with a new
variety of tools, Resign would be able to get into another level of perfection and easy production. Most of

Better machines mean better quality products, less time and
effort in preparation  and less waste of
material…. For example, 2 machines of what we aiming for, can prepare and render pallet
wood with less effort, less mess, less time and less waste, in addition, it can be way safer to use these machines by
beginners than our current technique with circular angle grinder!
There are machines that have multiple purposes and can be
used in treating different kinds of waste
Building a more professional training space, with tables and
tools with easy access for 6 trainees at a time, will make it possible for
Resign to host trainings and recruit more people who would like to develop
their upcycling skills, especially when the machines are safe to use…most of
our work depend on angle grinders, but it is not safe to give it to beginners

to work with.

There are machines that won’t be dangerous when
given to beginners after showing them how they work.!
Opening a shop where people can come look at the products in
a tidy, clean and  nice set-up. Spending some time to understand the

variety of products that can come from upcycling. Buying from the shop to support Resign's sustainability, and give a chance for projects we want to support, and invest in.

The shop, will give us more understanding of the possibilities for a responsible business to exist. Tracking income and outcome is one of the main keys for a business to succeed.

","More than a year and a half have passed since Resign
launched its first fundraising campaign. Successively gathered more than
$6000usd, invested in getting some tools and material, renting out a workplace,
to try and experiment upcycling waste, turning it into useful products…then the results were amazing.
The products were unique and satisfying, and more people
started to trust Resign's work. We went into making decorations, furniture,
participated in many exhibitions, and conducting several training sessions and
workshops, involving more people in this great project which wouldn’t have came
to life without the trust given from people to me as a person, Ala Hilu.
After 3 years of working on developing new ways to treat
waste, creating many useful things out of different kinds of waste, observing
the process of creation, and understanding the relation between what is possible
and what is available as in machinery, human capacity and waste (raw material),
I have reached several conclusions that can make Resign a better place with
better service and better products, in addition, With a wider vision to spread upcycling
faster and make it more accessible for people. This needs your support again…
