column5: >In December 2015 I will be going to Uganda for 6 weeks to volunteer in the small town Jinja, 80km northeast of the capital Kampala.

column2: >I will spend my time working between the local hospital, medical clinics, orphanage and the Discovery Centre run by the charity Youth With A Mission.
>My goal is to use my experience and skills in health care, along with my love for children and compassion for those in need to contribute to the well being of this community.
>""Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then I said, here am I! Send me""

column3: >Although I have worked hard to self-fund my entire trip, I need money to significantly contribute to the well being of the people of Jinja.

column2: >The aim is to raise $10,000
>This may sound like a large sum, so lets break it down...

column1: $4,000 will build a small house for a widow and her children, who are currently homeless with no safe shelter
• The remaining $6,000 will be distributed in the following ways to improve the wellbeing of the community:
• $2,000 to provide needed medical supplies /equipment for the local hospital
• $2,000 for food relief to the community
• $2,000 to improve the orphanage, provide the children with clothes/footwear and to run a Christmas event

• Closer to my departure date and once I arrive in Uganda I will be keeping a regular and updated blog to detail how each and every dollar is spent $$$ so that YOU will know the direct impact your donation has had.
• Please understand that 4% of your donation goes to Indiegogo as this was the cheapest crowd funding website I could find.

As I am going for christmas and new years I will be planning christmas activities and presents for the local children at Care for Kids Orphanage which funds will also support to make happen. More details to come soon :)

column2:
>The Impact

EVERY child, EVERY human being deserves the right to BASIC HUMAN NEEDS, such as a safe shelter to call home, safe clean drinking water, health care, education and protection.
>Your donations will help to provide these basic human rights to the people of Jinja.

>My trip to Uganda is so valuable to both the community of Jinja and myself. I believe that in offering my skills, labour, time and love to the people of Jinja I will also receive love, friendship and an incredible life experience in return.

>I would like to mention that my trip is supported by my local church, the wonderful Reaching the Nations Christian Church and their long running charity Lost N Found, an Australian non-profit charitable aid and development agency with the purpose of helping vulnerable and helpless children, and restoring broken families.

>Lost N Found has been on many sucsessful missionary trips to Uganda and South America over the last 9 years, and also work in partnership with International Support Aid and Care For Kids Orphanage. I am very excited to represent both Reaching the Nations Christian Church and Lost N Fond through my mission.
>ALL donations will be very greatly appreciated. Please spread the word about my cause to all of your family and friends!
>I will be keeping regular updates on my trip from now until I depart and return from Africa through my Facebook page and my blog (to be posted soon)

>A Massive THANKYOU to everyone who has taken the time to read this, to everyone who donates, to my loving family and Reaching The Nations Christian Church for all of your support. God Bless you all xx

column1: In December 2015 I will be going to Uganda for 6 weeks to volunteer in the small town Jinja, 80km northeast of the capital Kampala.
I will spend my time working between the local hospital, medical clinics, orphanage and the Discovery Centre run by the charity Youth With A Mission.
My goal is to use my experience and skills in health care, along with my love for children and compassion for those in need to contribute to the well being of this community.
Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then I said, here am I! Send me""               -Isaiah 6:8
Although I have worked hard to self-fund my entire trip, I need money to significantly contribute to the well being of the people of Jinja.
This may sound like a large sum, so lets break it down...
$4,000 will build a small house for a widow and her children, who are currently homeless with no safe shelter
The remaining $6,000 will be distributed in the following ways to improve the wellbeing of the community:
$2,000 to provide needed medical supplies /equipment for the local hospital
$2,000 for food relief to the community
$2,000 to improve the orphanage, provide the children with clothes/footwear and to run a Christmas event

Closer to my departure date and once I arrive in Uganda I will be keeping a regular and updated blog to detail how each and every dollar is spent $$$ so that YOU will know the direct impact your donation has had.
Please understand that 4% of your donation goes to Indiegogo as this was the cheapest crowd funding website I could find.

As I am going for christmas and new years I will be planning christmas activities and presents for the local children at Care for Kids Orphanage which funds will also support to make happen. More details to come soon :)
The Impact EVERY child, EVERY human being deserves the right to BASIC HUMAN NEEDS, such as a safe shelter to call home, safe clean drinking water, health care, education and protection.
Your donations will help to provide these basic human rights to the people of Jinja.

My trip to Uganda is so valuable to both the community of Jinja and myself. I believe that in offering my skills, labour, time and love to the people of Jinja I will also receive love, friendship and an incredible life experience in return.

I would like to mention that my trip is supported by my local church, the wonderful Reaching the Nations Christian Church and their long running charity Lost N Found, an Australian non-profit charitable aid and development agency with the purpose of helping vulnerable and helpless children, and restoring broken families.

Lost N Found has been on many sucsessful missionary trips to Uganda and South America over the last 9 years, and also work in partnership with International Support Aid and Care For Kids Orphanage. I am very excited to represent both Reaching the Nations Christian Church and Lost N Fond through my mission.
ALL donations will be very greatly appreciated. Please spread the word about my cause to all of your family and friends!
I will be keeping regular updates on my trip from now until I depart and return from Africa through my Facebook page and my blog (to be posted soon)

A Massive THANKYOU to everyone who has taken the time to read this, to everyone who donates, to my loving family and Reaching The Nations Christian Church for all of your support. God Bless you all xx",4.0,1,"1 Campaign

My name is Eric (the flash) and my business partner is Robert(batman).  With our team of experienced athletes and entertainers we hope to start a revolutionary pedicab company.The name of our company is called ruE pedicabs and together we have a dream, a mission, and a goal.
Our dream is to change the world one smile at a time.

column5: > Our mission is to encourage the development of individual creativity within the work environment.

column1: Our goal is to spread imagination and Entertainment to the world while continuously providing the Experience of a lifetime.

Are You Ready for the greatest show on three wheels!

Why a ruE pedicab?

We believe that our pedicab company will be the most unique pedicab company in existence. Our purpose is to entertain our customers and transport them through St. Louis. Imagine walking out of the ball game and right in front of you is captain hook asking you to be a member of his crew. You decide to hop in and give it a try, its not every day you get to travel through the city with a famous pirate captain.  You are singing pirate songs with the captain and before you know it  you have arrived at your destination with a smile on your face and a story to tell. This is but one scenario of thousands you could experience when riding in a ruE pedicab.

Epilogue

Our tale began as two friends who met years ago  working together at a restaurant. One night many years later, Eric,with his degree in theatre, looked at Robert, with his degrees in business and math, and said, ""I want to change the face of theatre and the world by putting on a show for millions, two audience members at a time.""  We want to create the first field for amateur actors to harness their craft and actually profit from it.

With your help
We need about $60,000 to purchase 12 pedicabs from
column5: >coasterpedicab
column9:
/>


 Any amount of money we raise will go directly towards purchasing pedicabs.  Even if we can only purchase some of the cabs we'll be able to buy the rest after a few months.

Bonus round

column1: Be a member of exclusive clubs. The perks of these clubs range from limited edition rue swag,  lifetime free rides, and unique one of a kind art work such as this.
column5: >By becoming characters and entertaining the city, the greatest show on three wheels was born. Your contribution will allow us to bring joy, laughter and knowledge to the streets of St.Louis and eventually the world.
column9: > We will bring it to life and allow it to flourish.

column1:
Our biggest obstacle will be our largest competitor.  This large pedicab corporation sends their worst cabs to St. Louis and operates out of a storage unit every year.  They have a shoe string budget and shady business practices. Our brand new cabs combined with our dream to entertain will allow us to explode onto the scene and instantly become first choice.  We will expel our competition from the streets of our fair city. We're the little guy with big dreams and even bigger hearts. Because there are no full time pedicab companies in St. Louis, the next biggest challenge is to establish them as a primary means of transportation for the city. We believe with our combined experience in business, performing, pedicabbing, and networking we will be able to establish ourselves and create something amazing in our city.

""We are the music makers, we are the dreamers of dreams.""

                                                            --Willy Wonka

As a group, American Christians have done major damage to our
ability to relay the Gospel to America. As James Emery White put it in his
book Rise of the Nones, ""We've acted in ways, talked in ways
and lived in ways that have stolen from God's reputation.""
Walls of unbelief are being built up
at rapid paces that we, as the church, currently aren't quite good at crossing.
Shattered Magazine's goal is to help break
down barriers to belief in God, barriers to good relationships with Christ and other people, and many more barriers  through the power of story.
When we let down our white picket
fences and start sharing the real stories of where God met us and how He has
impacted our lives, then others can begin to relate to Him as well in powerful ways.
Our hope is that people who don't
believe, those who see the church and subsequently Jesus negatively, and those who might believe but are struggling in their faith will begin
to see Jesus as for them.
It's about time we get real with
each other. It's about time we start being Jesus to people and quit condemning
them in light of the forgiveness extended to us. It's about time we stop making
Christianity about how perfect we think we are or how perfect we think we
should be and make it about the perfect Savior we serve.
Our stories are one way we can do
the blood of the Lamb and by their testimony. And they did not love their lives
so much that they were afraid to die."" (Rev. 12:11)

Rebecca Sterner, a widely recognized magazine consultant, spoke with me over a year ago.

After I had told her that we raised $7,000 to print our first issue on Kickstarter, she proceeded to explain how it should be done to properly launch a magazine. I wonder if maybe she laughed quietly to herself at our naivety...

Her words still echo in my ears, ""you will need 100,000 subscribers to make it nationally and you'll need 1.5 million dollars to make that happen.""

WHAT?! Yikes.

Well, with a whole host of accomplishments behind us, including nationwide distribution in Barnes and Noble, Books a Million and other boutique stores
column2: a subscriber growth rate of about 400%
column3:
and a growing interest in what we're doing from the church, we're thinking that God's pretty awesome to keep us around. :)

That being said, she is right about something. We need money to market our magazine.

column1: We believe that if we can raise $300,000, we will be well on our way to reaching that 100,000 subscriber mark - at 1/5 the cost she said it would be.
Your money will allow us to reach a

sustainable level of operations and production by the end of this year because of the subscription revenue that can be generated through marketing.

Our Marketing Plan - Where Your Money Will Go

We plan on using a variety of methods to market including:

- key event promotions / partnerships

- religious and non-religious website advertisements for most highly trafficked websites.

- Google Ads, You Tube, Social Media Marketing

- relationships with non-profit ministries

- building on our website traffic (already at 145,000 / month) to convert to subscribers // telling more stories

- tv / radio ad spots in key regional growth cities (Birmingham, Nashville, Atlanta, Memphis, etc...)
thing skeptics and the un-churched of the millennial generation said would make them highly more

likely to come to church?

A: It is if they knew that the church had older people who were

willing to share their stories and offer wisdom. 

(Based on ""Churchless: Understanding Today's Unchurched

and How to Connect with Them"" by George Barna and David Kinnaman)

We want to be a tool for the church - something that can help get people in the doors and something that can be used to help us understand what it means to have a relationship with Christ and how that transforms our perspective on everything.

We could keep telling the stories of a few individuals to an audience of a few thousand. But we believe God is up to something bigger in the world. We believe there are thousands of stories of God's glory that go untold every year. And we believe there are millions of Christians (247 million in America alone) who need to hear those stories. Would you help us get there?

You can be a part of this movement, and that could be your reward alone! :) But we'd still like the chance to say thank you!! So, be sure to check out the ""Perks"" section for your partnership level and your reward!
With any BIG idea come risks and
challenges. So what stands in the way of Shattered fulfilling this mission to
break down the walls of unbelief through the power of story?
takes time and a team to share these stories across multiple platforms. Shattered
has a team who believes so strongly in this mission that they have given of
their time for lower than value or in many cases, free. This has been our
greatest limiting factor. What if these individuals were freed up to tell these
stories full-time? We could get to 100,000 subscribers faster.
If you don't have any money to
spare, you have friends and family who might care about this campaign.
• Use the Indiegogo share tools as well.
• Send this link in an email to your friends.

• Tell your church about this up-and-coming resource.

willing to share their stories and offer wisdom. (Based on ""Churchless: Understanding Today's Unchurched

and How to Connect with Them"" by George Barna and David Kinnaman)We want to be a tool for the church - something that can help get people in the doors and something that can be used to help us understand what it means to have a relationship with Christ and how that transforms our perspective on everything.We could keep telling the stories of a few individuals to an audience of a few thousand. But we believe God is up to something bigger in the world. We believe there are thousands of stories of God's glory that go untold every year. And we believe there are millions of Christians (247 million in America alone) who need to hear those stories. Would you help us get there?You can be a part of this movement, and that could be your reward alone! :) But we'd still like the chance to say thank you!! So, be sure to check out the ""Perks"" section for your partnership level and your reward!
With any BIG idea come risks and
challenges. So what stands in the way of Shattered fulfilling this mission to
break down the walls of unbelief through the power of story?
The great challenge is money. It
takes time and a team to share these stories across multiple platforms. Shattered
has a team who believes so strongly in this mission that they have given of
their time for lower than value or in many cases, free. This has been our
greatest limiting factor. What if these individuals were freed up to tell these
stories full-time? We could get to 100,000 subscribers faster.
If you don't have any money to
spare, you have friends and family who might care about this campaign.
Share on social media and tag @shatteredMag
Use the Indiegogo share tools as well.
Send this link in an email to your friends.
Take your loved ones out for coffee and tell them about
Tell your church about this up-and-coming resource.
And that's all there is to it. Easy.

Wordique's Story

My father once told me to never stop dreaming or working towards that dream, and I remember these words as if he told me them yesterday. Often, I have to stop and remember them when things get tough or aren't working out. My father was a strong, logical, and intelligent man. He taught me a lot in the short time that I got to spend with him. When I was eleven, my father died of lymphatic leukemia but his advice still lives on inside me.

I'm sharing this personal story because it's the driving force behind Wordique. My ultimate goal is to help others work toward their dreams and help remind them every day to never stop dreaming. This is what keeps me going each day, even though at times it feels like I'm fighting an uphill battle. Also, the Wordique team shares my vision, values, and goals. It's great to work with like-minded people towards the same outcome.

Why is Wordique different?

Wordique is a custom built site designed for writing projects and editing services. It's a safe and secure platform, where we hold the funds till the final draft is complete. We help recommend writers or editors to new clients based on their needs, and we also never deduct a commission. Yes, you heard me right, our site is 100% commission free! Additionally, we'll never limit a writer to certain projects based on their experience. Wordique was primarily designed for new or inexperienced writers (even though all writers are welcome to sign up.) We're always there to offer career advice and encouragement. We'll help writers with their resumes, portfolios, and offer advice on their next step.

These are the key elements that allow us to stand out from all the other networking sites. We are NOT a content mill, and we actually care about all our clients. This isn't just a business, it's our PASSION! We realize behind every profile is a story and a dream.

We need your help!

Now that the site is up and running we need help with our marketing expenses. It's crucial that we earn enough funds my mid-May to be able to afford the marketing services so Wordique can be visible.  All of the funds we earn will go towards our marketing efforts. We have already mapped out the necessary services and expenses, and that's where we came up with the amount needed.

A detailed list of expenses is available upon request.

Where are we going?

My vision for Wordique is that it'll soon have a full database of writers and people seeking writing services.  In the future, we have plans to incorporate more creative networking services for filmmakers, graphic design artists, and other creative freelance professionals. However, we have to start out small and master only one thing at a time.

I'm confident Wordique will help writers get writing credits and build their resumes. This will allow them to move on to bigger and better things like writing for professional blogs, magazines, or newspapers. Maybe they'll even be able to land an agent because of the work they did on my site. :)  That would be AWESOME!

Other ways you can help

Every penny helps to spread the word, but if you are unable to give we understand. Please help by spreading the word by sharing this campaign with your friends and family.

You can also share our website or Twitter.

Additionally, if you know any writers that need work or companies that need affordable content send them our way!

Thanks for visiting! We appreciate the support!

Caregiver Alliance (FCA) is a public voice for caregivers. Our pioneering
programs support and sustain the important work of families nationwide caring
for loved ones with chronic, disabling health conditions. Founded in 1977, FCA
was the first community based non-profit organization in the United States to
address the needs of families and friends providing long-term care at home.
Established in San Francisco, FCA was created to provide services to caregivers
who care for loved ones with cognitive impairments and diseases. FCA offers
programs at local, state, and national levels to support caregivers.
look at our website -- www.caregiver.org

needed way that will have a powerful and positive impact on many lives.

Aloha, I'm Duke Aiona, President and CEO of Hawai'i Family Advocates. Our mission is to advance our core values through education, lobbying, and electioneering.  Our world is changing rapidly, and I see a vision of Hawai’i where families are strong, all human life is valued, and religious liberty flourishes.  With your help, and my dedication to spreading the word, I know this can be possible!
OUR CORE VALUES ARE FAMILY, FAITH, &
In my case, I've been married for
34 years to Vivian Welsh Aiona. We have
four amazing kids and three beautiful grandchildren.  Hawai'i Family Advocates supports the marriage between one man and one woman, and traditional family values.
We have been worshiping at Resurrection of the Lord
Catholic Church since 1983 and are involved in several church ministries.  We support religious liberty.
We invite your support on this journey of bringing it all back to the core values of Family, Faith and Freedom.
At the age of 35, I became a Family Court Judge of the first
After retiring in 1999, I was elected to serve as the
Lieutenant Governor of the State of Hawai'i in 2002, proudly serving two full terms until 2010.
Serving my community in these various positions has
allowed me to see a glimpse of the future most people have not seen, I have
seen the corruption of our government and the downfall of family values.
Now, as President and CEO of Hawai'i Family Advocates I am on
a Mission to change all that!
Currently, there is an imbalance in state government.  Our major media outlets in the press and television are tilted towards the
“new age” and liberal views.  We will be
that voice in the dark - the <b>voice that
will speak on behalf of those who have no voice, the child in a mother’s womb,
those at life’s end, and for developing and strengthening families, <b>where
marriage is celebrated as the core ingredient, as a priority.
Our Mission is to create a legacy organization that will be
the voice for today’s and tomorrow’s generation. It will be the resource for those who share
the beliefs and values of the sanctity of life and institution of
marriage. It will empower our electorate
and community at large with the knowledge, skills, and structure to deliver our
message and correct the imbalance in our media, state and federal
WE WILL DO THIS BY...having a strong presence in state and
local government through lobbying, presenting testimony, facilitating public
support through rallies and gatherings, and by providing education on
legislation and policy that will affect our core values of family, faith and
THIS A REALITY WE NEED TO ACHIEVE OUR GOAL OF $50,000
Throughout most of my professional career, I have been asked
on many occasions as to what I thought was the best way to address and <b>solve
many of our social problems. Whether it
was drug and alcohol abuse, teen pregnancy, juvenile delinquency, and/or

column2: simply put there are no magic bullets to our social ills.

column1: However, there is no question based upon my experience as a family and circuit court
judge, lieutenant governor, father, grandfather, coach, and teacher that the
family unit is the key ingredient to building a person with the character,
integrity, and knowledge to be a law abiding and productive member in our
be there to provide the support and help that a person will need when they are
at their darkest and most challenging moments.
A person with <b>a strong family unit will always know that he/she is not
alone and that they can always count on their family.
Accordingly, for me I have been blessed with the opportunity
to serve in positions where I am able to promote, influence, or develop
programs or policy that strengthen the family.
Hawai'i Family Advocates is another opportunity for me to
We are an organization whose vision is to create a world
where families are strong, all human life is valued, and religious liberty
flourishes.  This vision will be achieved
by advancing our core values of family, faith, and freedom through lobbying,
having a strong presence in state government through lobbying, presenting
testimony, facilitating public support through rallies and gatherings, and by
providing education on legislation and policy that will affect our core values

WHAT YOU CAN HELP CREATE  

HFA will be that
organization for the believers of faith, principles, and values who <b>treasure
the sanctity of life in the beginning and end of its cycle, the institution of

structure that will be a credible voice in state government. HFA will empower its members on the issues of
today and with the knowledge and ability to articulate and advance its

By funding this project, you will create a world where
families are strong, all human life is valued and religious liberty flourishes.

• Whether it is an INDIVIDUAL looking to resolve personal areas of concern, a Family seeking help with today's PARENTING issues, or BUSINESSES looking for FUN, INNOVATIVE avenues for LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT or TEAM BUILDING Retreats ... horses help strengthen the relationships that matter most!

What:

  • We have the horses, we have the arenas... however, we still need start-up expenses including a truck, a trailer, and extended liability insurance. 
  • With your generous donation, you can decide if you would like customized parenting tips or personalized EQUINE sessions for your family or business. Also, 10% of all donations will go toward local scholarships for Families in our Community who are in need of Counseling services.
  • Any funds received for this campaign will go directly into Business Capital for Core Connections of MT.

Why:

  • Our ""WHY"" is that our Country NEEDS new methods for dealing with some of our biggest struggles:  LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT is necessary for creating authentic, transparent leaders who will guide tomorrow's market.  Many FAMILIES are in need of guidance for raising our children in today's complex world, and as INDIVIDUALS... we ALL need help once in a while with the things that sometimes trip us up.  At any given time, 20% of Americans struggle with a mental health issue, and we need innovative ways for dealing with the challenges we sometimes face in life.

•  Equine Assisted Businesses face huge obstacles.  The expenses of horses, facilities, and equipment are overwhelming!  Moreover, the creation of a sustainable program with a Collaborative Team makes it is easy to see why many Equine businesses never get past the dream phase.

• Our Team of Highly Professional, Highly Qualified, and Experienced Individuals have created a strong foundation that knows SUCESS!!!  We currently have two Licensed Clinical Counselors, a Licensed School Counselor, and two EAGALA certified Equine Specialists. It has taken three years to develop our business plan, develop our CORE Team, and create a Movement that has hopes of changing how our world views mental health and Leadership Development.

• Every dollar helps send the message that Americans are strong agents of change... we have the knowledge to resolve our own struggles, and we can effectively create opportunities for success when we are partnered with the right companions.

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Share the message... even if you can't donate, please spread the word so that we may connect with others who are looking to create new solutions for the Relationships that matter most!
  • Please share the Indiegogo mission!


","Who:

Whether it is an INDIVIDUAL looking to resolve personal areas of concern, a Family seeking help with today's PARENTING issues, or BUSINESSES looking for FUN, INNOVATIVE avenues for LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT or TEAM BUILDING Retreats ... horses help strengthen the relationships that matter most!

What:  We have the horses, we have the arenas... however, we still need start-up expenses including a truck, a trailer, and extended liability insurance.  With your generous donation, you can decide if you would like customized parenting tips or personalized EQUINE sessions for your family or business. Also, 10% of all donations will go toward local scholarships for Families in our Community who are in need of Counseling services. Any funds received for this campaign will go directly into Business Capital for Core Connections of MT.

Why:  Our ""WHY"" is that our Country NEEDS new methods for dealing with some of our biggest struggles:  LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT is necessary for creating authentic, transparent leaders who will guide tomorrow's market.  Many FAMILIES are in need of guidance for raising our children in today's complex world, and as INDIVIDUALS... we ALL need help once in a while with the things that sometimes trip us up.  At any given time, 20% of Americans struggle with a mental health issue, and we need innovative ways for dealing with the challenges we sometimes face in life.

Equine Assisted Businesses face huge obstacles.  The expenses of horses, facilities, and equipment are overwhelming!  Moreover, the creation of a sustainable program with a Collaborative Team makes it is easy to see why many Equine businesses never get past the dream phase.

Our Team of Highly Professional, Highly Qualified, and Experienced Individuals have created a strong foundation that knows SUCESS!!!  We currently have two Licensed Clinical Counselors, a Licensed School Counselor, and two EAGALA certified Equine Specialists. It has taken three years to develop our business plan, develop our CORE Team, and create a Movement that has hopes of changing how our world views mental health and Leadership Development.

Every dollar helps send the message that Americans are strong agents of change... we have the knowledge to resolve our own struggles, and we can effectively create opportunities for success when we are partnered with the right companions.

Other Ways You Can Help:  Share the message... even if you can't donate, please spread the word so that we may connect with others who are looking to create new solutions for the Relationships that matter most! Please share the Indiegogo mission!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
